review: Rocket League??? OK. So yes. It is a pretty great game Buys the game. Wanders what to do. Versus Unfair Bots. Gets wrecked. Versus All Star Bots. Gets wrecked. Versus Pro bots. Gets Wrecked. Versus Rookie bots. ................... Gets wrecked. Thinks for a moment. Versus no bots. Finaly wins 3 0. Celebrates. Thinks he's good enough for a casual match online. Loses 15 0. Breaks his computer's screen.2 Months Later... Plays Rocket League again. Does a bunch of training sessions. Continues training sessions for a year so he doesn't break another computer screen. Thinks he's decent. Versus Rookie bots. Yay! No computer screens broken. Wins 5 0! Versus Pro bots. Surprisingly wins 4 2! Thinks that he's good. Versus All Star bots. Wins 2 1! Does not want to try vsing Unfair bots as another computer screen might get broken. Does it anyway. Gets absolutely annihilated 10 1. Computer gets thrown off a balcony. 1 Month Later... Gets another more durable computer. Does an online casual match. Yes! Wins 4 1! Thinks he's good. Does a competitive match 1v1. Wow! Wins 3 2! Doesn't break computer...........yet. Plays the game and does'nt break the computer. Gets addicted. Wants to spend money. Buys a $50 steam card. Buys in game keys. Opens first CC3 case! Lands in between 2 MYSTERY UNIVERSAL DECALs. Gets a hammer. Breaks screen.2 Weeks Later... Buys a new laptop. Promises himself that he won't break it this time. Plays a few games. Opens another CC3 crate. BOOM! Gets the imported rare car Breakout Type S! Plays with it. Looks sick. Thinks he's like the best Rocket League player in the world. 1v1's a friend. Bets that if he wins he gets his Mystery Universal decal (Heatwave). Also bets that if he loses he gives him whole inventory to his friend. Friend accepts the challenge. Friend wins 69 0. Afer giving his whole inventory. Burns his laptop down with Magnesium. Ends up burning his house down. THE END Great Game! Solid 10/10 would do it again! xD

review: Rocket league IS a good game no doubt.At it's best it's a fun fast paced competitive multiplayer experience.At it's worst it's the game of who can get spewed the most insults at from your because you missed a save....which they were responsible for. Although there are plenty of nice encouraging people in Rocket League the cancerous community can be overwhelming at times which would be less overwhelming if the report function would be more responsive. As an example of the toxicity of some of the players just the last match I was playing a 2v2 competitive game at Silver III level. The opposition were the same skill level as eachother however one of them kept on hurling F Bomb's and the typical "you're a boosted ". The person of which these insults were thrown at wasn't having the best match but still not making stupid mistakes. Some matches if you're down by a few points and there's one minute left and your teammate votes to forfeit but you don't they'll start playing with the other team scoring own goals and blocking your shots. Frustrating.Apart from the community the game while flawed at a few points is a surprisingly fun experience. Who would've thought that playing football/soccer with RC cars would be so fun?The graphics are flashy and fun. There are plenty of cool lighting effects. They aren't too distracting (provided you've turned motion blur and weather effects off) for a multiplayer competitive game and they set a good tone.The gameplay itself doesn't get stale and is essentially flawless. Easy to learn hard to master. That kind of stuff. Impressive moves are extremely satisfying to pull off.The soundtrack is nothing short of a masterpiece for ears fine tuned to EDM. Although most of the tracks are not songs which you would've heard before they're still fantastic. In a *fairly* recent update they've added a song from the soundtrack to be played once a goal is scored or an "epic save" is made. Overall it's very fitting.Communication between teammates is simple and intuitive. It would be nicer if you could add custom emotes however I guess there's a reason why you can't.....The devs are very faithful and still giving a constant stream of updates 2 years in and listening to what people want. My only gripe is that some of the updates do not quite accomplish this such as the Chaos Run update (where they added 2 cars no one plays with the Ripper and the Grog and a map that no one likes Wasteland). They do make up for this however with some amazing new gamemodes such as Hoops and Dropshot and new customizability options. A nice segway for....Customizability. The battle cars aren't affected by the customizability options apart from car body so it's nice to decorate without worrying about stats. There are plenty of customizability options and extremely cool black market animated decals. Although I own none personally I hope to trade up to one eventually.So what's the verdict?It's a fun experience I'll probably be playing for quite a while longer. Although the community is quite a bit toxic and devs can make some weird choices at times it's one of my favorite games.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love this game! I purchased it twice now once on the ps4 and then when I purchased a gaming PC I bought it again on Steam. The game is easy to learn and love but hard to master. Between the two systems I have over 200 hours of play time and can't wait for more. For someone that has never tried the game the concept is simple. You play 5 minute soccer matches with rocket powered RC cars. That's it! It sounds so simple that you'd think it would be boring. It is FAR from boring!!! There are a million different ways to score and defend. The quick chat is usually very positive with the team celebrating your success as long as you do it in return. There is the occassional rude user that spams "what a save!" when you wiff on a save but just brush it off and leave after the game.I use a PS4 dual shock controller most of the time and works great! A CONTROLLER IS A MUST! playing with keyboard and mouse is no where near as fun.In some of the reviews I notice folks complain about having to pay for some of the unlocks. My justification is that I've been playing since it launched on the PS4 and the developers have been really responsive when the server fails or balancing isn't fair. That continued development costs the company more than the $20 it is to purchase the game. Let them charge $2 for cars that were not available at launch. The crate system for some of the crazy skins and mods frustrates me some. I work really hard in hopes of getting a crate then when I get one I have to buy keys to open the crate and I risk getting a lame skin I already own. When you get something cool though it feels amazing! Overall I recommend you buy the game. The game is designed as such that the paid unlocks only make you look cool and by no means give you an advantage. Give the game a shot!
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is easily in my top 5 games of all time. It has wonderful purly skill based multyplayer. It's fun for all ages (with mute) and for all skill levels. The developers are always adding new features that enhance the experience as well as fixing problems pointed out by the community. You will not find a better value in gaming.
title: Rocket League®

review: My favorite game I have about 1500 hours cross console and 850 at the moment on steam I really love this game and the community I highly reccomend anyone who likes quick games that can either be extremely wacky and funny or very competitive.Though I do reccomend a good computer to run it on good settings because on low settings which gives the best fps but it looks very pixelated but you can get used to it.There is also a great and big community growing rapidly there are many teams that have fun together or play in tournaments and this game can be very fun with your friends in modes like Dropshot Chaos or Lab and even competitive modes like Doubles Standard (3v3) Solo Standard (3v3 with only solo queue) and Solo (1v1).If you are making a decision to buy this game or not I would give you the thumbs up but there are many Youtube videos showing you the pros and cons of rocketleague. One pro would be the price it is extremely cheap compared to the standard $60 per game. A con would be some of the toxic people in the community which can sometimes throw competitive games and say bad things to you. There are many pros and cons though so do your research.Thanks for reading this long and boring review.
title: Rocket League®

title: Rocket League®

review: I consider this an addiction... I have other games in my library gifted and purchased I am yet to play because I enjoy this so much. This game ticks many boxes if you only have 20 minutes free you can jump in and play three solid matches. It matches you against similarly skilled players as you go up and down in ability I tend to rank down a bit after a drink or if I'm tired and go back up when I'm concentrating and the matchmaking does a great job of pairing me with similar players so I never feel like I'm overly outgunned by others.There is a really satisfying progression aspect to it as you learn new things and how to anticipate your teammates moves and others attacks etc. I only play 2v2 ranked this is the sweet spot for me. If you're new jump into unranked for a while to skill up I'd say 3v3 then 2v2 avoid 1v1 unless you want to get really annoyed then go to 2v2 ranked. I'll never be a kuxir or squishymuffinz (pro players) however I do enjoy it. 1 065 hours in so far... worryingly high amount of time to spend on a single game...!Great job Psyonix.

review: Ever since I saw gameplay I knew this had to be mine. So I went to the Steam store and bought it straight away. Ever since I started playing I have never thought about stopping. I would always purchase new games that I seemed interested in yet after a day or two I would always venture back to Rocket League even after it's release back in the middle of 2015. That say's something. The concept of the game is incredibly easy hit the ball into the goal but... the amount of skill it takes to master this game even the professionals who have been playing Rocket League and it's prequel SARPBC for over 6 years still haven't fully grappled every corner of this game. This is what gives Rocket League it's longevity and the developers know that which is why there is no plan for a second sequel of this style of game. 10/10 game I've loved it ever since I started playing. I'll hit Grand Champion one day!

review: Amazing game kept me addicted even when I've bought other games as well.From the gameplay aspect it feels very realistic. Has much physics embedded inside this simple game. Graphics are nice albeit being playable even with the worst graphics possible.It takes a little bit of effort in the first hours as you get used to positioning but once you handle it you're ready to go and explore other skills.DLCs are quite great everyone may have their own preferences when it comes to choosing cars. Luckily this ain't "pay to play" games so people using DLC cars isn't necesarrily better (unless they're used to it and very good in using it).There are microtransactions and trading (either with other players or trading in items for a higher quality item you'll understand once you buy it.) inside this game but it's not disturbing or anything bad. I may also say that this is a quite profitable game if you use the trading system and understand it well. (sometimes needs luck but hey everyone has that)Recommended whether or not you like soccer and cars short length of matches and unique concept makes it a great game for everyone.11/10 would keep avoiding and muting toxic salty players )

review: Sometimes the simplest ideas are the best ideas. ROCKET LEAGUE GAMEPLAY Take asSOCCiation football (SOCCer). The game where you kick a ball into a net. Now take a car. The thing that you drive to get around. Attach a rocket to it. The thing we used to get to the moon. Now mash these two things together. Sounds stupid right? Nope. Rocket League is so simple that anyone can "get it" in their first try playing the game yet just complicated enough to reward skill and have replayability. The maps are pretty much the same aside from size though the new Neo Tokyo map hoops and Rocket Labs changes them up enough. Different modes such as hockey and basketball mutators that let you play with unlimited boost gravity etc. Cars have a good weight and feel to them good turning radius the boost has a good feel to it the controls are slick with both kb+m and controller it's great. GRAPHICS Beautiful. The graphics have a nice little charm to them there's lots of subtle details texture types particles while keeping a steady art style and remaining well optimized. SOUNDTRACK I mean soundtrack's good? Really good. I would have personally preferred if they had gone with synthwave (the concept of rocket powered cars and the aesthetic just screams 80's to me) but the soundtrack they chose is good. Consistent themes catchy tunes good. CONCLUSION I always thought sports games were kiinda stupid. Unless you did something really different like NBA Jam or Wii Sports or any racing game you could think of they were pretty much all the same thing. Rocket League is not the same thing obviously. Taking roots from soccer and racing games the gameplay is simplistic enough for even a toddler while competitive enough to be a professional esport.

review: Rocket league is a good game for competitive players. Not so much for casual. I used to like it for what it was but the game is now more about the items. Pretty much every item in the game is cosmetic with the exception of import bodies as they have different sizes of hitboxes. There are a lot of toxic players (suggesting that the game is mostly played by kids) and it gets boring after a while. It's literally just football/soccer with rocket cars. As the game has always been it's overhyped and boring. Now I'm not saying rocket league is a horrible game but the concept itself just gets boring after a while. Overall I would not recoommend playing the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: I want to love Rocket League as much as it's predecessor Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars which me and my mates must of sunk 10s of 100s of hours in to. And I nearly do. Everything from the first game has been improved up on but unfortunately Rocket League is unplayable. Lag and rubber banding in every single online match I have played makes it impossible to play which is why I cannot recommend Rocket League as it stands.Edit 18/07/15 Servers seem to of durastically improved no longer are matches unplayable due to rubber banding. As mentioned above great game very fun and a one of a kind!

review: Remember that one time Top Gear decided to play soccer using cars? This game is exactly that but instead of driving around in a big clunky Toyota Aygo you get to drive around in very acrobatic Micro Machine like cars that can go up walls and even fly using the rocket booster. Matches are short and quick and it's really easy to find yourself playing several in a row. Plenty of parts to unlock and customize your vehicle with and yes there are hats in this game. The most innovative feature is being able to search for an online game at the same time as you're playing one of the offline modes the game also supports 4 player split screen making it an excellent party game.

review: I really wish I could reccomend Rocket League. The gameplay is fun and extremely addictive not to mention exciting and visually pleasing. But unfortunately it's overshadowed by one problem and it's a big one. The matchmaking. What were the Devs thinking of? If you just bought the game you will be put into a match full of veterens and those veterens will run up the scoreline like Germany did against Brazil. It makes it pretty much unplayable. If this issue is resolved I'll change this review and reccomend it in a heartbeat but until then don't bother playing it.

review: The Napoleonic Wars (1803 1815) were a series of major global conflicts pitting the French Empire led by Napoleon I against an array of European powers formed into various coalitions. They revolutionised European armies and played out on an unprecedented scale mainly owing to the application of modern mass conscription. The wars were a continuation of the Revolutionary Wars which broke out in 1792 during the French Revolution. Initially French power rose quickly as the armies of Napoleon conquered much of Europe. In his military career Napoleon fought about 60 battles and lost seven mostly at the end of his reign. 22 The great French dominion collapsed rapidly after the disastrous invasion of Russia in 1812. Napoleon was defeated in 1814 and sent into exile on the island of Elba he then escaped and returned to power only to be defeated at the Battle of Waterloo and was exiled again this time to Saint Helena.

review: Rocket League Rocket League is a really fun unique game that will run really well on most computers even low budget ones.There is a decent amount of customisation you can do to your vehicle which provides something to work towards.The game also uses a ranking system.. EG getting to level 10 you will become a "Semi Pro." Another cool edition to the game is that there is a competetive mode. I would recommend to anyone that wants a unique fun game to play with friends.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a football based game where you are in rocket powered cars there are two teams orange team and blue team. The main objective of the game is to score more goals then your opponents in the five minute time frame. I've only played around 450 hours of this game but I have to say it is one of my favourite games I have ever played I highly recomend it to anyone who likes video games or likes playing football (this game is quite big if you don't have a decent quality computer it is a lot less enjoyable).
title: Rocket League®

review: I don t like football at all and I hate FIFA like games. But Rocket Legue is different. This crazy thing is the best simulator of football I ve ever seen. It s funny and very addictive. But get a controller before buying )9/10+easy to play hard to master+Locall split screen for 4 players &gt typical party game+online is really fun+updates (basketball is realy awesome)+customization cars don t support split screen "keybord and controller" (without third party program like x360ce I don t see a reason why) theese days it has some issues with joining second controller both are Xbox compatible and it always works... I would really enjoy the LAN mode our internet connection in the village is really poor (and no in our house isn t even signal for a mobile phone so it is impossible to get better)...

review: Rocket League is a very fun game that can easily be picked up by anyone who plays soccer/football but also people who does not like it. A game that is a sports equivalent of CS GO with very competitive gameplay that requires knowledge and experience to play to it's fullest.A game about flying cars empowered with rockets to score goals can only be fun right? A very unique experience.I believe RL (Rocket League) is a fantastic pickup and can be played for hours and hours. The only problem I've had is server issues in which I've been forced to play many ranked games alone as a result of the server not picking up my teammate. Otherwise Rocket League is an amazing game that I see no reason not to buy.

review: This is one of those games which look very boring. But once you try playing you just can't stop.At the start it's a challenge to hit the ball. As you progress you learn not only to hit the ball but also to hit it into the right direction. At this point it is very important not to only play solo duel because at this point you have to learn to be cooperative to play any other gamemode. Later on you learn to hit the ball in the middle of the air and then you know pretty much all there is and can try amazingly cool stunts which you can find all over youtube.Be warned though. To get to this point you will most likely need to spend about 150 hours with this game.P.S. Mostly only playable with a controller so either get one or don't get this game. Keyboard controll is possible but it's much better with controller.

review: I feelt that I should review this game after playing for 23 hours I AM ADDICTED!. If you look at other reviews it says theirs a server problem I have never had in issue and I have wired ethernet. You probably just have a bad wifi provider. Secondly everything about this game is addicting although theirs not a lot of modes. I have heard alot of people saying that having the items not make your car better is bad. I think its good because newbs won't get crushed by people who have all the items. The gameplay is solid although I wouldn't recomend using a controller for accurate gameplay. The graphics are solid and caping the fps at 60 was a nice touch. Even on high settings my game has never lagged even if I drop to 30 fps. What they mean by an easy to learn hard to master means that you can't play 1 hour and be able to always win. I thought I was good until people started using rocket flying more frequently. Overall their looking to add new content and more dlc and have a lot of cool features already implemented so I rate this 10/1O
title: Rocket League®

RL is your friend...RL is good...RL cares about you...you must....assimilation is inevitable...resistance is futile...Most amazing complete luck shot I ever got was being knocked into the goal after hitting off the side wall....flipped upside down in the collision...... ball bounces off my underside up and into the goal for score..15/10 Would accidentally imitate Kronovi by complete luck again!!

review: This game was brought to my attention at Quakecon this year. Everybody was playing it instead of the usual deathmatch arena games. I had no idea it even existed I was highly interested and it looked incredibly competitive. It's a very interesting idea and it works beautifully with the fluidity of the physics exploitation. It is incredibly fun and every match is different. Some people can maneuver their vehicles to make some amazing shots. The only thing I have to say negative about Rocket League and it isn't even a negative is that you won't enjoy it as much if you don't play with friends. I haven't played it much more because I don't find random matches all that appealing.Great game though it has a lot to offer and you'll get more enjoyment than you paid for.

review: Awful Toxic Community. Dodgy Match making. Smurfing beyond belief. I love the core of this game but there are a few major things that let it down.As a title that is rated PEGI 3 the type of language harassment and abuse you see in nearly every match is awful. I know friends and colleagues that play this game with their kids who have inevitably had to turn the text chat off to get away from this. As simple as this is to overcome it shouldn't really need to be done as the text chat is a vital part of playing RL.I only really play ranked RL these days (other than the occasional game of rumble) mainly because of the awfully dodgy matchmaking when searching in Casual. The match making system when searching for casual games seems to match you completely out of your skill level. Not only does it match you out of your skill bracket but it also chooses to match you into games that are already 5 0 down. Now this comes into an entirely different problem of people rage quiting after just conceding a goal(s) where maybe some form of penalty system (like in ranked) may benefit.Because i've only really played ranked rocket league for the last 6 12 months i've been exposed to how common smurfing really is even in ranked matches platinum and above. Things like this just ruin the competitive nature of the game for those who actual enjoy playing.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rockets football cars. What's not to like? Goals Aerials Epic Saves (and of course epic fails) all make for a thrilling match time after time. It's never the same game tweak anything number of players difficuty pitch etc and the strategies that work best change.Bored with Soccar? (Doubt it.) They've got Hoops and Hockey. And if you get bored of chasing balls/pucks there's boom boom boom action when you wipe out the opponents stock car stylee.Great developers great community. Amazing physics with awesome graphics that are configurable enough to keep any reasonable rig playing the frenetic action smoothly.This was my first review I hope I've done this game justice. If you are dithering over purchasing just get it you won't be disappointed. It's the best value games money I've spent in well over a decade.

review: Auto Ban for 24 hours for language?! I took a day off of this game anyways due to some incredibly toxic and own goaling teammates in ranked and I come back slapped with a ban for my language?? Absolutely fantastic. Don't want to scare away those kids who spend their parents money on your lottery system with some foul language ohhh noo. Use the mute function if you don't like how I talk don't completely shut me out of playing the game. That makes absolutely no sense! That's why I enjoyed playing on the PC over my xbox I used to play on (with over 500 hours on that alone) I was able to voice my frustrations without being censored for no reason. It's just more censorship on the internet because heaven forbid someone gets offended by words that a completely anonymous person typed out to them.If you wanna start banning people maybe put a system in place that recognizes when someone own goals more than 3 times in a match so I don't have to play with self hating narcisistic kids when I actually want to play a ranked game. I mean I would be more than happy to play unranked but I can't remember the last time I played that without my entire team/the opposing team quitting after they get scored on once. Please Psyonix. You have a great game here but your eye is quite literally not on the ball. Take care of what matters before your community destroys itself.

review: This game is amazing. Simple sleek competitive hours of fun await you in this Fifa meets Mario Cart hybrid. This game is destine to be a major e sport player for years to come. The game play is simple yet refined and there is an even playing field for all players. No unlocks in this game give you an advantage over any of the other players. In theory you could launch into the game out of the box and beat the world s top player in your first match. You won't. You'll lose. But the beauty in this game is that everyone has a fair chance. After a few hours of playtime you will start to figure out how to use the game's flight mechanics to start scoring dazzling aerial goals.The only open issue with this game out of the box is a small glitch that affects players using a mouse and keyboard. This is easily fixed by following the instructions set out in this video I made. Enjoy and I'll see you out on the pitch!

If you have a good sense of humor a competitive spirit and don't easily get hurt feelings when the game scores you at the end in front of everyone and proves that you suck more than everyone else you know and really even the bots get MVP more often than you do well buy this game. review: So you picked up this game because all of your spurglord friends are playing it. All of you can be seperated into catagories. The one that plays defence no matter how far into that goal the ball is. The guy who steals every goal no matter how hard you worked for that The one who lags all the time and usually ends up driving on the walls of the stadium. And you the guy who sets up and makes goals. My friend and I have spent hours (maybe even days) on this game and you work so hard at achieveing nothing just to have that one moment where you think you are going to make the most pro goal in all of Rocket League history. Then it is ruined by that guy who stole your ing boost and messed with the ball to make the shot miss. You become an alcoholic shortly after yelling at your teammate. Then you make a questionably racist vehicle and spam chat with "Nice pass!" 10/10 would futbol again.
title: Rocket League®

review: The game is good itself but developers are not working on any known issues. I have been playing this game for more than 700 hours now got to decent rank(superstar) and in my opinion this game has one of the most toxic communities similar to LOL DOTA CS GO Rust etc. It would really help if devs make a good reporting system or some solution to this issue but for now you can only play in stack with your friends to avoid toxic players on your team. I played 3 games in a row with a guy who was not the best player of all but expected me to carry him and ruined 2 out of 3 games intentionally. It is really easy to smurf in this game. I made an experiment myself started playing on my friends acc at the end of the season and found out that on Challenger 2 are actually smurfs in 50% of the games(in opposing teams). This is just harsh for new players they can't really relax playing this game when in a lot of games they face people 6 ranks higher than they are. On high ranks on other hand there are a lot of toxic and boosted people. Some even say that they are boosted some just leave "pro" status on them and run like potato in circles chasing the ball. What are the incentives for those players you might ask. End season rewards and big **** to show their friends. Hats off to the devs they countered the smurfs somehow with the matchmaking in parties based on the highest rank but that's also not enough and also affects some legit parties of friends different rank who want to play together. You actually need to carry your friend if your ranks are significantly different.To conclude this game has serious matchmaking issues which is really bad for healthy environment in community. Other things such as gameplay customization different game modes are awesome but they are offset by a terrible issues listed above. I understand that it is really hard to fix smurfing and toxicity but devs haven't done a thing since launch about it. If you have good nerves and/or a lot of friends to play with proceed to acquiring otherwise think about broken gamepads.

review: 'Huh Rocket League is on a free weekend I guess I'll give it a try...'*1 Hour Later*'Why didn't I play this sooner?!'Rocket League is a very simple but very well executed game. It's remote controlled cars with aerial abilities and football (+ hockey basketball and a variety of experimental areanas) combined to create an addictive multiplayer experience. On the surface it looks silly but you really have to play it to understand what all the fuss is about great gameplay experience with an energetic atmosphere that requires skill to pull off some amazing goals and is even more fun with friends. Controls are solid and performance is buttery smooth to boot. Cars are customisable with new bodies decals paintwork toppers (hats etc.) and antenas. New content such as game modes are added to the game for free however you can pay a little more for some extra customisational options (though do note that these are completely aesthetic no stat boosts of any kind).Highly recommended to those who want to try something different. Believe me it's worth it for hours of fun!Edit They're adding Steam Workshop support for custom levels what more do you want?

review: TLDR What once was a fun casual party game has been shaped by its ranked community and Psyonix into a highly competitive game all about eSports crates ranks and wins. Sadly this isn't the game I originally bought 3 years ago and I can't recommend it to non competitive gamers in good faith anymore unless you REALLY know what you're buying.If you're reading this you most likely know what Rocket League is. You know the game where you hit a large ball around with your rocket powered car in an over the top fantasy equivalent of Test Drive Eve of Destruction's 'Soccer' mode. Overall there's nothing like it and it's pretty good too.So why the thumbs down in spite of 300+ hours of playtime? Well first of all as of writing this I haven't even touched the game in over 5 months. Deep down I still enjoy the concept of Rocket League so much that I can't outright hate the game itself and I wish I still could enjoy it like I used to. That being said my main problem with Rocket League nowadays and the reason I'm writing this is the direction the game and its community have taken since launch.When Rocket League originally came out in 2015 it was just a simple fun soccer game. Hop on play some matches ignore anyone that took the game too seriously customize your car grab some new items here and there through sporadic post match item drops stuff like that. There were even DLC packs that you could buy and get a couple cars with some items. I liked that and I would buy them to show how much I liked the game even the ones I wasn't crazy about. $4 for 2 cars and some items released alongside new free maps? What a steal.Then the crates happened late 2016 and everything went downhill from there. Psyonix stated that some proceeds from key sales would go towards funding eSports prize pools which to me was kinda weird back then. Now I think it's just absurd. Asking your playerbase to pay for your eSports tournaments' prize pools is bad enough in my opinion but doing it through psuedo gambling cosmetic crates by exploiting people's gambling addictions whether you consider these crates to be gambling or not is just wrong. Those new cars that looked super cool? You have to gamble for them now you can't just buy them outright anymore and free Decryptor keys don't count they just enable people to buy more keys. The exceptions to this are the licensed DLCs which while still cool comes off as having your cake and eating it too which isn't that great a business strategy for an indie studio to be partaking in at all.By the way I know there's a subset of the community that will tell people like me that oppose the crate system to just buy some keys and start trading with people. Sadly Rocket League makes doing that overcomplicated. I have bad anxiety problems I can't randomly add people to trade stuff because my uneasiness from even typing this review just won't allow it. Also even in that subset there's scammers you have to look out for. If only Psyonix actually cared and either integrated Steam Marketplace to let people resell/trade that way or make an in game trading marketplace feature maybe I would buy some keys and support the game that way but since trading doesn't directly benefit Psyonix they naturally buried that idea before it was ever considered.The final straw for me was when the community backlash to Neo Tokyo caused Psyonix to create a flat standardized layout for it. Then came Wasteland and Starbase Arc. Does the ground slightly curve on the sides? Better flatten it to make our toxic community happy they're apparently completely incapable of adapting and adjusting to different scenarios to overcome their opposition and need Psyonix to "fix" the game for them. This also made the eSports competitions themselves completely unwatchable for me. Why would I watch people play a computer game where all of the maps are the same and no different strategies are required? I'd rather watch the Overwatch League.Speaking of toxic good grief this game is REALLY toxic. I remember joining a match a ball flies past me before I even have control of my car and my teammate calls me slow in text chat and starts berating me until he rage quits. I'm not the type of person to get offended by it but seriously dude? Saying I'm mentally crippled over a video game? How about you lighten up and stop taking casual play so seriously? (The kicker was that we started scoring the moment he quit so the joke's on him and yes this was in CASUAL not ranked I've never been that competitive a gamer to invest any serious time into ranked and I have my reasons.) This game and Overwatch seem to be the biggest offenders of this (if you don't count MOBAs and every multiplayer survival game of course) and frankly it just makes me sad. Again I have bad social anxiety problems as it is and all this kind of behavior makes me want to do is just stop playing entirely. Is that what this community really wants for people to just leave and never come back due to the sheer toxicity of its casual playerbase?This is going to sound unrelated but I swear I'm bringing this up for a reason. I had a friend for years while I was growing up. Generally he was one of those that I felt had my back if I needed help yeah he would make some edgy jokes once in a while but nothing that was unbearable. Flash forward nearly a decade after I met him and the last time we talked he was constantly dragging everyone down using racial slurs every night and feeding off of any sort of happiness he could wring out of us. I called him out one time and he didn't want to hear any of it and guilt tripped me into apologizing. A few months after that I had to just stop talking to him entirely because I just couldn't take the toxicity anymore it was making me miserable.Guess what his favorite game was? Rocket League. He hated it at first like most newer games where he would just quit without trying to learn anything but then he saw me starting it up and I grabbed him a copy. We had some fun matches but even from day one if a goal got past he got agitated real quick blaming his own teammates for the other team scoring even if we did everything he wanted us to and this would happen every night we played games with him because all he wanted to play was Rocket League all the time hence the 300+ hours. Eventually he decided he could only play VS AI with me that we would never be good enough for even casual online play. It was probably for the best honestly because even in those few online matches we did play if someone on the enemy team said something negative to us there he was with the racial slurs it was embarrassing. I wouldn't be surprised if he got banned from the online now.My point is these days I like to think of Rocket League and that friend as one and the same. I hope deep down that something will change that maybe Psyonix will make a PURE CASUAL playlist put all the fun other modes in there (Dropshot Hockey Rumble) with the original non standardized maps add a trading marketplace in game just...something other than tournaments. Tournaments that only really cater to the competitive side of the community the ones that value wins and numbers over just having fun with the game in the first place. I'm not judging anyone that plays games this way (hey more power to you) but I read the YouTube comments on said Tournaments teaser video and I see this gem "If you're not hyped then you're not a real fan." 238 upvotes as of me writing this. Nope guess I don't hate myself enough to be a 'real fan.'Hopefully my former friend can get his act together and become a better person but I doubt it. Same with Rocket League sadly. It was a lot of fun while it lasted but the toxicity has gotten to me and it's just not the same now. To those that still enjoy the game please keep enjoying it. It's not a bad game it's just not what I want anymore.
title: Rocket League®

review: I know this review is quite late but I only got the game three days ago. I've played probably about 60 matches about 55 of which were all in the online competitive ranked mode. And the game is great. It's a fast paced mashup of soccer and a car combat game. Not much to talk about there. It takes a surprising amount of skill and spatial awareness to play well.But what I will mention is the terrible community this game has. I bought this game three days ago and only played more than an hour the past day and a half. About half the players I've played have been fine no issue. The other half of them however will do annoying things like saying " you" at the end of a match they lost or "bullcrap" in reaction to one of your goals. They'll claim something was lucky even if you did it on purpose. This is 1v1 btw. In 3v3 the pug 3v3 people spam emotes and leave after a 2 goal deficit.Or another time a player yelled "GET VAC BANNED." I scored like 3 goals and he had 8. I play a ton of sports games. I've never cheated in my life in a multiplayer video game. And I truthfully only bought this game so I could have something to do while I wait for Overwatch to be released. Not to say this game is just going to be something I leave behind afterwards I do love this game. But the idea that I would cheat is just absurd I'm not THAT invested in the game at this early on. I recommend buying the game if you like a really fast paced actiony sports game. It's faster than any sports like game I've ever played. I didn't try the hoops mode yet but it seems cool. But the toxic community is unfortunately here just like it is in every online game.
title: Rocket League®

review: 53 hours and counting... at first I thought it would stop at like five or six hours because "for how long can this be fun?!". Well considering how short the matches are (five minutes) and how fast paced they are it's one of those "pick up and play one or two games just to kill some time" games.W... what? What this game is all about? Well. You're driving rocket cars with which you're playing football/soccer (depending on where you're from) and there's also game modes to play hockey basketball and such. If you're mostly into football (hey I'm from Europe we say it the right way!) then you can play that 3v3 2v2 and 1v1. You've got training modes to make you better at the game. I probably have missed som oh yeah one of the biggest features of the game.Customizing your car. What can you do with the car? Great question! There's the body decals the colors of the body and decals wheels flames (for when you're using boost) different hats and also different things to put on your antenna. So pretty extensive all things considered. More is also being added as the times goes on.Such a great little game I wholeheartedly do recommend this game. Especially if you're into racing games and sports games. Go on what are you waiting for?! No time to waste!
title: Rocket League®

review: Holy hell what a game Rocket League is. The reviews for it are pretty awesome too rofl. I even did a video about my favorite ones with YouTuber MattShea.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v hvsHAdif5uMPROS GORGEOUS game. Seriously particles and graphics just look fantastic along with the environment.Gameplay is very easy to learn yet challenging to master ensuring that players don't get bored.The COLORS! People tripping on acid don't see this many colors!Amazing sound track this game's music is fantastic.CONS Community is either an absolute delight or the biggest jerks you'll ever meet.I'm not great at it and it makes me sad.All in all I'd easily give this game a 10 out of 10. I'm usually pretty hard on games as a critic so this game really does something for most other games don't.

review: I have made a review before on this game and I am embarrased to say I forgot the most important part.The communityThe community in this game is so bad... In fact it is so bad that i wouldn't even put it in the category "community"...I tried League Of Legends back in the day... Man was that a salty community filled to the brim with small boys who all apparently had sex with your mom...LoL salt is ing sugar canes up your compared to Rocket League's community... Never have i seen so much salt uncalled for trash talk and a terrible misuse of the given "quick commands" for the chat. The intention of the command "What a save" was meant for a pat on your shoulder if you did something amazing to keep the ball out of your team's net. However this "quick chat command" is NEVER ever ever used as a compliment. Rather it is used to redicule accidents and "bad" goalkeeping. Ofcourse this would happen and it does happen in most other similar games.. But the kids playing this game are derived directly from the devil himself.I mean the following in the most sincere honest way humanly possible 99% of all people playing Rocket League deserves to die. As in literally fall dead to the ground. Have weird sick happen to their families and get whiped from the face of the earth. These people are bad people. To the core. Rocket League behavior should be information brought to job interviews and first dates. These people deserve to die alone. Without ever feeling the love of a woman/man. They need to be eradicated.I'm not usually a "mean" or "evil" person. I make friends with most people I come across. But I will never. And I mean NEVER even try to make friends with these inbred insects in this game.If you like a normal community with a reasonable amount of trash talking and salt. THIS IS NOT YOUR GAME.I'm sure you can find places to be hated and rediculed without having to pay 30 bucks.All in all the community is the worst community in the history of communities. And for that simple reason I do NOT recommend this game.

review: lmao smurfing afk xp farming many game bugs that have gone unfixed and now an update has been released to fix all of these issues.Just kidding they added the battle pass from fortnite. Its not 2016 anymore the game is dead glitchy and broken in some ways and the community is toxic not on a cs go or any battle royale game level of toxic but still bad but thank goodness no one uses the voice chat.If for some reason you may still be interested in this game I would recommend a controller because it took me a good 70 hours to just get used to keyboard controls and I'm still bad at the game even after 150 hours total across my pc and switch. I wouldnt recommend the game just because of how psyonix doesnt fix any of the issues above. InsteadThey added the rocket pass!!!!1!!!11!EDIT According to other reviews they removed casual dropshot hoops (basketball) snow day (ice hockey) and rumble (powerups). This has to be the most update I've heard of yet. Not only did they remove gamemodes that casual players may enjoy more than the base game they made them compettitive so that tryhards would ruin the game for them. Honestly if Psyonix decides to make another game I wouldn't buy it because once they make a good game they have to ruin it with bad updates bad server maintenence and greedy desicions. I'd think of myself as a pretty negative thinker to be honest but there is no way that anyone should have the right to think of this game in a positive way anymore. If you've seen a positive review on this game it's likely from wither 2015/16 when the game was actually good or it's from a die hard fan who will deny any proof that the game has gone downhill.Also for some strange reason the devs can't decide between DLC Loot Boxes that give you no chance to get something you could actually use without buying another hundred of them and the new rocket pass that everyone loves so very much.CS GO is cheaper and VALVe cares about that game more than Psyonix does with this one.

review: I loved this game as i have allmost 300hrs invested in the game and i barely have time go game much as it is. It's just really creative and fun and if you get good you'll do some tricks that will make your endorphins light like candles. But it needs some changes or upgrades to it's report system. I've never heard of anyone getting punished for stupid in this game or serious stuff for that matter. Your options are to report harrasment or afk'ing or just unsportsman like conduct. But it's allmost impossible to check if someone trolled for an entire match. Like i said the game is very fun! And i belive the comunity is great but only if you get past the prospect riseing star div1 players. i just uinstalled the game after i played a 3v3 match. 2 of the people on the enemy team left very early but we kwpt playing 3v1 which isn't fair but i didnt want to risk the match as i was at promotion. half way into the match one on my team starts playing against us. And since we aren't prepeard for that he scores. We thought he just messed up and kept playing but then he scored again and made it an even score. Finally he give the guy the last goal just before over time and we lose a match 3v1 couse of a troll i can't prove did it since i can't send my replays to psyonix and i dont usually run a capture software in the backround. I think the game is fun if you focus on it casually and dont play ranked. But it'll also be fun if you are confident you could get past the challenger ranks where all the trolls and youtube fakers seem to hang out.i hope they do something about this but until then this game just makes me frustrated. Sad to the copmunity even in lower lauges used to be awesome!

review: Rocket League stole my heart and sometimes that's not a good thing. There is a lot of praise about Rocket League already so I'm just going to present some things which I found to be slightly faulty. In the interest of your time should you be reading this the bottomline is that I loved it but it certainly isn't perfect.I'm not a competitive player so losing very often isn't something I have fun with. Before the most recent patch there was no way to text mute filter or even report players. This would often cause me personally a lot of frustration as this seems to be the kind of game that really invites a good deal of negative offensive or just otherwise unsportsmanlike players. I know the rebuttal to this is that I need thicker skin or that it's just Internet being the Internet but my point is that I shouldn't be forced to put up with it. This has been fixed with the recent additions to the chat options however so I am very thankful for that.Beyond that the matchmaking system sometimes feels a little too unfair. Often teams which are already technically the underdog (through level or multiple losses) will be ignored by the matchmaking and be used as bottomfeed.In one particular scenario when I was at the pro level I was matched with another pro and the matchmaking assigned another bot to our team. We were up against two veterans and an expert. After we lost the opposing team's expert left and the matchmaking sought two new players to join for the rematch. Curiously it took me to their team and left the other pro player alone with two bots after not finding a new player. Obviously the lone pro player was slaughtered for two minutes before a bunch of players were brought in saw the losing battle and promptly left anyway.Ideally the matchmaking would take one of the veterans and match each with either pro in my team to balance both squads. I realize level isn't exactly indicative of player skill but if the game wasn't going to take level into consideration regarding the player's skill level then giving players a title would be irrelevant to begin with.This has happened to me on many occasions.Players leaving mid match is very problematic as well as the ability to do so incentivizes a big deal of players to not stick around unless they're already winning. Losing players halfway through a match can and often is decisive. Players should be penalized for leaving. Worst even as I've mentioned it's very common for players to not want to stick around in a surely losing match. Once two players leave and start losing by two or three goals it's extremely difficult (at least in my experience) for other players to stick around so the remaining player might as well just forfeit.This is not even in question in my mind Allowing players to just leave is absolutely the wrong design decision here.Regardless of these issues which in my opinion are not small issues but ones that I hope will fixed sometime soon Rocket League was in my Top 5 Videogames of 2015. I don't see myself stopping in the near future. The mix of moment to moment team tactics with extremely high skill ceiling and addicting mechanics focused on mastery over the physics engine is brilliant and I have no doubt this will become a very popular videogame in eSports or other videogame competitions. The design lends itself to very very high levels of play with fantastic moves and the capacity for a degree of mastery the likes of which we usually only see in the fighting game community.Rocket League is amazing. Even if it breaks my heart sometimes.
title: Rocket League®

review: So i think i got enough hours to sum up a review for this game. It's not gonna be long though you really can't write much about a game thats well done.For me the most important thing a game should have is an easy gameplay cause there are a lot of games that are overall good but their gameplay is grievous. It is really easy to understand the basic mechanics and how the game runs and it is quite hard to fully master them which makes the game an excellent competitive pursuit. This is one of the games which can be played with people with older less powerfull PC's like myself. At almost minimum reqs. i have no problem running the game at 40 50 FPS which is more than enough. Of course the graphics won't be as good but if you aren't pretentious this won't be a problem. There are some problems though which i will state down in the review..The cars and their designs are really good. There is a car for anybody no matter if you like playing with race cars or big monster trucks you will find your suitable car. All cars have unique decals and paintjobs and with all the variety of toppers anthenas and wheels you can customise your car whatever the way you like. Wide variety of in game mods hoops hockey rl labs mutators etc. The maps in the normal and ranked playlist are really cool made all of them maybe excluding Neo Tokyo which in my opinion belongs in the labs playlist due to it's terrain. The main menu is very clear no unnecessary options and decorations. You have easy access to anything from the matchmaking to the options. The bad things First one is the really weird FPS drop on the Aqua Dome map. From 40 50 normal FPS it drops to 15 and it is not playable at all. Keep in mind that this is a problem that is only on less powerful PC's like mine so if you got a new powerful PC you will have no problem here. Still i hope the devs will do something to make it playable for us.The second and last con for me is the random matchmaking at times which is a bit annoying in competitive play although it's much better since last year. So finally if you think of buying this game my opinion is go for it this game deserves its price.8/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is a ing sensation. Every once in a while someone comes up with a stupid concept for a game that against all odds turns out to be absolutely amazing. The concept for Rocket League is Monster Trucks/Cars with rockets charge after a gigantic ball in a game of football. The basic controls are simple enough drive car into ball to score goal pick up boost and use charge to gain speed or to fly through the air. Still it takes a lot of time to master your vehicle properly to get a good feel of the game and not least how to cooperate with your team. When the feeling of mastery hits you there's no escaping this pleasure machine. This game is simply the good Video game smack. The feel of nailing an Aerial or magically blocking your friends from one. There's not one single game on this planet that's more fun to play with your friends right now.
title: Rocket League®

review: Preety nice.
title: Rocket League®

review: Premise Take 3v3 5 minute soccer and replace the players with rocket powered cars. It may sound crazy but it s a formula for a great time. The developers have continued to support the game long after launch enabling cross platform play across PS4 and Xbox One as well as adding more sports! Hockey? Check! Basketball? Check!! Custom game modes from beach balls to giant boulders? Check!!Visuals The arenas all look and feel fantastic making you feel like you re actually on the pitch steering your car towards victory. The vehicles all look unique though they all have the same stats. The game also offers quite a bit of customization with myriad cars toppers wheels and antennae to choose from (even more with the purchase of very reasonably priced DLC). They have an update scheduled for the end of this month that s going to expand the items even further with increasingly rare items and even stat tracking ones (think strange items from Team Fortress 2). Sound The stadiums come alive with chants and cheers ooh s and ahh s. The soundtrack is killer though there s no option to listen to the music while in a game strangely enough. The cars all make different noises with the trails having their own unique sounds as well. Overall I m really impressed by how it all comes together. I can tell by sound if the approaching car is an enemy or ally it s that polished.Mechanics This is my favorite part about Rocket League. The game is simple enough to pick up drive and push the ball around. Then you begin doing double jumps and flips realizing that you can contort your vehicle (and physics) to your whim. You can spin twist and turn in place easing the ball in the direction you want it to go. From there you keep pushing learning formations communication and positioning. Then you learn how to fly. That s probably the most enjoyable and frustrating thing about Rocket League the flight. You have to learn it if you want to get out of the lower leagues but it is so rewarding. This game offers a low barrier to entry with a very high skill ceiling. Even with my hours I have a long long way to go before I call myself an expert at anything but that skill progression is what keeps me going. Week after week I can see myself improving and that feels awesome.Fun Factor The variety of modes keeps me entertained allowing me to play daily without getting bored or burned out. I play Doubles (2v2) Standard (3v3) Snow Day (3v3 Hockey) Hoops (2v2 Basketball) and Rocket Labs (Experimental 3v3 arenas). There s enough variety that I feel engaged constantly which is a refreshing change of pace from most games. The custom games are a blast too with plenty of mutators to create interesting modes. My personal favorite is turning the gravity all the way up (which disables jumps) and turning on instant demolitions. Now you ve got a demolition derby. XD If professional gaming is your thing the Rocket League Championship Series is proving to be really popular expect a growing e sports community from this one.Rating I give Rocket League a solid 9.5/10. The execution is solid the content is updated regularly and there are new modes cars and arenas every few months. For the paltry asking price there s plenty of fun to be had. Don t miss this title!!

review: You have a stadium. You have a battle car. You have a ball. You have simple controls. Does that mean the game is simple? Yes! Does that mean the game is easy boring or that it sucks? No definitely not! General Features Rocket League features several modes as example an online mode at which you can play ranked and unranked games varying between 1 vs. 1 2 vs. 2 3 vs. 3 and 4 vs. 4. Of course you can also play with your friends at home via. local co op because it's one of the games which has a splitscreen mechanism for up to 4 players true old school gaming! It also features several offline modes such as exhibition matches against bots or season mode against bots. And of course it also features a tutorial and a training mode which both are well made. Gameplay Rocket League is incredibly balanced. Ever battle car has the same speed the same maneuverability and the same jump height. The only thing which is slightly different between the battle cars is the hitbox but you probably won't notice that the hitbox is different at all. The general gameplay is very fast very fun and very addictive. The controls are simple but mastering the cars and the battle car is difficult. The bots are playing surprisingly good there's a high possibility that you will lose your first games against the bots. Customization possibilities Players are able to customize their battle car by unlocking items which are gained by completing an online or offline match. This includes changing the body decal (skin) paint wheels rocket trail topper (hat) and antenna of the battle car. In total there are more than 150 customization items unlockable which means that there are millions of different customizations possible My conclusion Rocket League is incredibly fun. Rocket League is incredibly addictive. Rocket League is incredibly competitive. If I would have to compare the gameplay to another game I would only be able to choose Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars which is the prequel to Rocket League made by the same developer. I strongly recommend to buy this game even if you don't like sports games as Rocket League feels way different compared to FIFA or PES. In my opinion Rocket League is definitely worth the money.

review: Rocket league is a funny game that mixes cars with football. play with friends for a laugh and have fun or challenge other players with a very competitive style in Ranked Seasons. Lots of DLC Including a cool back to the future delorean time machine (Quick note DLC cars DO NOT give you an advantage whilst playing and only add cool customization) . I have only put a full 24 hours into the game but I love it to bits. GAME PROS Easy to learn with good training gamemodes. 4 DLC Packs. The Ability to customize your vechile in many ways. Ranked Seasons. Loads of maps with different styles. Capture replays of your best moments. Exhibtion mode which lets you mess about with settings like gravity and more. GAME CONS The ability to hit the ball into the goal a soon as the game and or round starts although you can use this as a tactical advantage. This game can really grind your gears even if your not playing ranked. Matchmaking sometimes puts you with people who leave the game instantly or dont know how to play. I honestly can't think of any more bad things about this game its deffinetly worth the money 10/10 Would love to see brum in a DLC for this game

review: Rocket League is life.Rocket League is great.Buy it. BUY IT NOW!If you think it's just soccer with cars you're wrong. It's so much more.This game has endless possibilities and a long list of terms that you might not even encounter until you've put more than 1300 hours in.The combinations you can make with your teammates the sick moves you can pull off on your own it goes beyond your imagination. If you just start playing this game might seem simple and not much fun.But it gets so much more fun the better you get at it.Aerialing through the sky getting a ceiling shot or a pinch safe... it feels so amazing when you're able to pull it off.The community might be somewhat toxic but it's much nicer than most competitive games.Don't like a game? Leave. Don't like a ranked game? Put up with it because the game probably won't last longer then five short or long minutes.The customization of the cars is amazing as well the amount of different decals toppers boost trails goal explosions... most of them even beautiful! I'm not talking about the toppers or antennas most of them are UGLEH .It's just a lot of fun simple to play a few games of simple to quit when tired beautiful arenas I just...can't recommend this game enough. If you want to see what kind of possibilities lie in this game... watch the pro's. They make the impossible happen they make this game seem amazing... and also simple. Don't expect that you can do what they do.But... try it. Try it anyway. BUY IT.

review: It's hard for me to give this game a negative because I really enjoy it (at least I used to). What I can say about this game is I recommend it if you're on a PC (windows) and if you can use it with a controller. What my problem with this game is is the awful mac port and support it's been getting. Around 7 months ago an update was released and it kind of broke the mac version. A few new bugs came in and the framerate was butchered a ton but the biggest problem is a bug with the steam controller. As I said this game is really only worth playing if you're using a controller but with this glitch the steam controller no longer works. I've also heard of people having this problem with a few other controllers as well but I know that some controllers such as the Xbox 360 controller should work. Back when this happened I just decided to wait to see if they'd make a bug fix well that never happened at least a successful one. They've released a few bug fixes that are supposed to fix these issues but they actually do nothing many people (including me) have contacted Psyonix to ask them to fix this bug but all of them have just said the bug has already been fixed and if we're still having the problem "they'l work on it". So really what I can say is do not get this game if you're playing on a Mac even if you aren't going to use a controller. It's just a horrible port I'm not sure if this issue is also happening on Linux but I do remember a few linux users saying they had the same issue.

review: I got this game using a $20 gift card from a friend and it exceeded my expectations by miles. Pros The learning curve is very well done. You always play against players right around your skill level and no matter how good you are you will always have more to learn. It isn't tooo stressful of a game. It runs really well on my computer though there are some complaints on the lower end of specs. Try to at least meet the minimum specs. You can party with other players (on the same platform as you) and team up in 2v2 3v3 and 4v4. It goes beyond soccer with gamemodes like Rumble Hoops and Snow Day. The developers continue to update the game with more community suggested features.Cons The Aquadome arena is very stressful on lower end computers. The reporting system still needs some work. I haven't seen my family since I bought it.

review: I like this games potential. But there are many problmes. I can play other games and will play fine. Smurfs and trolls are very common. Very toxic and community Ok time for a positive part You now get automatically banned for saying offensive words! Im glad to see this chat being cleansed of filth! This new system is so strict it wont even tell you what they consider "offensive" so you get banned from playing the game for almost no reason! Glad they added this cool little feature ) /And to top it all of the people working on this game dont care. they would rather post pone gameplay updates and add new crates and items to make more money. I have played this game for awhile and it is growing more and more toxic and cancerous. I cant play this until some serious fixes have been made. I cant even play without fps drops or lagging ever since the latest update. If this game becomes playable i will totally change my review and play this game again because it is a unique and fun game to play.... only if developers cared about the community instead of how fat their wallets are.. sad.

review: Game Rocket LeagueScore 8/10Recommended? YesWorth a buy at full price? YesI actually didn't think that this would be my kind of game. The controls looked akward gameplay bland and overall not something that I would actualy play... and then I played it... and oh I couldn't be much wronger... you should NEVER judge a book by its cover. Who knew RC cars and big soccer balls would make such a good combo? Rocket league is a big game of soccer but with a twist rather than having people kick the ball instead you control RC cars (which by the way are fully customizable) and must hit the ball via bumbs jumps and turbo boosters. 4v4s are pure chaotic fun with extreme concentrations of action at all times while 2v2s are more tactical and competitive with every moment keeping you on your toes. The game features an epic soundtrack plenty of customizations for your vehicles and tons of fun for you and your friends. Even if you aren't a soccer or racing kind of guy you should still give Rocket League a chance. It just may surprise you.Pros + Competitive play+ Amazing soundtrack+ Plenty of customization+ Many gamemodes+ Up to 4 on 4 games+ Quick 5 minute games+ Great graphics and optimization+ Turbo boosters+ Cross playCons Camera angles can get fidgety Your average teammate will not always be up to snuff Servers with both PC and console players can get laggyConclusion There really aren't any big problems with this game. It offers tons of fun for the price of $20 USD and with friends competitive play will keep you on your toes. I recommend even people who don't really like soccer (me) to try this game out as the fun in RC cars and giant soccer balls just may surprise you.Score 8/10Worth a buy at full price? Yes
title: Rocket League®

review: This game would be good if everything wasn't tied to the server's connection quality Blowing other people up and collisions in particular are the most inconsistant and RNG 'features' in the game. Matchmaking rarely actually puts you in a playable/winable match unless scoring 5 8 goals in 35 seconds is somehow consistantly possible to do. Even after 2 years this is still a problem.The most annoying thing for me in particular is the fact that the game's default position while in the air is pointed downwards so if there is any fluactuation with connection ( on my end or the server end) the game will default your car to that position while flying with a rocket boost so rather than actually flying you get a face full of floor while the car completely refuses to even lean back and actually do what you're controlling it to do.

review: My view on this game? Buy it ONLY if you want to play it with your friends or on single player. The players on the server are (mostly) rude childish and sour losers often abandoning matches and storming out with other players on the team.As far as the game goes it's a lot of fun! The graphics are cool the gameplay is easy to catch and has a good set of skills to master.I strongly recommend it!! Again as far as you don't play with strangers.
title: Rocket League®

review: Edit Respect to Psyonix for making free maps and listening to the community and this game was phenomenal when it first came out but ever since the Rumble update last September the glitch of passing through the ball has gotten so much worse... now on every map I play it seems. When it used glitch every blue moon now several times per match. Which sucks for me since I invested at least $25 (There are some who've spend hundreds) on keys for exclusive cars that sometimes pass literally through the ball or a millimeter to the left or right of it. So when hitting the ball is the entire point of RL said glitch kinda makes it unplayable at least in hopes of actually ranking. It's still fun to play around with friends so I still recommend the game under the circumstances that you don't expect much from ranking. 6/10
title: Rocket League®

review: updated I have put so many more hours into this game I own every version of this game and I absolutely love it. If you don't wanna waste money I'll tell you right now don't buy it the developers need to rework rank still at plat level and diamond level teammates consistently score on you. Another note to point out is that if you win with a teammate 9/10 you will be against them the next round and if you lose with a teammate 9/10 you will be on the same team again. So basically if you and a teammate have bad chemistry your gonna eat two losses instead of one because ranked is so bad. Majorty of players are gold and plat which is imbalanced there is no grind because you win 3 matches lose one and you drop more mmr than you gain and theres nothing you can do cause it matches you with the same teammates over and over and it's extremely hard to even go up one division. Also skill level of plat pc player vs plat console player is extremely different however you can overcome this obstacle by disable cross platform play.old 12/20/17 While the game itself is fun beyond all doubt never play ranked/competitive. This is a soccer game with cars yet all you see up to plat and diamond are hot shots who don't know how to play as a team and were carried to a higher rank. The ranking system needs rebalanced since most ppl are gold and obviously thats unrealistic.

Microtransactions all over the place item trading and people trying to scam you toxic players in literally EVERY match and that's just casual play. I really miss the time when I could just play a friendly game with strangers quietly level up and try some crazy cosmetic combos. In one of my the last matches someone from my team asked me for my level and when I told him he discussed in chat if they should kick me just because of my level. review: It got football and cars its perfect!The game got nice gameplay where teamwork (If not 1v1) is key. You learn to control your car better and better both on the ground and in the air while you play. You can play 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4 and other game modes after your choosing and if you feel like taking on the big boys you can play ranked.The skills you use in this game is 1) Controlling your car2) Controlling the ball3) Predicting your opponent's next move4) TEAMPLAYI love the car customization and how it lets you make the car yours with different cars to choose from colors materials patters wheels boosts and more. A nice game and definitely worth buying if you like teamplay football and cars.
title: Rocket League®

review: Do not buy this game if you get easily frustrated. Lags and bugs related to lags often will cause a lot of frustration for players.1. Disconnected team mates2. Match becoming unplayable3. Random demolitions4. Missed shots because the ball is portingLet's combine this with a loot box system that is completely evil in terms of design.1. Loot boxes can only be opened with keys. Keys cost quite a bit of money.2. You can easily have a situation in which you get 4 times the same useless item out of a box due to increased drop chances of standard items and no protection against redundant drops whatsoever.3. And if you get this useless stuff you could trade it. But who'd want that stuff with the loot chances it has to begin with?

review: 643 games on my account and I'm just playing 1. My Steam game hoarding habit stopped because of this. Don't know if that's a good thing or a bad thing.My first game to break the 60 hour barrier. break the 100 hour barrier. break the 150 hour barrier. break the 200 hour barrier. break the 400 hour barrier. break the 500 hour barrier. break the 600 hour barrier. break the 700 hour barrier. break the 800 hour barrier. why tf am i counting again? i just don't care anymore.It's cool.Waiiiiiiiiiit.....Come to think of it It's my first time to boost in steam just to get a tag.lel5/5 would break more barriers(Since no one really reads this) Random log 160214 started logging currently at 153 hours Just realized the rocket boost is just an extension of your boost skills. Realized this from goalkeeping.160224 Still learning new stuffves. So much variety of skillsets to master. So hard. Still lamenting on why i didn't buy this game at launch.160403 That does it! Solo standard Competitive is the new unranked matches!160423 Broke the 500 hour barrier160511 Broke the 600 hour barrier No matter how much hours you've put into this game. You're still a noob compared to those who have 200 hours and up more than you.160619 Broke the 700 hour barrier Grinding the out of Season 2 before it ends in a couple of hours. Now at Ch 2 Div 5 from PE in a day.160718 Hey look it's 777 hours! What a coincidence.160725 Broke the 800 hour barrierBah. Who cares. Sometimes you won't even know day from night and if it's the weekend already. I love and hate this game. It's love. It's life.
title: Rocket League®

review: Awful toxic waste of human DNA community. In fact if you do like this game I encourage a heavy diet of Cyanide. The game itself is a great concept but... utterly useless.Here is how I get that conclusion.This is supposed to be a fun game to pick up and play just arcade fun if you will but the competitive matchmaking ruined the game for me every single time I played it. The matchmaking doesn't make the slightest effort to pair teams with like skills instead you get two guys who can't seem to find the ball or can't seem to find the correct goal and they continue to be a nuisance... HOWEVER the casual matchmaking is much much better because you can continue leaving matches with utterly useless players until you find a group you really have fun with. This is the only reason I still have the game installed. And this is the only reason I recommend playing. Honestly Every competitive game has this flaw and is the reason I am not buying any game claiming to have a competitive structure. It wastes resources and it is useless.This game is complete fun with the right teamates even when you lose badly you can still have fun and those moments make this game a complete joy to own but when you join a ranked gameplay server you throw all that out the window and the game becomes useless garbage because it doesn't work.Oh and did I mention utterly useless community and microtransactions? Say no to drugs. say no to rocket league.Oh and competeitive play? THis games physics and net code are so bad 1v1 matchmaking is only fun if you love not knowing if your opponent hads warped into your goal or not. The competitive nature of this game can be summarized simply as this A big esport Circle Jerk. Don't waste your time because the moment you get in a comp match and leave it bans you even from casual matchmaking in increasingly annoying and utterly wasteful amounts of time.If I could get my money back on any game I have This would be the one. But since I can't refund such a peice of utter waste of cyberspace I'll troll it for many years.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is one of those games you can always come back to allbeit for a quick 5 min game
title: Rocket League®

review: The core game is great if a little too addictive. As long as you don't spend money on static pixels (DLCs keys for lootboxes etc.) it's decent value for money. That said the community is toxic Disabling chat vastly improves the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: One of the hardest game i've ever played in skill needed.This game sometimes depended on luck when you entered a competitive in gold but as i get closer to diamond i'm keep getting frustated that i need to train to get higher this isn't that easy of a game. I know i'm better then the average but it just isn't like you can boost any teammate you want. You play against real players who at a certain rank suddenly gets brains and will block the out of you.If you're looking for a racing soccer/football and such game. BUY THIS GAME!! It's one of my most played games.
