review: So you're either thinking of buying the game or just checking reviews after already playing it right? You want my opinion after thousands of hours? Well this game is incredibly team oriented so you must rely on your teammates and they must rely on you. So what if one of you up? Yeah thats basically how matchmaking goes. Every game is just a lab experiment on how humans react when trying to work together to achieve a common goal (no pun intended). Sometimes the players on the same team work together and support each other but what too often the case is they roast each other and destroy each others motivation to achieve that common goal.
title: Rocket League®

review: I HAVE NOT HAD THIS MUCH FUN PLAYING A GAME IN A LONG TIME!Edit some of the community has tempered my enthusiamWhen I saw the description of Rocket League I didn't think it was for me then I saw a video of gameplay and was interested. Boy am I glad I gave it a try!Rocket League is basically Indoor Soccer played by cars.Pros +Simple concept allows anyone to jump in and have fun even 6 year olds+Advanced techniques give further depth to gamplay and keep it interesting after the 1st hour+Quick matches allow short or longer sessions to fit your schedule+Drive up the walls or jump for aerial gameplay+Exploding cars and balls+Matches can be 1v1 up to 4v4 to suit your preference+Gamepad supported (encouraged)+Local split screen co op+Online multiplayer+Season mode available+Useful tutorials to get the basics down+Unlockable cosmetic vehicle customizations are fun but not a grind+Reasonable price point+I have not had any online connectivity issuesCons AI tends to score own its own goal more than it should (both your bots and the opposing bots) Others have had online connection issues Public players on your team running you over on your scoring chance Not enough of my friends own this game (yet) Some toxic community members (death threats racism etc) Rocket League Moderator advised "not the devs job" when I asked about ability to report above No reply from developer about my concerns about above (will change if they do reply)Please note I am not a Soccer fan in real life so don't let the real sport influence you.If you think this review was useful please rate it up even if you don't like the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Super fun game. It's not hard at all to learn to play but takes alot of dedication and hours to master. A simple but very addictive game. The base choice of cars is good alot of things to unlock (decals hats antennas etc). Every unlockable are cosmetics so no unfair games for newbies. Getting good is just about practice practice and more practice.They have a fairly good choice of DLC cars taht aren't that expensive. Both a good way to treat yourself and to support the development of the game. Those cars however aren't OP or anything like that. For most players it's just about the looking because you'll slighly notice the differnce between the car. You'll mostly feel it when you'll get super good at the game. Best part of this? The current favorite car of pro players is a free one that everyone has. So it remains fair and cool for everyone.It took me a very long time to get myself into buying this and I dont regret it. I have alot of fun in competitive solo and I enjoy very much playing with friends in casual. Just remain calm and have some fun this game's awesome!
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Playing this on console with my other friends forced me to come back to this game. I orginally got this game on Steam as a gift from a friend. If you're looking for some fun with some friends and family of all ages I highly recommend this. It changes the whole experience. It makes a party memorable. Though I strongly recommend you use a controller. Playing in keyboard and mouse is a straight disadventage and does not make the game worth to buy. But it easily dies off if you don't have any players around. Now you wouldn't get endless hours on this or last the whole day playing this single game. I spend very few hours on the game. The gameplay's simple with a few mechanics. Aerial seems interesting though.It's a decent and average game but not a god tier game. As I said playing this with other friends makes it extermely fun and does make parties memorable. I would give this out a try.

review: Fast paced action multiplayer game that have an strong old school smell (same spirit as the 90's Quake I hoverrace etc). A simple car football game. That's it.Community seens fine also. Most of the crazy stuff that happens in game is dealt with humor by both teams. With a mix of funny physics in a low gravity setting a huge ball that is also a bomb and cars that can fly and jump lots of funny things will happen even if it ends in a panful loss for your team. Surely there are still your average bad mannered "moba kid" around but fortunatelly those are a rare sight.Not much to say. A very fun game with simple ideas and good mechanics really addictive and very hard to master. Recommended.

review: Today's sports games are way too generic and have a lot of AI support. Fifa NBA Pes Football manager. Everything is so repetitive and becomes boring. Meet Rocket League one of the rare sports games where you have to do everything manually and doesn't have RNG (well except some jump resets and similar...).When I started playing RL I had the most fun I've ever had in a game. Kicking and dribbling the ball felt so satisfiying. Even today when I dribble past 2 or 3 opponents or make a nice redirect I feel good.The game also has no pay2win elements. There's no such thing you can buy to "boost" your car. Everything is cosmetic.What else should I say? If you still haven't played this game what the actual heck are you waiting for? Even if you're not particulary a soorts games fan this game is a must play and such a good gaming experience.
title: Rocket League®

review: The game itself can be very fun but don't bother with it until they fix their matchmaking and support. Made it to gold status playing in leagues and since I have had 9 games 2v3 in a row because there is no penalty at all for just bailing on a game. Couple that with the fact that their reporting of cheaters means absolutely nothing and you have a great game turned terrible by the company that makes it. How you can report someone for obvious cheating (blocking their own team and playing goalie for the other team) and then be matched up with them 3 games in a row after that is beyond me. Sad and disgusting but EA gives better support than these guys do.

review: It's footie with cars.That's pretty much it it sounds stupid as as a concept for a game because believe me it is. But this is hands down the best sports game on the market for a long time.It's easy to pick up really difficult to master the game looks good enough the music and sound effects are superb the physics are in house but really consistent and responsive DLC is purely cosmetic new modes being added every now and then Psyonix are literally one of the best devs of the moment.If you are still doubting give it a try during the free weekend. It's 20$ full price and totally worth it if I knew I would've saved myself the steep cost of FIFa this year. IT'S THE PERFECT SUBSTITUTE.Having said that and I guess it's impossible because exclusivity rights but PSYONIX PLS GIFF ChampionsLeague team flags I'd pay for that or BPL or Ligue1 or LaLiga or whatever.Go get it you won't regret it.

review: new update on 4/25 added basketball and about 14 hours of input delay in all modes unplayable until fixed as far as im concernedEdit been a couple months since basketball update where this all started still having input latency issues literally only game i have where this is a problem so its not on my end tried different controllers different usb ports even tried kb/m all to no avail. they keep coming out with all types of new maps n dlc's and everything else but heaven forbid they actually fix some of the issues with the game done with it you cant have a game where theres random spots of input latency as bad as this game has it. sitting here with constant &lt 48ms ping and theres times where what im doing on the controller doesnt happen for almost a second in game ive talked to others who play quite a few saying that they're getting the same issue some are fine with it others not so much. sucks because i used to sink quite a bit of time into this game it was fun as all hell now i cant stand to play for more than a few minutes every few weeks or so because the input latency is so aggrovating. if they can fix that ill change the review back to positive but not a second before that until they do im just considering the fact that i spent money on this game a loss.Edit #2 most major problems with input latency and other things have recently been fixed feel like i can change my review to positive now absolutely fun game when it works right great time sink. glad they finally seem to have fixed whatever the issue was. can get back to playing again.

review: I've played this game for a while and I can honestly say it's one of my favourite co ops.The gameplay is fast paced and exciting. You will get your handed to you when you first start especially if you jump straight into competitive but it's still a lot of fun trying to make that first aerial. Spoiler alert You'll miss...a lot... You can play solo but I definitely recommend grabbing a friend getting on TS/Discord and doing team play.There is DLC and Crates but the items are aesthetic and the keys are very cheap ( $1/key). I've put in 200+ hours and bought the game for $16 so I don't mind throwing a bit more money at the developers who have added multiple game modes for free since I purchased the game. As far as crates go there's not much better systems out there.

review: Product received for free. WARNING This product contains addictive substances.I have been playing this game in pretty much all my free time since christmas of 2016. I'm pretty sure I need help.Rocket League ReviewFor a game with very few gamemodes (in comparison to other multiplayer games) this one is surprisingly addictive. I'm not even a fan of soccer! However there are many many aspects to this game that will keep you entertained for 2 20 200 or even 2000 hours plus. That 'drive' for the next goal the next epic save the next cool new item for your sick newly tricked out automobile... this game has more to offer than just a two goal soccer match.The GamesRocket League comes with a few gamemodes. Dropshot Hoops Rumble and of course socCAR. football for everyone else Each gamemode has it's own uniqueness to it. On top of that there is different types of player amounts Chaos (4v4) Standard (3v3) Doubles (2v2) and my favorite Duel (1v1). Each gamemode requires a different playstyle so don't expect one strategy in one gamemode to work in another!Skill LevelI've talked to friends who say they don't want this game because they don't believe they'd be "good enough" at it. That's silly. While it is true you WILL be bad at this game upon purchase (probably very bad if you're new) you will be paired with others who are just like you. There is a natural ranking system in this game similar to other games with a major difference. That difference is that you are no better or worse off than your opponent reguarding equiptment. There is no decal wheels or rocket trail they can put on their car that will make them a better player than you. looking at you Scorpion from COD. And if you stick with this game you WILL get better. A LOT better.TradingPersonally I love the trading system of this game although expect to pull your wallet out if you want to open crates on your own. get the five key deal for five bucks that way they don't rip you off. You can get some really amazing looking cars from trading. There are so many items avaliable in different rarities and different series of items. Of course that may not be your thing which is completely fine as well.VerdictRocket League is a simple game with a simple objective. Score. How you come about doing it is what's difficult. But when you do score you'll be wanting more and that's where Rocket League shines. This game does well in presenting itself in every way. It looks beautiful it is incredibly satisfying and it has awesome potential for car customization. Overall I'd definitely recommend this drug game.
title: Rocket League®

review: So before I explain why I don't recommend this game I will say it is a GREAT concept and loads of fun. The reason I do not recommend it is because arguably the MOST IMPORTANT part of this game is completely broken the ranking system in competitive games. The reason I call this the most important part of the game is because this is supposed to be the system that sets you with people of your skill however you are more likely to find an equal match in the casual play.Let me explain. To determine which rank you should be placed in at first the game has you play 10 games and because I won 8 out of the 10 games I was placed as a "Prospect Elite" rank for Standards (3 v. 3) which at the time was the 4th rank. Then immediately after being placed in Prospect Elite I lost roughly 10 games in a row and was dropped 2 ranks lower. The baffling flaw in this is that out of those ten games I scored the highest score of all 6 players in at least 7 of those games. The game does not consider how well you performed and ranks you purely off wins and losses. And quite ironically shortly following this my team won several games but I had close to the LOWEST score every time and I went up a division. This rediculous luck of the draw matchmaking system means you could end up playing any skill level player or be the lowest rank even if you scored 7 goals on your own between your "teammates" constantly crashing into you while the other team commulatively scored 8 goals. So even though you scored 500 points higher than anyone in the game you go down a division. Ironically this means that the matchmaking system works better in casual play than in competitive. In casual play other players are placed with you based off their in game level and ultimately ends up typically creating more even games. I can't even play ranked matches anymore because the whole system is a complete joke and I am for lack of a better word baffled that the developers of the game do not notice or do anything about this flaw.

review: It was a fun game a few years ago but I really hate the direction they've taken with it. While the game itself is a ton of fun they still haven't managed to fix servers after so many years and I still will have everybody in a private match just drop from a server. Not to mention the bad lag/rubberbanding on a 200 mb/s ethernet connection.There is also the loot boxes. I know these are becoming regular in games but I still hate it. You unlcok cosemetics through a spinning wheel and it almost feels engineered to make you want to spin one more time. I can't tell you how many times I've near missed a black market or exotic. At this point I don't even try anymore. Some people I know have been able to trade their way to the top and can get basically anything but this requires crazy dedication and time that to me isn't worth it.Finally there is the future rocket pass that was recently announced. It's pretty much a rip off of Fortnite's battle pass. From what it looks like it will have a free and premium version thjat will allow you to unlock items and decryptors for crates (yay lootboxes). Like the Fortnite battle pass it will likely need to be renewed every few months for premium passes. Ontop of all of this there are DLC packs that offer extra cars and if you don't buy all of them you get an annoying bright yellow "SHOWROOM" tab on your main menu showing you all the stuff you don't have and can't have if you don't hand over extra money. This was fine when all the other stuff wasn't in the game but they're seriously asking for a lot at this point. I'd personally be alright with this if Rocket League was a free to play game and at this point it should be. If it was just the 20 dollars I'd say go for it and it would be a 10/10 in my book. If rewards were based on a battle pass style system that you DIDN'T have to pay for that would be awesome. If there were no microtransactions/loot boxes it would be well worth it. If the game becomes free to play I'll change my review to positive or delete it all together. Say what you will about Fortnite but they're doing things the way Rocket League should be doing things and after so much fatigue over lootboxes and microtransactions in other games I'm tired of having it shoved in to my face in the one game I used to play all the time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Spent a lot of time with this game.Had fun playing it. But the people in this game are the least scum of the earth when you see how they behave.Now I'm getting lag spikes randomly through out the game. There is nothing active except for RL but apparently that is enough. Didn't have those before.I am going through cars when i am in supersonic mode instead of blowing them up. With soft touches i am lagging underneath the ball so it looks on the replay like i touched it but it immediately goes down as if i didn't touch it at all. It's like the ball hits a bump but gravity is so hard it just pulls it down again without any movement of the ball higher in the air.Thanks. Honestly thanks. Then the matchmaking is the iest i have seen in a long time. I have to play against GC's with their whole team all the time. I am not good enough to play against gc's for s sake. Just because one of them has a lower mmr than any other on the team doesn't mean that it is fair to put none GC's up against a GC a friend that is probably around champ and one that is maybe diamond 1. The MMR difference is ing 800 you o's. What is fair about that if the overall MMR of the team is that high above yours ?Go yourselfs psyonix honestly. The Rocket pass is a rip off if you are not playing hard all the time since some people have to work almost every day until late at night and can't grind that hard. With the free version you get NOTHING WORTH putting in any effort.Sorry but this game is not enjoyable if you have reached your skill cap and are forced to play against people that make you look like a fool and your team is around the same as you are.Fix you psyonix and maybe then i will take a look at it again.

review: Hey Thanks Psyonix for banning me without proof or reason. Real class. Considering I've only ever defended myself from targeted trolls calling me everything under the sun after they lose. Maybe a screenshot with a support number would be acceptable. Even then a properly timed screenshot could make anybody look like the instigator. You managed friendly fire with this ban. So as a warning to others trolls are becoming a plague by spamming reports on the same person. When you play late like I do you'll encounter the same group of people over and over who verbally harass you until you type something in retaliation. Then the entire team of trolls will report you continuiously every match. Just to find out the next day you're unable to play. Get it together and get the real culprits. The instigators. Even hockey has a penalty for instigating.

review: I have over a thousand hours on this game. This is a spectatular game you can play soccer (which is most popular and default) hockey basketball heck even a version of Mario called Rumble! You are a car that is rocket propelled and your objective is to score shots into other's people net while keep yours safe from enemies. There are hundreds of skills to learn like redirects double touches air dribbles aerials the list goes on! There are thousands of variables to customize your car! There is also ranked modes. Ranked modes 1v1 2v2 3v3 3v3 (solo). There you can play to get to a higher rank and earn sweet prizes when the season ends depending on what rank you were on. If you are wondering what (solo) means in 3v3 it means you cant play in a party. A party is where you invite your steam games to come play with you in this rocket propelled game. So come play the Sequel to SARPBC (Super Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars).
title: Rocket League®

review: Very few games hold my attention now a days.. So it's impressive when one does. I started playing last nite and I'v already put 19hrs in the game.. Let me just throw this out there I HATE soccer. I think it's boring as f***. Tosh (the comedian) said it best with "Watching people chase a ball for 4 hours to end 0 / 0 is not enjoyable unless ofcourse the bleachers collapse and half of Europe dies. Maybe they would score more if they didn't flop everytime someone stepped on their toe."Not a huge fan of racing games and I HATE sports games ( I mean I like to play sports for real but I hate watching them or playing the video game alternatives). But this is way more than just cars pushing a ball around. The controls are amazing. I'v never felt like I'v had this much control of what's going on in a sports game as I do with this. It's basically NINJA CARS. WTF is better than ninja cars?! Thats what I thought.. Nothing. You can jump double jump. air dash and even fly. There's driving on and up walls flips.. You name it. The action is intense your fingers will hurt your face will hurt from laughing and if your throat doesn't hurt by the time your done then you aren't communicating with your teammates and communication is key.. Even if it's call your buddy a d0uche for hogging the ball.. How will he ever learn otherwise?10/10 for me. It's a great game. There are some issues with being able to communicate with other players cause it's crossplatform but I team up with my current gamer buddies so that doesn't really bother me.. Good luck and see you on the field!!!!
title: Rocket League®

review: I'm a fan of some racing games but not a fan of sports games. I'm not even a fan of sports in real life. I finally gave in and played Rocket League and was instantly addicted to it. This game combines cool customizable cars with soccer. Even if you hate soccer you'll love this game. The basic driving controls are like other mainstream driving games but there's other abilites you can do like jump and flip. If you've played any other racing/driving game you'll catch on quickly. This game will have your adrenaline going and make you want more. This game is very well made and fun.ProsGameplayGraphicsMusicCustomizations Car and settings. You can even select what servers you connect to.DLCs One DLC is the DeLorean from Back to the Future.Special EffectsIt's not boring like real sports.ConsThick headed sports fans! I'm talking the "ball is life" sports is a religion can't stand to lose players. While most players you encounter are great there's a few in the game that you just want to punch due to their ego. This game takes practice to get good. So if you're like me and play lots of other games you may not commit tons of hours getting good at this game. When you're not perfect that one jockboy will call you out in chat for being a bad player. If this discribes you do the world a favor and drink bleach. I hate sports because of fans like YOU!AI When you play seasons mode you play with AI. Most of the time you'll find yourself protecting the ball from your own team. When your team should be running the ball to the enemy goal they usually score for them. I found myself shouting at the screen while playing this. To get the fair experience of this game play online.
title: Rocket League®

review: Hella hours in the game so here are some pros and cons. Pros it's fun as hell to play especially with friends. Cons B******* COLLISION DETECTION (1) Matchmaking against players several teirs higher than you on a regular basis (including in my experience a rookie against a g****** legend) fly hards try hard teammates b******* collision detection players talking smack young kids (under twelve) talking smack about f****** your mom almost as bad as a first person competitive shooter physics(2) oh and b******* collision detection. Overall not recommended because the b******* definitely outweighs the fun with friends.1) You are also unable to score on anyone roughly two teirs higher than you since they have had more hours and thus far more experience than you as well as chances are they are flyhards. 2) Literally you enter a match and if you touch the ball at the same time as the opposing person chances are it's going to fly backwards towards your goal most likely flying back almost as if with an aimbot and scoring on your goal

review: It's a surprisingly simple game there's no complicated mechanics or different stats between cars no power ups either no convoluted maps just put the ball in the goal. The simplicity is the game's strong suit after half an hour of getting used to the driving jumping and boosting everyone can have fun as long as you're playing against people around the same skill level.Whether you're a dude who plays on and off once in a while or some autist who wants to spend 6 million hours perfecting your aerials there's something for everyone it's pretty rare to see a game so simple yet with such a high skill ceiling that manages to stay fun at every level of play.
title: Rocket League®

review: I was adverse to Rocket League at first but I saw Yahtzee Croshaw's 'Let's Drown Out' play of it and it looked great. So naturally I bought it. I haven't regretted that.Rocket League is soccer but with rocket powered cars. So it's soccer but actually good. I find myself trapped by its simplicity as the satisfaction from winning and scoring kickass backflip arial goals is enough joy for three human beings. I am one human being.It is one game for two four six or eight players unlockable cosmetics and a ridiculous joyride from start to finish. More fun with friends too in my opinion.I recommend this buy it get good at it enjoy it play with friends. Step away from real soccer and come join us.
title: Rocket League®

review: Like sports games? Like FIFA but always felt it lacked control? Like cars and maybe racing games? This is the game. The second I played Rocket League I knew I was in for a good time. Combines the competitive nature of FPS other eSports games with the fun and creativity of sports in a physics based game not driven by sequences of animations.

review: So i like to play with my friends who are higher rank than me turns out even when playing people that are the same rank as my friend. I still lose 12 13 points per loss. However when we win and beat the people the same rank as my friend i gain 5 6 points. Keep in mind the enemy usually will have a higher team rank than us. Our ranks are champ 1 champ 2 and champ 3. Rocket league has this mechanic in play to stop smurfing. However its litterly beneficial for us if my friend buys a new accound to get reranked to play with us. Even if we win like 5 games in a row and lose 2 we will be even in terms of net points or sometimes even at a deficit.
title: Rocket League®

review: rocket league is a great game about a strange but interesting way to play the game of soccer. The game is a simple thing to understand but deeply complicated as you get into more advanced movements and manouvers that you can execute. The casual gamemode is fun to mess around in with friends and to improve your gameplay before heading into the competitive gamemode and really focusing on improving and rising the many skill tiers that there are. Rocket league is the best 20$ i have ever spent on anything i have ever purchased and i would recommend it to anyone who doesnt mind a bit of a learning curve every now and then.

I learned about this game after I stumbled upon a video of Kronovi playing a match. I told myself I would not stop playing till I was able to play like him. It has been over a year with many hundreds of hours on ps4 possibly over 1000 logged and I am not even close. If you give up easily this game might not be for you. If you truly want to be challeneged then buy and download this game!

review: This is the perfect time to buy this game. With the addition of crates and trading Psyonix is trying to push towards turning into a much larger eSport and with the developing playerbase it's likely headed in the right direction.It's a super fun game no matter where your skill level is at. Even in casual mode the game evaluates your skills and places you with other players in the same area. Smurfing in competitive is not very common and has been actively fought against by Psyonix.One of the best aspects of this game by far is the responsiveness of the devs. If you head over to reddit.com/r/RocketLeague you can find lots of posts with development members of Psyonix openly interacting with the community for suggestions and ideas to improve the game and efficiently put out hotfixes.Get it. Try it. If you don't love it within the 1.5 hours of your beginning play return it. I doubt it'll happen.
title: Rocket League®

review: Review after 300h of gameplay The community is bigger more cancerous. And I'm still playing it no matter what.... I LOVE IT! Review after 162h of gameplay Abandon every other game you're playing and buy this... no seriously just buy this game buy the DLC's heck buy the soundtrack and buy everything else again and give to your friends so you can play together! ROCKET LEAGUE! The most videogame of videogames of the XXI century! First Review Probably one of the most spectular and fun multiplayer games ever made. Better than the prequel which had multi leveled maps and made gameplay a bit harder Rocket League takes the same soccer with cars concept simplifies it to a simple arena amazingly good gameplay and a killer soundtrack. Pros Multiplayer is super funGreat options for costumizationRuns great on low end machines (as long as you don't turn max settings)ConsSingle player can get boring (who plays this game alone anyways)Some lag at the beginning of certain matches (not always)Overall 9/10Multiplayer Game of the Summer Award
title: Rocket League®

review: Not even joking when i say this. 10/10 game except for some minor issues.1. one or two maps are not optimized enough for plebians like me with crappy computers. besides that there are no performance issues.2. I wish there was a spotify connection that let you play your own music while you play (there might be but im just not up to date with it). soundtrack is still SOLID3. Loot crates. couldnt care less for it. 4. Customization is perfect except for tiny issues. Like not letting you place your decals where you want to and too many hats that you will never use (but the option is there)Other than the ones above nothing else is bad about this game in my opinion. Beautifully crafted.

review: nearly 400 hours in and the game is still plagued with issues that it had from day 1 and those are as follows.1 Horrid matchmaking which matches you with people well away from your skill is a joke and should have been fixed a long time ago2 Pants servers they are awful even though your ping is good if not brilliant that does not dictate how smooth the game will be the rubber banding is shocking and at times unplayable.3 And the saving the best for the last THE POOR COMMUNITY! the community is a bunch of autistic gob shites who don't know thier from thier elbow who will flame you constantly even though they are the ones making the mistakes and loosing you the game generally resulting in a division down or de rank in competitive. Psyonix need a way to filter out the trash players who troll constantly causing de ranks as it is unfair to the genuine people playing the game to have fun and enjoy themselves. It down right puts people of the gameMy word of advice for this is keep a cool head and report anyone who is trying to do what I described hopefully us the community can make a difference and make the game more enjoyable in the process.Don't get me wrong this game has plenty of good points and it is genuinely a fun and enjoyable game that has some the best tense and brilliant moments of a comp game I have played in a long time and the Esports side of this game is amazing to watch I love this game however as you can probably tell that recently I have just been fed up and let down by the above points which is a shame.if you do buy this game make sure to have someone or a group of friends to play with as it will make it more enjoyable than soloing your way through it.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is extremely entertaining and matches only last for 5 minutes so it's easy to jump into when you only hve a small amount of spare time. The gameplay is fast paced and the matchmaking is on an ELO basis so you generally find an equal matchup for your skill level.The only negatives I would mention are random lag spikes (which thankfully aren't too frequent) and the fact that bots are hit and miss they either set up shots/goals perfectly or they camp their own goal and then fail to save even a soft shot meaning you can't trust them. They also seem to delight in deflecting your shots away from the opponent's net and deliberately shooting the ball back to your own half. Better bot AI would be my number 1 update
title: Rocket League®

review: airshots are hard made my gambling addiction worseI love this game enough to play it through some hard times. I play this game to get through hard times. Learning curve is an understatement but unlike a lot of games all of your tools are there from the moment you start playing just you and your car. The community is actually friendly ( overwatch) and bad players do get berrated but they are equally likely to get scooped up by an open group or in my case a team that'll help them get better. This game is unique in both gameplay and the community. 10/10

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.

review: Tremendously fun game. It has one of the the highest skill ceilings in any game I saw to date but is also very easy to get into and feels immensly satisfying at any skill level.The matches are short enough so that even if you're getting crushed you don't feel like the pain never ends and if you're enjoying the game (not necessarily winning yes) the length is perfect.Indeed it's a deeply enjoyable game even when you're loosing most of your matches as performing any defence/shot on goal/goal etc feels great even if at the end of the day you didn't manage to win the match.The addition of custom game modes and periodic fun updates makes this a definite must have in my oppinion!

review: I absolutely recomend this game to anyone who loves competative games. You don't even have to like sports to enjoy playing this either.It is fast paced intense and quickly over. Matches only last five minutes so it's easy to say "just one more" and oops you're late for work.For me the keyboard controls was very hard to use so I absolutely recommend a contoller.There are a bunch of unlockables to customize your car to help you stand out. Pros Competative addicting tons of people playing easy to learn controls (with controller) and fun for all ages.Cons Other players can be quite verbally abusive. Recommend chat turned off for the younger players. (Me? I'm amused to see how seriously people actually take this game so i leave chat on)

review: Not since the original Xbox game Deathrow have I enjoyed an arena based futuristic sports game to this extent. It's very intricate and skill based (with a little twist of luck thrown in for good measure). Time spent better play and is very rewarding. It's fun it's innocent (my 7 year old loves to play it although to this point I'm not letting him play online which is perfectly acceptable given all of the season options customisability mutators training and usage of bots). That being said I've only encountered friendly play online and of course you can mute chat features and report players etc. if that ever becomes a problem. I found this game for around 12 dollars and that was a STEAL considering how much gameplay I'm likely to get out of those dollars. Also my 360 controller works fantastically. It's not terribly likely that this will appeal to someone and then NOT turn out to be a worthy purchase. Just watch some gameplay vids and if you're like me you'll want to pick it up. Great game.

review: Don't buy the game UNLESS you play drunk or have friends.The game has bugs that developers don't care enough to fix. PC port is horrible. They didn't put too much thought in making the port. Cross network is definetly a no no. PS players have terrible skills overall and you can't even tell them to stop acting like a mad dog. Unranked is bugged at the moment because servers for cross platform and PC platform are combined into one giant up meaning you can't play unless you wanna spend 30 40 minutes waiting. Ranked is a nightmare. You get sent to ranked from unranked because you want to play competetive games but what's that? Even the worst players can screw you over? Yes yes they canI had challanger 3 and couldn't go higher because everytime I won a game I would lose the next one due to receiving the dumbest human alive. There is no limit. You can get a newbie in your game to get rising star and he can completely you over. This morning I had 10 games in a row of complete idiots. Me against 2 people on my rank and let's see who is my team mate oh look a newbie from 2 ranks below... Alright 1 game can go bad right? This situation can't repeat 10 times in a row right?? As I said if you are the type of person who doesn't give a flying buy it you'll enjoy it because even ranked is full of people that "just wants to have fun" by ing around.If you are the type of person to win your games in ranked and enjoy competetition... don't even dare.

review: I played this game a while ago on PS4 and loved it. I don't know why but its just super fun and hilarious. I recently went back and played with a friend and it was the most fun I've had in a game in a while. They added a basketball mode (which is really cool) but the standout mode is Rumble. Its basically the regular game but you have special abilities that you can use during the game to spice things up. Theres a magnet ability which pulls the ball towards you theres an ability that lets you switch spots with an enemy an ability to knock the ball forward sending it to (or away from) a goal and many more abilities you can use. This game was fun before but now its worth buying if you haven't already or going back and playing because of Rumble. Lots of fun!

You play as Lightning Mcqueen from Cars 2 Nuke Tokyo and fight other cars in an all out deathmatch to see who can put a ball in their designated hole in the wall first. My personal favorite character in this game is the car. Over all the game was a disapointment and I would not recommend to my worst enemy. 6.5/6

review: Gotta recommend this game. My fiancee and I play splitscreen all the time and the hockey mode is our favorite (we're Canadian of course). Honestly though it's a clean crisp responsive program with excellent design. Our XB360 controllers are a natural extension to the game even though I play every other game I own with a mouse/keyboard. I never feel completely out of my league because the servers do a decent job matching us with similarly experienced players. The in game "achievements" (making a save scoring) pop up and make me feel pro in the middle of a match even if we're losing. I never cared too much for sports games (played a few for Sega Gen back in the day haha). It feels exciting to make a great save or have a close match. The devs keep it well updated and the community seems pretty active. We exclusively play onlnie pick up matches but the "season" system is fun as well. Well worth the full price but I see it pops on sale pretty often.

review: First Review Progression system is amazing at each title you feel like youve improved so much and the levelling system more accurately reflects your ability than most other games.Gameplay Simple and easy. Its no pay to win purely based on you and your team mates skill levels. The sky is the limit.Graphics As good as you could want from a gameVersatility As far as car football goes the game allows you to do anything. With boost air rolls double jumps etc... you can hit the ball wherever it is and how you wantCustomization Crates are a little expensive for their value but if you are willing to buy on the trading market prices are fair (just be aware of scammers) cars are extremely customizable but not to the extent they look stupid. There is still the element of simpleness that I think is better.The game has had me hooked since purchase. There is just something about the gameplay that means once you reach a certain level it is just so much fun (when you are comfortable driving up walls and in the air)
title: Rocket League®

review: Norwegian fish pieServes 4Preparation time Less than 30 minsIngredients30g/1oz unsalted butter½ tsp caraway seeds30g/1oz plain flour500ml/17fl oz full fat milk100g/3½oz cream cheesesalt and freshly ground black pepper½ onion peeled finely chopped130g/4½oz canned dolphin friendly tuna drained flaked160g/5½oz pasta (such as macaroni penne or fusilli) cooked according to packet instructions drained60 80g dried breadcrumbs6 8 anchovy fillets cut in half lengthwaysMethodPreheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6.Heat the butter in a frying pan over a medium heat. When the butter is foaming add the caraway seeds and fry for 1 2 minutes or until fragrant.Add the flour and whisk to a smooth paste. Continue to cook stirring vigorously for a further 3 4 minutes then pour in 125ml/4½fl oz of the milk. Whisk the milk and flour mixture together to a smooth paste.When the mixture is bubbling add another 125ml/4½fl oz of milk and whisk until it is bubbling and incorporated into the mixture.Repeat the process with the remaining 250ml/9fl oz of milk. Continue to whisk and simmer until the sauce is smooth and thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the cream cheese. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.Add the onion tuna and cooked pasta to the cheese sauce and stir until well combined.Pour the mixture into an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle over the breadcrumbs and lay the anchovy fillets on top. Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the breadcrumbs are crisp and golden brown and the sauce is bubbling.

review: Edit I just nominated this game for the "Just 5 MORE MINUTES" Award. It deserves it. If you haven't bought this game already do so. It is worth every penny. I am not a big fan of racing cars but I am a big fan of soccer. The mixture of RC cars and soccer is FANTASTIC! This is actually a game that feels like playing soccer as you have to develop skills to be good at the game. The devs are also excellent and keep on updating the game with goodies and new game modes. The game is very easy to pick up but is HARD to master. As a bonus you can get to pwn PS4 and XboxOne players. 5/5

review: Product received for free. I'm an old school SARB player. For those who don't know what SARB is it's the prequel to this game on PS3 which is Super Sonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars. I played SARB for about 10 years. Rocket League is decent but SARB will always be superior when it comes to skill base. ANYONE can get good at Rocket League. It's slower paced than SARB and the ball moves slower. SARB is faster ball is lighter and moves faster which requires more skill. Rocket League is fun when you're matched with someone who knows how to play correctly and properly especially in a 2v2. 2V2 is where all the skill is not 1v1. In 2v2 you need to know how to play with another person. You need to know how to set up catch set ups know how to do kick offs properly and just having common sense. If someone trash talks you and says let's 1v1 I'll beat you just laugh at them because 1v1 doesn't know skill. Knowing how to play a 2v2 properly is skill. Forget 3v3 and 4v4 as all that is is people running around hitting the ball just to hit it with no strategy whatsoever. There's no teamwork in 3v3 and 4v4. These live twitch events with Rocket League would be more fun to watch if they were 2v2 not 3v3. Having a 3v3 tourny is really dumb. Anyone can play a 3v3 and hit the ball when it rolls in front of the goal on the opposite side. Anyone who plays anything other than 2v2 and thinks their good is bad. That's just how it is. Any old school legend SARB player like myself will tell you everything I just said. If you want to be respected by us then play 2v2 properly.
title: Rocket League®

review: ROCKET LEAGUE!!!!For an overall rating i would highly recommend this game to any gamer as it meets the needs for everyone. Even if you are a solo or multiplayer person this game will meet your requirements. However this game is technically football but with cars many gamers like me DO NOT like games relating to sports or espcially FIFA though Rocket league enables a very entertaining environment for anyone.ProsVery fun and energeticGood creativity when upgrading your car in the garageNot like any other Sporting gameCompetitativeConsUsing a steam controller might be easier for you instead of a keyboard Ranking system needs a little improvement in competitativeQuite difficult to generally improve your skills even when using training

review: Rocket league is like drugs. The more you play the more you want to play.Rocket league is simple on the surface but needs communication and strategy between teammates at higher levels. It is the only E Sport that has ever captivated my attention. It is a bit of an emotional roller coaster at times though. Sometimes I feel accomplished after a hard earned victory while sometimes i want to kill my teammate.Rocket League is a game you need to put hours into to get better it's all about practice practice practice. You also need to be patient as being too aggressive will leave your goal wide open which is bad. One good thing is that controller and keyboard both work well. Most people say that you need a controller but I love keyboard and mouse just fine.Would I recommend this to a friend?Yes. In fact I have already reccommended this to all of my friends.

review: REVIEW AS OF VERSION 1.19 9/10tl dr s dopeThis game's premise is pure and simple Football/Soccer with Rocket Powered Turbo Cars. If the concept alone isn't enough to get you interested then maybe you should get your head checked because that's the coolest thing I've ever heard of in my entire life.Like the concept the gameplay is also simple and there's a whole lot of fun to be had with it. Turbo boosting into the ball (or other cars) is extremely satisfying and you feel badass when you actually make that all important save or dunk some scrubs with an intense goal.Now for the actual review PROS + Very smooth and responsive controls + The game controls decently on keyboard though a controller is recommended + Ranked Play is a thing + Car Customization has just enough choices to make your car feel your own + Skill based + Cross platform play* + Rocket powered cars. + The game can be just as fun to watch as it is to play (imo). + Splitscreen play. + 100% customizable camera from FOV to the camera's angle and stiffness. + Matches last only 5 minutes so you can sit down and play a quick game if you don't have much time + DLC packs have been handled extremely well with decent pricing and a decent amount of purely cosmetic content + Mutators have been to the mix for private games which alter certain physics/aspects of the game and can amazing fun to mess around with + AMAZING soundtrack consisting of mainly electronica styled music. + Random item drops for extra toppers and such. This used to be a negative for me as you could get duplicates but in the new update you can trade in 5 of a same grade of item for a more rare grade. + Multiple game types and maps to spice things up. + Easily accesible e sports leagueCONS You will be bad at first this can discourage some people The AI is absolute garbage. Especially in Hoops The game can be extremely repetetive at times. The different game modes are just slight variations. ? It may just be me but I'd like an option for the soundtrack to continue playing during gameplay.CONCLUSION If you're okay with a bit of repetetive gameplay and want a game to just pick up and start having crazy fun right away I'd absolutely reccomend it for you.If you don't like the idea of having to practice A LOT to get better at the game or the repetative nature of it all is offputting then you'd be better off spending your money elsewhere NOTES *As of right now there is no way to actually party up cross platform which is sad because I have a lot of friends who play it on PS4/XBOX One and not PC. Hopefully this issue will be remedied. You can however all play in a private match using the room name and password system.

review: Love the gameplay but hate the game. I enjoy playing this game fairly often but unless some major problems are fixed I can't give it a positive rating. If you want a fun easy to learn but hard to master game this is it for you. However that's only in singleplayer (NOTE in SP be prepared for autistic AI players) or if you play with friends. If you try to play competitively you will not only be put against players much much better than you you will also experience unbearable lag. As a final rant many maps are horrible to play on (Neo Tokyo in particular).If it's on sale for $10 sure grab it. For the current price of $24 (in NZD) try something else.

review: This game is not your average racing game. So much so that it's not even a racing game it's soccer (futbol). But this isn't your average soccer game either it's soccer with cars. In my opinion this is one of the best games I've ever played. I recommend if your looking to get this game to purchase the Game of The Year Edition which includes 3 DLC packs which contain 2 cars in each pack for a total of 6 cars the packs also consist of an assortment of other customization items. During sales the GOTY can go down to $15 so snag it when it's cheap. If you're looking for a fun multi player game this is the one to get. In Rocket League team work is crucial you can just pop into a match and play with a random person but communication and understanding your teammates play style is key. Whether you want to just mess around with friends or play competitively this game has it all. You can start up a party with your friends and play a private match or go online and choose between casual or competitive. Rocket League has more than just Soccer though you can play hockey with cars basketball with cars Rumble which is soccer with power ups or Dropshop which I have no clue how to describe. There are a wide assortment of maps and cars currently there are 41 cars in the PC version of the game 10 of them being cars you get by playing 20 being DLC and 11 being Import bodies that you can get by trading or opening crates. The first of my favorite aspects about this game is that it is multi player based but you can play solo in a team or play 1v1's. The second aspect I love about this game is that you are in total control of the car you can steer on the ground in the air you can jump boost fly all normal car things so first you'll need to learn how to control the car before you even get into how to play soccer. The last aspect I LOVE about this game is how original it is. Sure there are many soccer games and many driving game but who woulda thought of putting those to together the creativity in this game is intense. They could've just tried to follow the formula on how to make a game that will sell just throw some guns on a dude and have him shoot things but this game broke the mold and Psyonix truly made a masterpiece. P.S. Sorry for the Essay. &gt .&lt
title: Rocket League®

review: Worth the price. The amount of fun I've had playing this game was worth much more than what I paid. Play soccer with cars in 1v1 duels 2v2s 3v3s and even a chaotic 4v4. That not your cup of tea? WELL GOOD THING THERE'S MORE MODES!Try out the hoops mode. It's a 2v2 gamemode that's basketball with cars. It's my second favorite gamemode. That still not good enough for you? WELL THERE'S MORE SO SIT IN YOUR SEAT AND GET A LOAD OF THIS! There's a super crazy 3v3 mode with abilities called Rumble. I have seen some pretty crazy things happen while in Rumble and it's my favorite gamemode to this point. You can freeze punch magnetize plunger and pull yourself towards the ball. You can kick people with the shoe make them go super fast or teleport to players. It's pretty crazy. If you don't like any of those than you can try the hockey mode. I'm not a fan of it but some people like it and others don't and I'm just one of those people who don't like it. OH I FORGOT TO MENTION you can customize so much it's amazing! If your a rich kid wanting to spend money than you can customize even more with Premium things and champion crate things. I'd give this game a 69/70 for it being pretty good.

review: Rocket League is probably literally my favorite non story driven game I have in my entire library. I have a lot of games.This game is absolutely amazing. It's just polished SO nicely and is so smooth. I really can't think of any downsides to the game.Frontend The game looks absolutely amazing. Seriously. The aesthetics and design put into this game is incredible. It has a large variety of gamemodes and tons of features for you to customize your car. The game is fast and has almost no loading time. Many people play the game and it's so easy to meet friends or start a party with your friends and battle others online.Backend The physics in the game are handled very nicely. There's really nothing wrong with it. It's hard to believe you're lagging when the ball is still moving smoothly. The bots are pretty good. Only issue I've ever had with them is they're not so smart in season.Additionally Psyonix creators of Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars update this game very frequently. I have recently been playing Hoops (basketball form of the game) and Snow Day (original game with a puck with little to no friction). Psyonix's most recent update adds a new gamemode called Rumble which adds powerups that you get in a certain timeframe. It's absolutely hilarious and addictively fun.I really don't have a single problem with this game. It could probably be worth $30.00.

review: Rocket League is pretty cool but it has some major flaws. Pros Awesome premise Soccer with over the top sup'ed up cars and trucks.Stunning Visuals Awesome stunning way cool graphic and super high res game.Ease of use Quick setup for online action.Quick setup for offline action.Buttload of changeable options Lots of avenues for offline action.Lots of cool mods.Lots of cool vehicles and vehicle tweaks Cons Long term buzzkill While the game is very fun and exciting it is very one linear.It gets boring (at least for me).The fast movements give a headache after 3 or 4 hours of play.Online has no "safe zone" Online has no "safe zone" for beginners to learn. Their only online choice is to fight random players most of which seem to be pros and vets who have had the ganme since its initial release over a year ago.Any expeienced athlete knows that a n00b has to start off with other beginners and advance from there.The only other option availablke to n00bs is to play offline and for most games that is fine. However...Horribly Idotic AI's Even on hard mode the AI's lack of knowledge of how soccer actual works.No sense of what a goalie is.No sense of positions.Horribly Idotic AI's The AI's lack any sense of teamwork.A profound example AI's will intentionally ram their own teammates (users) and steal the ball from a user who is one their own team. WTF?Horribly Idotic AI's I don't mean because they lack strategy because they do.In the last 48 hours I have watched my own teammates (AI's) drive the ball across the field away from the opponent's goal and put the ball right into our goal. I have also seen my opponents do this too.I can't keep track of how many times I have seen this.Horribly Idotic AI's Seriously WTF is wrong with the game's coders and planners? Are they idiots???Didn't they test the AI's? Or did they assume the AI would work perfectly becasue they used the UT 4 engine?Would I recommend this game?No.Most of the people I know care more about gameplay and mechanics than graphics.And given how many people have gone back to 'retro gaming' I would say this is a trend.

review: This game made me smile laugh and have such a wonderful time after such a long time. Gave me hope during a tough time of my life. I know my hours are too less but hear me out. It's been less than 48 hours since I owned the game and already have 18 hrs in not to mention I also work a 9 hour shift. This game is just too good!!!! Perfectly competitive equally entertaining and the best part is you will laugh through your defeats. It attracts all types of gamers. You will get your kicked initially though but I haven't ever seen any player talking till now. Don't take the defeats too heart enjoy the experience but keep learning the mechanics. As for the developers they are awesome. To have a growing community even after 2 years since release takes a special game and an extra special set of passionate developers behind it.Buy this game this one is worth your money and time trust me. I'm even planning to buy the dlcs which btw are only cosmetic and don't impact gameplay thus not dividing the community. Buy the dlcs to support developers like these who actually deserve it.

review: Hey I do know that I have not played that much on here but I believe it is not need for this game. This game is a fast paced Dream of a lifetime. I actually remember thinking of ideas like this with my friends about how I wish you could incorporate some kind of faster pace mechanic into a soccer game. This game unites a great number of players to from my friends that play fifa games to friends who just want to have some fun in some fast pace action. I especially love the fact that you cannot by your way through this because there is not way to do this. The only reason to spend money is for custimization. This also is just a entertaining to unlock and custimize my little road runner for the numerous amazing tracks that you can play on. I could not have more fun in 5 mins. Most of the time. When I do not play with my friends the game becomes not as fun because of the inability to fully communicate with my team. Is there a way to communicate with your team? yes. Does even 50% of the community use it? not really. This game again is really fun but is even more fun with friends because some people I get paired with are just not right for playing this game. I just had a game where a kid just made puking sounds and talked about how he wasn't trying. If I wanted to deal with kids not allowing me to enjoy all my time in a game I would have my own kids. I have also had plenty of games where the people playing are just plain sore losers and sore winners the whole time. I liked it when "What I Save!" meant you got a good save. I hate it when it is just spammed over and over from both your and opposing teams about how someone didnt come close to saving it. The Game gets a 8/10 but the community that I have played with get 3.2/10. If I wanted saltiness I would go play League of Legends.

review: Incredible game!I felt compelled to write a review for this game because it has quickly become my favorite. It is such a simple concept but with unlimited potential for thrills on every game especially when playing against human opponents online or locally. Highlights Highly flexible options for accommodating split screen and online players in a party or random match Physics that just "feel right" Player has full control of the ball in contrast to a traditional sports game like FIFA where the computer does the dribbling and you just make passes and shots Challenges and rewards the player's sense of spatial orientation (great use of a 3D environment) Potential for very simplistic run and hit playing or for spectacular aerial displays of skill Abundant vehicle customization options Workable AI and "season" game mode that serves as good practice The developer continually offers free content in the form of interesting gameplay modifications like basketball and hockey modes Cross platform play with XBox One and PS4 which makes for a very large pool of online opponentsThis is one of those special games that causes its players to become addicted to it and are really hard to put down once you start playing. The length of each match is long enough to enjoy but short enough to "go for one more" long after you intended to stop playing. Besides the loads of fun RL offers as a party game local or online it also hosts a well populated community for competitive online gaming and a ranking system that entices players to want to climb to the towards the top. Even for offline play the game provides AI opponents which although sometimes are goofy enough to score on their own goal they do provide a stiff challenge for beginner players.You cannot go wrong with this game and I highly recommend it.

review: Who knew that mixing football and nascar would result in Rocket League?Rocket League is fun with friends but doesn't decline when playing solo either. Although the game recommends playing with a controller keyboard is definitely playable. Although I don't have a controller myself after 5 or so hours of playing with KB I got used to it.The matches are fast ( 5 minutes ) and there are enough different gamemode types to keep you playing as well as extra car customization. Overall I would recommend this game to anybody who likes racing football or both. The community is friendly and matchmaking takes around 30 seconds tops because the game still has a very active playerbase.Thanks for reading!

review: Rocket League one of the most styilsh fun difficulty scaling play making hype inducing "physics pls" gamesCars? isn't that a little overused?Ah wait the cars are RC styled so that's not really that common.Wow nice customization lmao hats this looks fun.Wait a ball? is this... cars playing soccer football?Yes it is billy now sit down this is my review nobody called you hereRocket league the sequel to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars has you playing football with radio controlled rocketpowered cars. Yep. It is in fact true.Jump around boost crash into people to knock them out of the park or just delete them for 3 seconds hit the ball make plays spin and do retraded things to get the ball into the enemy goal.*Multiple gamemodes*Fast matchmaking*In Development still*Sick plays lots of those*Amazing graphics (TY UNREAL ENGINE)*Unlockables that aren't a pain to get and are actually good cosmetics*Tons of keks in various manners and from multiple sources*Amazing replay system that has 100% camera freedom and cinematic montage making stuff Physics are kind of unnatural and sometimes B.S. but not very often and you can get used to them most of the time. I do not recommend playing this without a controller.If you want to get more information watch a video on the subjectIt really catches the fast paced whackfest that is this game.Seriously it gets really stewpid.The difficulty curve increases as you learn techniques that aren't actually that special but that can help often and dive deep into basic mechanics and teamwork. There's nothing else to master so you either get good or get out.Oh and there's also splitscreen for local play since screencheating isn't a thing here.

review: If you're into cars and/or sports or it into games then this is the game for you. This is one of the games anyone can pick up and start playing. Some will get really into it and play it for a thousand hours while some might just play it a few hours once in a while with their friends. Either way you will enjoy it. The essential mechanics are easy to use but extremely difficult to master which makes it a fantastic game to play over and over again.Even if you are really bad sometimes you might just get the epic goal or save and it will feel really good. Or even if you get good you will surprise yourself with skilled plays you never thought you caould make.One of the best games I've played in a long time. 5/7 Kappa

review: This game.... THIS GAME! The epitomy of easy to learn tough to master. I've got my Xbox360 controller for pc and love to sit on my on the couch when i want to play my sports games. This game is cheaper than most has less content than most (kind of) but as an action game fan and mostly non competitive gamer this has hit the nail on the head. Even when playing against the AI it feels like you're competing for something worthwhile with different the teams performing and reacting in their own way to get the job done at the end of the every season you choose to start. I've also only had GREAT experiences with the multiplayer matches ive had even with my crappy ping from my 3G connection in South Africa. The single player is typically there for practice for the real deal and has some serious competition of you choose the right difficulty (just try and see how deep this rabbithole goes). I've felt COMPELLED to buy each piece of DLC as these guys deserve the money. THIS WILL BE A CASUALS GATEWAY TO COMPETITIVE GAMING.

review: Ok so I reviewed Rocket League when it first came out and I decided to review it again. This game is one of the best multiplayer games I have played in a long time and while $20 might seem like a hefty price tag it is 100% worth it.PROS Fully customizable cars Cars that can fly Multiplayer extremely fun with friends Simple party system with local and online friends Flying cars Great tutorial with different aspects of the game so you can focus on one thing you are bad at (i.e. defense offense areals etc.) Soccer but with cars Did I mention rocket powered car soccer? Competitive and amusing at the same timeCONS The occasional cancerous player but what Steam game doesn't have those? Free play is a bit limited seeing as the only thing you can do is drive around and be a loner "Season" mode isn't too rewarding and is kind of bland DLC doesn't really contain much only some new car types and paint for those cars only. Something like a decal that could be used on all cars would be really cool in the future *hint hint* Less enjoyable when not playing with friends
title: Rocket League®

review: I woke up one morning ready to play rocket league like no other game before. I was excited to see that i was about to rank up on my next win i was battering my opponent with goal after goal.. All of a sudden he was having a comeback with 2 minutes left 5 1 he was pushing me.. i was playing worse as the game went on conceding goal after goal and getting frustrated as to why i couldnt defend. What was happening? i kept asking myself am i seeing things.. 5 4 15 seconds to go he scores making it 5 5 i was screaming at mt T.V asking it what the f**k did i do to deserve this beads of sweat rolling down my forehead.. 3...2...1... Kick off.. We both boost at the ball.. The ball goes flying over my car.. He scores with 5 seconds to go 5 6. i throw my controller across the room A button flys out i get up and start abusing my T.V. turn my pc off and go to bed10/10 IGN would play again. but prepare your buthole for those kickoff goals. omg rip. xx

review: So this game is a great amount of fun I put about 30 hours int othe game my first week and I was having a blast. I would recommend this game to anyone as long as you have someone to play with.With that is where I have my issues. It was a good amount of fun at first I lost an won about an even amount of games. It changed once I hit "Pro" Which isn't a rank only to show you've played enough games to hit level 20. At that point all of my games changed I was placed into games against teams of either two or three and we were all singles on my team.Due to this excessive amount of games played against pre made teams I started losing more and more games. My team lacks the overall coordination the enemy team has due to a lack of effective communication. I now only win about 2 3 out of 10 games that I play.With that said I am in no way "The best" at this game I would say I'm average most of the time my teammates are around the same skill level I see myself as sometimes lower sometimes higher but because of the lack of communication we have it's very difficult to pull out a win.So it comes down to this if you have a few friends to play with I would highly recommend this game. It's a very fair game that relies mostly on skill and a bit of sheer luck. It's very fun but no one likes to lose constantly.I have 230 games played and am level 24 I had around a 56% win rate when I hit level 20 and earned the "Pro" title since then my overall win rate has dropped to 51% since then.

review: if you come to see review about this game you're in the wrong place. but if you come to see fried rice recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 2 cups enriched white rice 4 cups water 2/3 cup chopped baby carrots 1/2 cup frozen green peas 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 2 eggs soy sauce to taste sesame oil to taste (optional)Directions 1. In a saucepan combine rice and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat cover and simmer for 20 minutes.2. In a small saucepan boil carrots in water about 3 to 5 minutes. Drop peas into boiling water and drain.3. Heat wok over high heat. Pour in oil then stir in carrots and peas cook about 30 seconds. Crack in eggs stirring quickly to scramble eggs with vegetables. Stir in cooked rice. Shake in soy sauce and toss rice to coat. Drizzle with sesame oil and toss again.

review: First of all pretty good game! I tried it when it was "Free Weekend" i liked it alot. Most fun with friends! Its also fun to play 1V1 very intensive gameplay you never know where the ball is going to land and i love that kind of feeling!The things you can put on your car dont seem to matter. I would say that it would be kinda awesome if for example you switch your old car out with the one you just got. And then i would Drive Jump or boost better )They need to make more gamemodes i really liked the one with "Ice hokey" where the ball was flat because then you would think about not jumping because if you jumped then you would not hit it. So after i played that i was very happy to play other gamemodes than just that one but sadly there is not any other gamemode.So all in all pretty good game!9/10

review: Seriously there really isn't much bad to be said about this masterpiece of a game. Beautiful Graphics. Unlockable Cosmetics WITHOUT payments. Terrific gameplay that's hard to master but easy to learn. No EA involved (probably what made this game so great). Hectic and hilarious online games with friends. Even a single player season mode?!?The only thing that I really see as a problem is how the game can get a bit stale when playing alone. Besides that though this game is just absolutely amazing. I highly suggest you pick up this game. A very good purchase for the price.

review: For clarity I've never purchased or owned a game for two systems before. I got this game for free with my PlayStation Plus membership. I loved it so much I bought it here on Steam.This game is wonderfully fun. Every detail and gameplay aspect has been perfected from the stadium sizes to the boost flying physics to the hat system.Finding an online match has proven difficult but that happens with newly released games. Cross platform (PC/PS4) play is promised and I look forward to it.Overall I can't put this game down and you won't be able to either.

review: I mean at this point you already know if you should buy this game. It's been out for 2 years now. Why are you even reading this review? What are you doing? Do you just browse reviews for fun? You know you aren't going to buy it if you didn't buy it two years ago so why are you hear? If you haven't heard of it I genuinely question your life choices. now you've me off. Why are you still reading? This paragraph is just wasting your precious life away by the second. Get out now. Stop reading. Tick tock the clock is ever ticking. You won't ever relive this second. Bam. It's gone. You wasted that second by reading a review for a game you already know you won't buy if you've already heard of it. If you are buying it what took you so long? Oh my god you read so much of this. .... You could've had an aneurysm just then. Then you would've died reading a long review for a two year old game. How would that make the people around you feel? Friends? Family? Do you even have those? My god honestly just just stop. You are gonna hit a picture of somebody masturbating pretty soon if you don't. Tick tock the seconds tick by. Tick. That second is gone. Tock. That second is gone. It's so sad how you choose to spend your precious time. You could be in Paris seeing the Eiffel Tower. You could be in the Galapagos Islands seeing the most interesting life on this Earth. You are reading this. I hope this motivates you to get out there and enjoy life. Because in reality we have so little time and the time keeps slipping. Please take this as an important lesson to enjoy life. Don't play Rocket League. it. This is a negative review now. Enjoy your life away from a computer. See the world. Canada Germany Peru and New Zealand are all there as are so many others. But then again the best way to enjoy life is to do what you want. If its playing Rocket League or WOW or anything else. Do that. Do what makes you happy. You could want to see the world so what's stopping you? You could just want to play Rocket League so what are you reading this for? Christ almighty go and do you. This is a positive review. Buy it to enjoy your life. I need to take my own advice as well. Why did I write this review I could've just played Rocket League instead. Go away and live life however you may see it to be appropriate. Enjoy the life given to you. I bet you weren't expecting this from a steam review page but there you go it's here.

review: Product received for free. When you have just started playing this game you can feel the electric rushing through your veins every time you touch the ball. It's a really heartwarming feeling and it makes you happy to some weird extent.The game has a really bad concept cars playing football but the developers were able to execute the game so well to the point that I might even consider playing it for the long run.However I would not recommend this game to the people who have no friends that own this game. If so you would just end up grinding and raging. It's a fun game with a fun concept so it is better to play this game with friends.Also the developers need to tweak the cameras a little bit to optimize the users' gaming experience.I rate this 7/10 not because it sucks but just because it does not fit my preference.

So this allowed me to really get crazy and have loads of fun. I already have done many videos for youtube of the game and now I find it difficult to reimmerse myself back into Season mode because of the chaos that is created with the mutators. Honestly there really is nothing to dislike about this game and everything to love. If you want a unique simplistic yet chaotic and fun game this is the game you need right now!

review: A simple game to pick up but absolutely one of the hardest to master. It's endlessly replayable unlike anything I've ever played and is incredibly fun from the start becoming even more fun as you improve. Psyonix (the developers) truly care about the community and regularly improve the game based on players' input offering tons of free content in addition to very reasonably priced DLC. For $20 or any price for that matter you'll struggle to find another game that offers as much multiplayer fun as this one.

review: Let me get this straight you want me to tell you a review about this game? Whoever you are you might as well go to the curators because if you've come for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place. However if you have come for an outstanding chocolate chip cookie recipe you've come to the right place. Ingredients1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar3/4 cup sugar2 large eggs1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract1 (12 ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips or chunks2 1/4 cups all purpose flour3/4 teaspoon baking soda1 teaspoon fine saltDirections1. Evenly position 2 racks in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. (on convection setting if you have it.) Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone sheets. (If you only have 1 baking sheet let it cool completely between batches.)2. Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl cover and microwave on medium power until melted. (Alternatively melt in a small saucepan.) Cool slightly. Whisk the sugars eggs butter and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth.3. Whisk the flour baking soda and salt in another bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients with a wooden spoon take care not to over mix. Stir in the chocolate chips or chunks.4. Scoop heaping tablespoons of the dough onto the prepared pans. Wet hands slightly and roll the dough into balls. Space the cookies about 2 inches apart on the pans. Bake until golden but still soft in the center 12 to 16 minutes depending on how chewy or crunchy you like your cookies. Transfer hot cookies with a spatula to a rack to cool. Serve.5. Store cookies in a tightly sealed container for up to 5 days.For a Rocky Road Bar 1. Lightly butter a 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Make the batter as per cookie recipe and fold in 1 cup chopped walnuts along with the chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake until the edges are light brown and the batter sets about 45 minutes. Cool slightly and cover surface with 4 cups marshmallows and 1 cup chocolate chips. Broil at least 8 inches from the heat until marshmallows turn golden brown about 2 minutes. (Keep an eye on the marshmallows and turn the pan frequently they go from golden to char in a wink.) Cool cut and serve.
