review: The best innovative game i have ever seen. Mixing cars with football / basketball is really very creative.I don't see any reason for not buying this game if you like football.At first you only drive around the ball like crazy after you learn how to hit the ball properly aim properly fly properly fly and hit properly fly and aim and hit properly. When you can fly properly you become veteran already.Enjoy will reach it's climax when you realize actual difference of this game and a normal football game )Let's go to the like/dislike/pro/cons/bugs ( no bugs because i couldn't find any serious bugs. )Things i like Matchmaking system The matchmaking system is based on your hidden mmr ( there are different ranked and normal game mmr ) That means you will be likely to match with a bit better or a bit worse than you. Menu For FPS testers like me main menu has the same render ratios with the game itself. Adjusting video setting is very easy compared to the other games. Menu Menu is quiet simple and straightforward nothing unneccessary. Game physics The first thing you except to be good from a game like this would be physics. And this game has good physics. No weird ball moves no weird car noclip action. As excepted from Unreal Engine. No serious penalty for leaving the game. You get no penalty in normal game. If you leave a ranked game it will count as loss.Things i don't like When you join a server and not every slot is filled you enter a free play mode which you can play with the ball freely before the game starts. But when every slot is occupied free mode is closed and you wait for every people to connect. That oftenly lasts around 15 second. If a player with poor connection comes that becomes more than 20 seconds. For a game which has 5 min playtime 15 seconds are worth considering. I want to exit the free mode when all players are ready to play not just ready to connect.Pros There is no difference between a mere buyer and well paid player. If you have talent you are good. If you are trained enough you are good. Nothing is based on money. Absolutely nothing. All cars have same speed same jump ratio and vice versa. Only hitboxes are different. Fast development Much way to customize your car. You can adjust every single detail of camera Almost no blunder bugs. Games last 5 mins if you are quickshotter this game is for you. Good community. I almost didn't encounter with trolls or toxic players. Too many rooms to improve yourself. Only 1 con i could think of )Cons When the time is over match ends when ball falls to the ground. No matter where it is. Yeah the game will be over even if you are 0.1 second close to score. I love the game but i call this t. Game should be over when the ball leaves the penalty box and falls to the ground.When just learnt to fly anybody would fly to the ball and score a very nice own goal 9 / 10 )

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.Just joking. I'm just mad because i lost like 10 games in a row. Why my mates always noobs ???Haha good game. Love it

review: I am not into sports or into online competitive games for that matter. I play single player I like a story....With that said Rocket League is super fun and addictive. Cars with rockets playing soccer...yeah it's that fun.The community is very mature (...uh...in the sense of "having been playing a while " not in terms of behavior) so it can be daunting as a newbie to get involved especially if you're just here for fun and have no desire to become ueber awesome. Still it's super fun and you can just ignore the trash talkers trying to spoil your good time. Definitely more fun with friends but still fun solo.I've played with keyboard+mouse and with a controller. IMO the controller didn't add much except for allowing local split screen multiplayer. The "analog stick" didn't actually behave analog y and yielded no finer control than just pressed WASD.If you have a Mac you'll want to run this in Windows via Bootcamp not in OS X via the Wine wrapper you might find online. It runs literally 3 times faster in Bootcamp.

review: You have no idea how many time i passed playing the prequel on my ps3 with my friends and even 1 or 2 years later we would still play it without getting bored even though we would have loved a sequel! Years have passed since our last match but today out of nowhere while i was on the store page i saw this! Within the first screenshot i immediately understood what this game was and i bought it. SO MANY FEELS! I love it! I searched the first one on steam so many times somewhere somehow i wanted to play it on PC since i switched to pc gaming but i found nothing until now... At a first glance it seems like the first one enhanced like an awesome more detailed with everything better version but i just tried the free mode so basically i saw nothing of the game. But STILL! Even if it ends up being just a super enhanced version of the prequel (really improbable) it would still be one of the funniest game you'd ever play! Buy it you will have a lot of fun and if you play it with your friend in local or online... you will never play anything else again this game is the 100/10 Another thing i want to say about the game is the existing local co op . So many games on pc have only the online multiplayer but this is one of the good ones with the local for you and your friends thanks there still are good developers out there.

review: This has got to be one of the most addictive games i've played. Easy enough for a beginner to pick up and have a good time but complex enough that after 100+ hours of gameplay I'm nowhere near one of the best nor can i do all of the cool tricks you can find people doing on youtube (or occasionally see in game). As time goes on you'll find yourself going from only playing on the ground to climing the walls to hit a ball or use boost to fly and hit a ball near the roof.It's meant to be played online and that's where it excels. you can play anywhere from 1v1 to 3v3 in ranked matches. unranked also has a 4v4 mode. There is however an offline mode that you can use for practice but that's really all it's good for.you get the occasional prick who takes the game way too seriously but the overall community is very great as well.only down sides that i would like to see fixed is the occasional crash (very rare) as well as the ranking system.while the ranking system is decent and overall does a good job it would be nice to be able to gain rank points despite a loss if you put in a really good performence. have those points you earn in the game itself mean something in the ranking system if you score enough of them to overcome the points lost due to a loss. maybe at 500 points or so have no loss in ranking points even if you lose the game.

review: HEADS UP TO MAC USERS FROM AROUND THE TIME PERIOD OF NOV. 15th 2016. Just wanted to put out the PSA here and let y'all know that it just doesn't work on my mac as well as many other folks' macs. For those that I have seen say that it DOES work (for reasons that none of them ever explain or attempt to explain which unfortunately makes me just think they're trolling) all say that the framerate is pitiful and really you should just run it on pc emulations regardless. As for me and many other people who fit the minimum hardware/software requirements stated above when the application is "launched" it says "You can't open the application "RocketLeague" because it may be damaged or incomplete."Please google this and see for yourself many of us see the incompatibility prohibit symbol over the logo. This is a fatal issue that has not yet been addressed as far as I can see and I have been reminded that the mac version is still in the beta stage. Just a heads up to those of you considering spending x amount of currency to purchase this for mac because you heard it WAS available for us mac folk. As of now it actually is NOT available to us and you should spend time researching past the advertisements. As of now I'm probably gonna go find out how to get a refund which I've never had to do before on Steam somehow.Sorry to spread the word J.V.Jones

review: At first glance this game obviously looks really cool. I mean it's Soccer. With cars. The thing is eventually more and more people and Youtubers start playing it and then I at least had a few second thoughts. It was seeming to be one of those games that a ton of Youtubers play and is really popular. For about a week until everyone ends up hating it. (I'm sure some great examples came into your head. Not going to name any specifics c ) Anyways after playing the game it seems that isn't the case. The concept really does last and has some surprising depth to it. This is one of those games that is very repetitive but always fun. It's the kind of game that can have you playing the exact same thing over and over and not get bored. The thing is it isn't the exact same thing. That's why people play it. In hopes that the next match they'll win or get an achievement or do some cool trick or maybe just have fun. So all in all this game seems to be the game that everyone wants but nobody has as many of my friends among many other people really want this game but are a bit intimidated by the price tag. Honestly if you really think the game looks cool and want to try it out I'd say go for it. It's a fun game. At it's core it's soccer a sport which hasn't gotten old among other sports for hundreds or even thousands of years. If I had to summarize this game in one word I'd just say... fun. Whether you're playing online offline etc. There's still enjoyment to be had. I feel this game is at it's best when you're on a team where you can really cooperate with your teammates perhaps essentially getting some friends getting on Skype and taking on the world. Or have your friends split up to fight each other? Anyways the game at first may seem difficult to grasp and it might seem that you'll never get much better but it kind of happens. I was at a point where I didn't see how I could actually get better. There wasn't really anything I could learn. I knew how to do everything I was just a bit inexperienced not the best at timing etc. I thought I really couldn't get much better yet I've slowly been able to beat better players. This was quite a long a bit off topic and slightly redundant review but if you read it props to you. xD Anyways to wrap it up if you truly want to know whether or not this game is for you the only way to know is to play it. ) (Besides Steam refunds are a thing now just in case.)
title: Rocket League®

review: I've spent a total of 480 hours in this game on steam and since the xbox release probably put another 150 hours in. I'm just here to say that if you have $20 to spend and have a competitive itch that you can't seem to fix then look no furhter than rocket league. Since the introduction into cross platform play with PS4 and now Xbox they variety of skill level and the amount of playerw on the servers is tremendous. It was sinking close down to about 50k or lower on high traffic hours but at night it would go down to about 30k. But after the xbox and ps4 additions its around 110 120k on high traffic hours and around 65 70k around the later hours.To wrap things up this is by far my favorite indie/casual game in the world. When I purchased I was just looking for a game to play in between work and school but it has now taken over most of my free time and probably became one of my top 3 game of all time. 10/10 Would recommend to everyone but it might not be everyone's cup of tea. Enjoy if you decide to try it out!

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.

review: Amazing game Pretty much everything about this game is great. The game is easy to pick up and play casually alone or with friends but is very hard to master. After 500+ hours on PC and around 800 900 on PS4 I can still guarantee that I will not stop playing Rocket League for quite some time. Pros Easy to pick up hard to master Exciting gameplay through a variety of gamemodes from normal 1v1 to 4v4 or non standard modes like rumble hoops dropshot and more. Progress through ranks in competitive modes of 1v1 2v2 or 3v3 and get rewards for your accomplishments at the end of a competitive season. Deep car costomization with dozens of cars decals toppers antennas and much more. Player to player trading allows you to trade items you don't need to get items you want. Many different training modes. Practise on others' or create your own training packs. Season and other offline modes allow you to practise against bots. Save replays of matches where you feel like you played very well or scored an amazing goal or save to rewatch again from different angles speeds and show your friends. Crossplay between platforms makes match queues very short thanks to the massive playerbase. Frequent updates to the game adds new features and improves on old ones. Cons Sometimes toxic playerbase. When trading you may encounter many scammers. As long as you have common sense you shouldn't be able to fall victim to a scam. Can be frustrating at times when you lose a lot or teammates play really bad. Learning curve is sometimes very steep. Becoming consistent in your play at the same time as trying to learn new techniques can be overwhelming at times.I can't really find any more cons and I might have missed some obvious ones but nonetheless it's an amazing game worth a try. I'd give it a 9/10 it's great and the only real flaw in the game I see is how the matchmaker and competitive points works but I am sure that's something that's going to be improved as the devs gather more feedback and data. It's not really something that will matter anyways for most )
title: Rocket League®

review: Great game and a lot of fun I have very few complaints about the game. One of them is that it seems the game is running 1/2 a second slower than what it is displaying. In a game where everyone is sub 50 ping the replay of a goal never looks exactly like the shot you lined up theres something wrong.The second issue is that the front part of the car was given some kind of physics defying kick boost to make it work properly. This is not an issue for the ball but if you tap a play you can send them halfway across the map with very little boost invested (just a tap before you hit). This kick property shouldn't apply to hitting other cars.Cars are all speed locked which is fine and to some extent the ball speed is as well... UNLESS you do something called a pinch which brings the ball to hit the frontend "kick zone" of your car in which it will move anywhere from double to three times the max car speed this should not be a thing.

review: I can't imagine needing to even write a review for this game. It's reputation already stands firm in the gaming community. It's an amazing game with an incredibly high skill ceiling and deep mechanics.What I can offer are a few pieces of advice/information Pros 1) Can be played for 10 minutes or 4 hours straight. Matches are quick.2) Extremely high replayability lots of achievements collectibles playlists practice challenges and user made content.3) Very easy to play with friends.4) Beautiful graphics (although I will say there is weird stuttering sometimes that Psyonix has not admitted to R9 390 no issues with other AAA games...)5) Very addictive game. Super fun to play and like a great sports game some moments are epic!Cons 1) If you play alone be prepared for a community that is made of many "next big superstars" who will criticize you even when something was their fault. This is really an issue with any competitive game in 2017 and I will admit is a low blow.2) Even though you can play against/with PS4 players there is no real way to communicate other than pre set "quick phrases". I find this very annoying also you cannot befriend them.3) Servers Random lag even with proper port forwarding open NAT and fast internet. The rubber banding will happen not all the time though. Lag is an issue because this is a reaction/skill based game.4) I hate to say this but honestly Psyonix's matchmaking algorithm needs work. You will be stuck at a certain rank (playing without a dedicated teammate) because you get paired with the worst players 3 games then decent players 3 4 games which just leaves you in limbo for perpetuity. I'm serious when I say this. This matters because if you want cool wheels and stuff that are rewards for matchmaking you need higher ranks. I'm not talking about the top ranks either. Someone with an MMR (hidden "skill" value) of 600+ should not be stuck in challenger III forever due to teammates. You should be placed on teams with people of very similar MMR. When there's 20 000 people in the same playlist I'm sure it's possible to match people better.These cons are not really a big deal until you get "ok" at the game and reach a middle ish skill level where things are extremely hit and miss. They also do NOT break the game and I still play all the time (and I play many games).

review: Ah. Cars with rockets and soccer. What a good combination.The title literally describes what the game is. You have controllable cars that you use to send the ball towards the opponent's goal. Combined with rockets allows for insane movement that can send you flying and do cool tricks when scoring goals.The game can be played online or offline. You have two options when playing online casual and competitive. Casual doesn't focus on ranks and instead moves you to a good server to play on even when the game has already started. This is a good option for practice. Competitive is just like any other competitive game you start a new match and try your best to go up in ranks. Casual and Competitive share the same 4 modes which include Solo (1v1) Doubles (2v2) Solo Standard (3v3 but no queue in party) and Standard (3v3 with queue in party). Casual contains other fun gamemodes like Hoops Hockey Rumble and more.The community on this game is very pleasant and continues to rub away toxic players. The developers on this game regularly hear community feedback and continue to make improvements to the game. The game has a decent ban system and removes the negativity with its word filter. You are also allowed to spam in game chat (which you can easily disable chat from the settings) that adds to the fun of the community.The game doesn't dissapoint with its visuals. It has great shaders realistic grass (WOAH!) and bloom that is incredibly strong. Visuals doesn't look too great on its minimum settings however and causes some rendering issues but I guess that is a problem with having a mid tier computer.The servers aren't great however and sometimes you can get matched on a server with 80 ping (and is considered good by Rocket League (?)). The ball can sometimes miscalculate on the clientside and server synchronization isn't great when matched on bad ping. Not to mention you can also easily drop out from the game if you have some packet loss. Sometimes the game cannot start because players fail to connect to the servers. This is probably the worst aspect of the game.Overall if you can live with the horrid matchmaking servers and love to play soccer with a little twist on it get this. It doesn't get extremely addicting but it's fun to play every once in a while.

review: I walk into my rocket powered vehicular vehicle with my non existant body and drive. I then learn that boosts are a thing.I boost at an inconceivable speed probably past ing mach 12332.I notice that you can drive on wallsI notice that you can drive on walls while boosting.I boost onto the wall at mach 12332 into a fellow teammate.I notice that my teammate has been shot into the middle of the field from our side.I notice that my teammate has hit one of the opposing players and the ball is shot into the enemy goal.I notice some saying Pool Shot! At the top of my screen and learn that I have scored my first goal.I notice that the enemy team has lost and my teammates are screaming wtf was that you just did you god.I myself in amazement and learn that this game is probably going to rip a hole into my real life and a rocket league sponsorship into my hands. GG 12332/10

review: Rocket League is an amazing game! Well worth the $20.00 price tag. It has a perfect learning curve with room to always grow and become a better player. It's better with friend or at least people you meet that you play well with. Even a 2 vs 2 game can be a tad frustrating when you're not on the same page as your teammate. A lot of unlockables customization and enough cars to choose from. They've also already added DLC to add more add ons and even 2 awesome new cars. (DLC was $5.00 and well worth it.) The only problem I've been having is when I have a great game with another player or players and after the game I will *Shift Tab* to bring up the list in which shows "Players"/"Recent Games" to see who I'd just played with. Maybe because it's a cross platform game I am unable to see this. Although I've had a couple people add me I have yet to do so. So I'd say make sure you write down the name(s) of players you want to add.

review: If you are a casual player then this game is a great time and I highly recommend.Competitive is broken. You always get matched up with people who ing suck and if you are not Kronovi you will go nowhere. I think there needs to be a better system for matching you with teammates. It makes me very angry when I am forced to 1v2 against two people who are very good. I also think that in competitive BM'ing should result in a ban. It makes me very angry when for example I play the best I can and I miss a shot and my opponents instantly spam "Nice shot!" I literally want to ing kill myself most of the time while playing competitive. I also think you should be allowed to leave competitve games without having a temporary ban from ALL matchmaking. It is not fair that if I am placed with someone who is not good and I have no way out of the game. Psyonix your game is ing broken and I hope you either fix this piece of game or kill me so I do not kill myself out of frustration.

review: This game seems so incredibly simple but for such a simple game it's insanely fun the way I found this game was my friend had it on his wishlist so I checked out. I thought $21 was pretty affordable so I decided to give it a try. I've had this game since yesterday morning and I've already put 12.5 hours into it. The graphics are great car designs are comical yet accurate the tutorial is easy to understand different gamemodes including season mode offline free play online and exhibiton and it doesn't matter whether or not your offline or online the game is fun to play either way! I would easily give this game a thumbs up and reccomendation!PROS Great graphics Fun to play Simple Online Mainly friendly environment Etc....CONS Bots can be idiotic and carry the ball right into your net Have to have wifi router nearby or in a good spot or will be incredibly laggyThat's all overall a phenomenal game! Well done!9.5/10

review: In my opinion the best and most sports like sports game ever made. Controls are tight movement has complexity matches are competitive and fast paced. Servers have been bad at times but only right after updates and honestly is to be expected currently from games with high concurrent player counts. My only other complaint is the existence of a crate based loot system which typically preys on children or people more prone to gambling which is an awful practice. Gameplay wise this is an incredibly well designed and thought out game. I foresee even more hours of playtime to come.

review: I'm not gonna give you the regular spiel about the game modes general information and all that crap you can google that.Car soccer. Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars. I'm sure this game gets a lot of ridicule because of its unconventional and rather odd design but rocket league is what an ideal game should be like. Very fun with friends and easy to understand and play but have a exceptionally high skill cap (I'd even say its one of the hardest games I've ever played). I got into this game because a couple of friends wanted to try the new game on steam by buying a four pack it seemed cool at the time. Everyone in comms getting excited over scoring a goal but after playing for a decent amount of time I've realized that asides from being ridiculously exciting at times this game can be absolutely gorgeous when you really start dedicating time to it. Pulling crazy tight angles on a shot crippling an opponent with mind games and doing things that people could have never imagined to be possible is what really makes this game. Youtube is filled with Rocket Leauge montages and they are just a glympse of what your muscle memory and this game is capable of. The community is ever evolving in the first competative season the apex of skill was comparable season 5's Platinums. I'm sure theres tons of stuff tricks and techniques that we haven't even discovered and as a community we're a long way from mastering the game. And of course the wonderful community a mixture of PC xbox and PS4 based conglomerate. And one thing they all have in common is their What a save! bind. Yes the players can be toxic yes they get frustrated and insult their teammates and want to forfeit 10 seconds into the game but thats all games out there. Its probably ones of the least appealing parts about the game but its something you have to learn to deal with. But dont get me wrong there are tons of players who are willing to laugh at mistakes and provide actual criticism but those are of course a rare find. The mutes reside at the top of this hierarchy.And yes this game does have microtransactions solely for cosmetic purposes. And some might argue even for slightly advantageous purposes by buying DLC cars which "perform better" but thats really not the case. The cars are all personal choices. It all depends on what you feel comfortable it I recommend starting off with the cars that you think you like visually speaking and then refine your taste by trying out the other ones. The microtransactions themselves are not that big of an issue its great for gamblers who get a big boner out of spinning the wheel or even those people who never play the game but just love stock trading simulations. Oh and apparently in the new update they will be introducing a method to accure purchase only items for players who dont want to spend money. More on that in the future.Asides from that solid game cheap fun competative trolly Idunno its in neat. These guys psyonix had been sitting on a damn gold mine and all they had to do is make it look a bit a nicer and boom one of the top grossing games on steam. Cuz yanno this isnt the first game its a continuation of their indie action/thriller Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars real great story memorable characters youre not missin much but oh boy someone messed up in product design with that bloated ing name.
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros the idea itself is great game mechaincs and controls are good you start with all basic cars unlocked and only get cosmetics for playing so no performance increase &gt it's fair you can make playsCons matchmaking is broken (the wait is too much for a 5 minute game sometimes insane ping(300ms+) and sometimes i have to wait for minutes sitting alone/almost alone on a server) in general you only get into a game by the time matchmaking is considering ALL skill levels and this usually leads to unbalanced matches the community is disappointing in randoms (toxic people leavers)Verdict If you are a solo player don't buy it but if you got some friends to play with you shoud consider it escpecially when it's on sale.

review: I love this game. Played it while it was free. SO. MUCH. FUN. But I can't recommend it particularly for Iranians like me. This game won't work for you. Rocket League blocks their servers in Iran. It can't connet unless you're using a proxy which will increase the ping to uplayble levels. So if you don't live in the handful of countries who are boycotted by RL servers by all means buy this game it's awesome and fun! But I won't and never will since I can't play it in its current state unless they allow Iran to use servers.

review: Rocket league is a game based on the concept of football however it adds cars to the mix instead of players and has a wider range of ways to defend and attack as well as save those all important shots.This game is not the quickest game youll ever learn as i myself have played only 7.5 hours and have only scored a total of 6 goals therefore you can see how much of a grind it can be well actually its not a grind because its not boring it is actually very fun if you have friends as in the start you will find the game very frustrating without the teaching of a well expirenced friend so you should always find one.If you put many hours into rokkie and pro traning for goal striker and arieal you should find your self catching on to how to play the game in no time.Having this advanced training in the movement system of this game will help you in the long run.I think that this is a well crafted game with great gameplay and a great concept so i give this game a 7 out of 10.

review: My skills in football games such as Fifa involve accidently shooting to tackle someone and then doing a slide tackle dribble to take a shot at goal from behind the half way line. In fact my real life football is barely any better (although I am the king of toe punts). My skills in PC games are perhaps demonstrated by me taking a screenshot and posting it if I beat a friend suggesting for those of you with U grade English that a win is very rare. So maybe a football PC game wasn't the best idea?This doubt in both my own idea and the idea of a friend who thought it might be a game I could actually be in the top 90% in was further confirmed to me when I bought the game on Steam rather than so that I could request a refund if the game wasn't to my ear wax loving Asian food loathing taste.7 hours of gameplay later Rocket League is continuing to entertain me. While occasionally the server lags to take in my OPness and my car sometimes fails to move for a few seconds (next time I'll check the service history before buying) the game on the whole is great and I would thoroughly reccomend it.In fact the game now reckons I'm a "semi pro" which while it's an honour to receive such a prestigious award also scared me as the prospect of playing people who weren't noobs was to me a mix between London Dungeons and falling from a ladder (after somebody walked underneath it) to an early grave. Luckily the game seems much the same as before and the sky has only turned black after 9pm.The "semi pro" status does however confirm to me that I am in that top 90% and perhaps this is my game. Many reviews rave about the novelty of doing a scissor kick in a car. I may have done one myself but I am not entirely sure what a scissor kick is despite trying to simulate it with some left handed safety scissors and a nut (the food not the other sort for anyone who is accusing me of castration). Anyway before my mind digresses further...Rocket League is one of the best games on Steam in my opinion and I would thoroughly reccomend it to anybody who is blind and only has one arm so that I can get a few more wins thanks! )
title: Rocket League®

review: Honestly I don't recommend this game and I am tired of it. So much so that I'll be uninstalling it.For starters the performance is abismal on Mac OS I never saw an update that addressed the performance issues present on this operating system. Before the general update (for everyone) that resolved the problems on the Aquadome map that was absolutely unplayable on Mac OS now it is just bad. Lots of people have server issues not being able to join matches sudden lag spikes and general random disconnects. This has never been worse that it is now. They don't care.The matchmaking and ranking systems are still broken and don't allow for a natural progression that accomodates for the improvement in skill of the players.The last update introduced terrible changes in controls/UI. To join a match you select the categories you want to join on matchmaking and then press the start button or the A/X on the xbox/playstation controller but there such a delay that sometimes it doesn't even register or register twice and you end accidentally adding a second player.People often say that they buy keys or the dlc to support the developers of this game I don't agree or think it is a good idea. Their lootbox system is even more exploitive than the ones implemented in other more criticised games like overwatch and etc. You have to play many hours to receive a random lootbox you have to buy keys to unlock the lootbox. Which have not a trivial price but a high price. And then when opening said lootbox with a purchased key you are subject to a random but weighted (which means that some prizes have a much lower probability of appearing than others) process that determines your prize.Furthermore these prizes are not only of cosmetic value they also unlock cars which technically are "characters" in this game and each one have different characteristics and stats meaning that effectively you have to pay to play as certain "characters".This is the reason I don't recommend this game anymore although I have played it for many hours (with increasing frustration).
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is a litteral waste of time if you want to play a game for more than a few minutes straight with no downtime. You better be ready to do a whole lot of waiting almost as much as playing in some cases. Here's a quick list of what I want to see before I can recommend this game to a friend. 1. Skip replays whenever 50% or more of the players want to skip it. There's always that one guy who doesn't press the button. Screw him. In a 5 minutes match 6 replays at 10 seconds per replay that's 1 minute. Litterally 20% of my time is spent watching replay. Wtf.2. Whenever a team forfeits end the match immediatly just like before. Once again a 10 seconds replay is just a waste of my time to go through when one team has already surrendered. 3. Another 10 seconds can be saved if I can start looking for new matches immediatly rather than looking at the winning team's car. I don't want to look at my car I don't want to look at my teammates' cars and I certainly don't want to looke at the other team's cars. 4. While waiting for a new match especially in competitive play put people that are looking for a match in a free play ring. I'm playing competitive... I want to get better... This is what I got to do now to go into free play Match ends. Wait for replay. Wait for cars dancing. Find match. Exit to Main Menu. Wait for main menu. Scroll down. Hit Training. Hit Free Play. Either make it automatic or make it a button right under Find match. 5. Speaking of Free Play remove unlimited boost. I hear that's how it was a long time ago. If I go into free play to practice it's not doing me any favors to practice aerials and such as I won't have unlimited boost in a match and I won't know how far I can or can't go. 6. In Solo play it feels like face offs are essentially 50 50. Make a tool for practice or fix the face offs. 7. While in a party while not the leader just gray out the Find Match option. I shouldn't be able to hit find match much less search if I can't find a match. Not only that but if you forget and do it anyway by mashing A a pop up comes up to tell you that you can't do that. Just gray out Find match. 8. Speaking of pop ups MAKE THEM DISMISSABLE BY PRESSING B. That's just common sense wtf.
title: Rocket League®

review: I can't blame this game for anything even thought they are having server problems on the launch it's obvious that the devs are doing the best they can to solve everything to the point that some hasn't sleep today working.The gameplay is 11/10 no one can disagree on that.The art/graphics are 10/10 outstanding if you like that style.The soundtrack is simply amazing .The community as far as I've seen on the forums rocks.Pretty much everything in this game seems AAA even though the budget was for an indie game at the start. I hope they use the money they've got to go on holiday and to continue updating this game with the finest content after that.Thank you very much for this masterpiece Psyonix.A satisfied customer.Edit (12/30/2015) This is still the best game I've played in many many years it can be as casual and as hardcore as you want but will ALWAYS be fun for you. The updates are constant (we've had already three DLCs but there have been MANY more updates most of them including content that had been requested by the community and seasonal collectibles FOR FREE.I'll repeat myself but it's worth for these guys Thank you very much for this masterpiece Psyonix.A satisfied customer.

Abilities? Pre game positioning Vehicle stats (Some vehicles are better at certain positions) Skill trees? review: Obviously a very popular game the idea is fantasticly simple and fun. Unfortunately what really lets it down is how laggy online games can be. I'm in the UK and I throw a lot of money at my internet connection yet a significant portion of the games are just so dissapointing due to constant lag glitching. Don't get me wrong you will get games where everyone has a decent ping and you get a fantasticly responsive game out of it but there are far more games in which you will find players yourself and the ball glitching around the arena like in games from the dial up era.If the match finder had a way to filter out people with slow connections then I would definitely recommend this game unfortunately the best you can do is filter by region so you are always going to get matched with kids playing on terrible broadband wirelessly forty feet from their routers with several walls sitting between them.

review: Game in all honesty is fun and cooperative however from time to time a added report and kicking feature would be appreciated. Mose players respect others and play fairly and apologize and then are accepted by their teamates for mishaps. In some cases though I have witnessed players become harrassed and antagonized by others who play in the game with them. Oftenly disabling of chat and muting sometimes is not enough. Oftenly my friends and aquaintences say that they are often messaged after games with horrid comments from said "evil" "unfriendly" "uncooperative" players. Yes kicking features should be deemed from a concept of excessive comments that are profane rude or offensive to others. Also a in favor rule of team members wanting to remove players from their team must be considered in a vote as much as penalty functions against the opposing team. Perhaps maybe a inclusion to where opposite teams with "evil" players may prohibit those players from aquiring the needs to destroy other players vehicles. These features need to be added in for the reinstitution of old players who had left and give more reason for new players to join.

review: Firstly my responce to this game is that it could be the new game that i will be playing for a while and yes i have been. (only because i don't know what else to play) This game lacks developer support as it was promised common updates when it recieves updates so slowly and the developers really still have no idea how to keep the game interesting. review: Don't buy it yet if you are from the Middle East it lags like crazy at the moment and I wish if there was a LAN mode atleast so we can compensate the lag and play in a LAN party while they fix it. not worth the money at the moment until they fix the lag.Edit the lag is worse if I choose the nearest servers (Middle East) and still with my Cable connection in the city 100Mbps. It is an amazing game but with really crappy servers for the Middle East.Edit2 Game still suffers from online lag I am still waiting for a strictly LAN mode.Edit3 After almost 200 hours my level was reset to 1 now I am a smurf! Thanks Devs for your crappy update style!Edit4 Forget Edit3 they restored my level but now I can't log in when you can't log in to rocket leauge servers it doesn't matter what level you are cause you can't FREAKING PLAY!!Edit5 This game is now just too random most of the time No servers online later if it was possible to join I stay at joining forever this last update ruined the connection. check this screenshot http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 822049852Edit6 The developers or game owners decided to ban comments in the discussion forum part of steam because of the connection issues we can't play or log online for no apparent reason there is no way to solve this it is random when we get to play the game is totally worth paying for but the service being provided not really PLEASE allow me to pay a monthly subscribtion but not have such issues!!! Edit7 Recently for me and many other middle east players are facing rubber banding where the car jumps erratically not like ordinary lag and it is happening wether my ping is 10ms or 200ms unale to play at all.. when I searched everywhere the makers of the game are saying it is not their problem it is the end user's problem. bare in mind I play Overwatch WoW HotS Speed Runners (fun game) and many many other online games that has no issue but fromt he point of view of psyonix it is my mistake that their servers are crap or whatever they got happening is wrong it is me to blame the end user... you know if they demand a monthly subscription I will be willing to pay if I will get the same level of connection quality like World of Warcraft and blizzard games.. really... I will play.. it is an amazing game but for some reason it is my fault for it not being able to run good on my 100mbps connection (not bragging cause I know it is not as fast as many other so trolls please stay away!) ... review: Rocket cars + Soccer is that a good combination. Yes rocket league is a visually stunning game that can run on on a potato PC (on low settings). It is a mix of competitive and casual. You can play with or play casual or test your skills in ranked. Each game mode in rocket league is unique from rocket basketball to rocket hockey. But this game really shines when your playing split screen with friends. Another interesting feature is the ability to customize your car it's small but interesting. You participate in special events to earn car skins. Overall it has alot of replayability and is lots of fun!
title: Rocket League®

review: 3/10My favorite game to cuss in.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1130236896http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1176797959I find it funny how they ban you for cussing even though the game already has "Profanity filters" enabled by default as well as the option to mute chat (voice/regular) from certain players or completely... Seems a bit counter intuitive to have those options if in the end you'll just be banned for it anyways. These developers are over sensitive or maybe it's just the fanboys. Still waiting on a vote kick option/report option for AFK's that just farm loot crates. And the ban timer doesn't start to coun't down from when it was implemented until you've actually launched up Rocket Leauge so you can't call it a 24 hour ban when in reality it's longer. That's false advertising.Decent game but it has some of the worst match making I've ever seen in a multiplayer game. Even after the "Autumn update" they have not improved it.1) Joining matches that already ended.2) Joining a match that already started and you're on the losing team.3) Joining matches where your team is half AI while the opposite team is 4 people and there's no auto balancing to fix it.4) AI is brain dead on your team unless there's 2 or more.5) Being put up against tryhards that have over 1000 hours in the game while you're new and also your team (rookies).6) Too many different game modes and team size matches instead of having less to minimize join times.7) No "ping limits" on servers or "region locked" servers so be prepared to see 200+ pingers on your/opposing teams.8) Lots of rage quitters.9) Having AFK's on your team and sometimes they're clearly there since they never get auto kicked for staying idle because they move a little and refuse to play.9) Sometimes you have to wait a long time to join a match with their crappy "auto matchmaking" and it's worse when you have one of the problems mentioned above.10) No server browsing list it's all "auto matchmaking."11) No vote kick option to kick griefers/AFK's.12) Being forced to watch a "Goal Cam" for every single goal because no one ever votes to skip when it should be a majority rules kinda thing.13) Being put up against the same people over and over again even though it says there's 10 000 or more people in that same game mode...14) The server doesn't wait for a full 4v4 or 3v3 and starts with Ai on your team while the enemy team is full human players. No autobalancing to make it a little bit more fair.15) Being put up against a full team of no lifers/try hards (1000 hours + game time) since they party queued up and you're no where close to their game time.16) AFK's that never get kicked/banned because they exploit it or they're "botting" to farm loot crates. But if you go afk to go do something quickly (bathroom drink etc) you'll find out you've already been autokicked in 10 secs or less. I only recommend it if you're playing with friends/family. It can be fun at times but it can also give you quite the headache...
title: Rocket League®

review: Crates &amp keys
title: Rocket League®

review: Update Feb 4th 2018 Servers are basically broken now I guess. Local matches still work fine but the decline I noticed last year apparently continued as even with very low ping the online servers are an unresponsive unplayable wreck. The game crashes regularly now and PsyNet players have gone from a majority to a near absolute meaning online grouping is that much less social and able to offer strong teamwork (due to PsyNet players being unable to read or write in chat). Likewise all interesting levels have been stripped out in favor of a standardized design in short removing much of what made the game interesting in the first place. Several modes suffer a notable loss of appeal due to this reduction in play options Most notably Rocket Labs . Several new bugs.Update Jan 12th 2017 Server quality continues to degrade with servers occasionally crashing and existing bugs remaining unaddressed and made more frequent by worsening server conditions. Community grows more and more toxic with trolls in every other match. The devs still have not added a basic block system much less visibily enforced their community standards. I'll reiterate This game currently just isn't recommendable on its public gameplay.tl dr version Very good basic game but still lacking a lot of polish and features. Feels a bit EA still in that regard.Recommendable for private play where it plays out as fun as any multiplayer arena game but absolutely not recommendable for public play where frequent server issues an overwhelmingly toxic and exploitative community numerous unresolved bugs and design flaws and lousy matchmaking all make for a game that is more often than not very disagreeable to play. Great game offering a blend of childhood marbles like physics fun racing hijinks soccer gameplay and even arena brawling. It's a game that's inherently easy to pick up play and enjoy and really plays just the way you'd expect it to from the videos and screenshots no disappointments in that regard. So really if it looks at all interesting to you you should pick it up! ..wait or not. For a good while now there've been some significant issues in the game that the developers have failed to address in any way and it mars an otherwise solid game.* Horribly toxic community seemingly no oversight by the devs in that regard. You can mute the players for that single match but it doesn't carry over to any other match or prevent regrouping with them. It also doesn't address other abusive gameplay elements idling (for drops) is a key example being so common that you're bound to bump into it after just a couple of runs (and during the holiday events expect this to be nearly every run)There are a lot of amazingly capable and fun and positive players in this game and if the developers approached things with any degree of oversight this might actually be one of the better communities in an online game. Unfortunately as with any MMO where toxic individuals understand that there are no punishments for acting out what should be a minor occurance has wildfired.Doesn't help that the report function no longer allows you to report users once they leave a match so you'll sometimes get people deliberately sabotaging their team spewing a bunch of curses and then ragequitting. On the other hand when I've discussed reporting users to other players the positive minded players gave a clear impression of "it's useless the devs won't do anything" while the negative minded ones laughed and well said the same thing.So that's clearly the biggest issue of it all.* Input recognition failures flip recognition failures ability activation failures contact recognition glitches most of these issues can be explained by server issues that've persisted (and in many ways only grown worse) since the Rumble release some time back. But they're common and they're going to bite you in the at least a couple of times each match most matches. Some matches are completely unplayable because of these issues. * Joining in progress matches doesn't prevent you from rejoining a match you left (due to toxic players) and despite a recent patch still spawns you in at very disadvantageous circumstances often leading you to run right into the ball upon spawn sending it as often as not into your own goal. * Rumble mode is unpolished with several minor quirks. Most notably the inability to properly target with targeted abilities and their often switching targets as you activate them can cause you to inadverently help your opponents rather than hinder them. * General modes don't use any sort of ranking system to make sure you get decent matches or even matches to your skill level so it's always a complete crapshoot to lobby up. On the other hand ranked modes are based on the (in my opinion) very subpar 3v3 mode (if that was all the game had I wouldn't actually recommend it due to the size of most of the arenas and the sometimes glitchy physics it's too easy in standard 3v3 to get a lucky shot into a goal). Mind you this isn't really a flaw with 3v3 itself but with the maps used for 3v3 (which are typically better designed for 4v4). Hoops the basketball mode also suffers from being better suited for 3v3 play (and a slightly larger map) than for 2v2. Meanwhile on the opposite side of things Hockey (3v3) lacks the physics glitches of normal 3v3 due to its hockey puck shaped ball and works fabulously in 3v3. Rumble (the mode with activatable abilities) is crazy enough to get by in 3v3 as well and Chaos (4v4) is the ideal team play mode working far better with most maps than 3v3 does.So the option is to play standard ranked (which you can't easily leave without closing client the way which in a way is understandable but also makes bad public groupings all the more painful. Definitely do ranked with a team of players you're comfortable with rather than public grouping it.) or to play unranked matches with no meaningful matchmaking system at all but far better mechanics and balancing.At least from my perspective and preferences the game is lacking a lot of polish.The game is at a glance fantastic no doubt. And when you get good pairings and a functional server it's a calculated sports game with all the appeal of a racing game throwin in with fabulous teamwork potential. Other than the above issues and still lacking a bit of variety in modes and maps the game is thoroughly solid. So I'll gladly swap this to a positive review in an instant as soon as the devs at least give firm indication that they care about the general gameplay of the game as much as they do their premium leagues.That's not me being petty with my review but a simple fact to the rating system Steam uses While I can definitely say I occasionally enjoy this game when I'm playing with friends or manage a very lucky grouping I can't at all say I recommend it in its current state. There's just too much frustration in it and those moments of enjoyment are often a challenge to obtain.If you intend to avoid the public gameplay altogether and just play on teams fully crewed by friends you're likely to find this game enjoyable. Inherently I'd even put this among the topmost games in both sports and arena brawlers comparable to any of the best ones out there (except of course for the lack of polish in some areas and with it having less scale than most sports games and having less variety of content than most arena brawlers).If you're intending this for play with friends either in closed groups or in a ranked team then I can certainly recommend giving this game a go. If you're in for the public gameplay aspect then I really can't the toxic community and bad servers compounded with other minor stresses make this game one of the more problematic online games out there.
title: Rocket League®

review: I bought Rocket League soon after release in 2015. I later bought DLCs and then keys and I now have nearly 2000 hours in game all on the same PC. I ve probably played it more than any other video game in my life and I ve been playing video games for a very long time (many years longer than most of the people here). Rocket League even reminds me a little bit of the great times I had playing Re Volt online nearly 20 years ago.In theory Rocket League is amazing. The concept is great the possibilities are endless and the matches should be a lot of fun. In reality though this game is completely broken. Playing it has become a frustrating chore. For those of you who are new or thinking about buying Rocket League here are some of the things you should expect in an average session Extremely angry and immature players. Your opponents and teammates will invent reasons to insult you or tell you to die. If you ignore them or don t give them the reaction they want they ll throw the game throw a temper tantrum or quit playing. (Maybe they re just ticked off because of the many bugs and glitches in the game but that s no excuse.) After getting complaints from players for months Psyonix finally added a way to report toxic people but it never works. Even after you report some random kid for using racial slurs or telling you to kill yourself even if you quit and search for a different match you ll likely get stuck with the same person for another 3 or 4 games in a row. This is the least of your worries though. Lag. The game will freeze for 30 seconds (often right at kickoff) your car will fly through the ball instead of hitting it cars will randomly teleport half way across the field or the ball will do a U turn in the air without touching anything. Sometimes the lag is more subtle than that but it is constant and game breaking. Basically the game is always out of synch so there s really no way to know if you re truly playing the same match that your teammates and opponents are playing.Point and scoring errors. This is a problem that became obvious with the Labs update but now happens in all game modes. Points for hits saves and etc. will get calculated for one team but not for the other. You might get zero points for multiple saves and shots on goal while the other team immediately racks up hundreds of points for small stuff like centers and clears.Artificial winning or losing streaks. No matter what the players rank/MMR is regardless of how well you play and regardless of how well the other team plays you may lose (or win) 10 or 20 matches in a row for no good reason. This problem has been getting much worse in the last year. I ve really started to wonder if Rocket League is a game of skill or a game of chance. Are the defective servers cutting corners by just choosing one side to win before the match even starts?The infamous heavy car bug. You ll play a few matches just fine and then all of a sudden the car begins to turn jump and accelerate much more slowly than normal like you re driving through water or like the gravity physics have changed. This used to happen to me very occasionally and then a couple of months ago it started happening in every single match I played. Eventually I got fed up and uninstalled the game.You don t have to take my word for any of this. All of these problems are well documented in hundreds of posts on official and unofficial Rocket League discussion forums. You might have to dig a bit to find them though. They usually get quickly downvoted buried or removed. (A few months ago the official subreddit even made searching more inconvenient by hiding the search box on the front page. Now you have to click the rules or wiki link to find it.)When I started playing Rocket League it usually worked well. These bugs and glitches have gotten worse and worse over the last 2 and a half years. About a year ago Psyonix started making public statements promising that they re finally going to work on the servers to fix all the synch and lag issues. We re still waiting for that to happen. If the company ever decides to actually do something I would love to reinstall and keep playing maybe even to 3000 hours or more. But for now I m not going to waste any more time stupidly wishing that these problems get fixed. I hate to say it but at this rate I m worried that the game won t last much longer anyway.It was fun while it lasted. Caveat emptor.
title: Rocket League®

review: Saw it and for long time i tought it isnt nearly as fun as people advertise it to be. Looks didnt exactly help.Again i was wrong. Bloody fun game and rather easy to learnEDIT!While game is fun i cannot reccommend this game to anyone. Community is toxic and is deteriorating whereas developers are just now starting to deal with this and methods are lacking. Only way to play this game is chat off except quick messages. Otherwise you likely get flooded with messages that make known salty games look like heaven.It also still has several serious issues that still havent been adressed whereas psyonix has no problem pumping out DLC s &amp eye candy to distract from issues. For example hit registration while generally good has hiccups rather often lately. with stable ping. theres little more rage inducing than ball just going through you without even reacting and having replays to confirm it. Not only one who has it as wellBut thats honhestly rather new problem. Good example of old problem is matchmaking in ranked. I get its hard to make good matchmaking but at least pair up people in same SKILL GROUP. Its not funny anymore if i get low gold/silver players in my team vs plats every single time i get close to diamond. Its one of problems i've been raising ruckus all over the place for ages now only thing i've gotten for it is fanboys guarding psyonix despite the evidence i provided. They have tried to cover that up distract from it by changing ranked system rank names &amp systems....Apparently they havent had time or resources to fix any of issues but they sure have time and resources to make lootboxes! eye candy! DLC s!

review: When I first fired this game up I didn't know what to expect. The controls took some getting used to but once you get them down there's something magic about this game. I spent the next 4 hours holding my controller unable to wipe the grin off my face and finally realised that this is what gaming is about. This game is pure FUN. It's competitive but you can laugh about how horrible you look when you whiffed on that save you feel happy even if you lost you're having a blast. I can feel the addiction starting to settle in because I cannot stop hitting next match. Just one more match just one more match like in the old days. I haven't enjoyed myself so much since the Genesis era. Now I have to get more friends in on this game.

review: Product received for free. Well i played the free weekend to see what the fuss was about.I had played LucioBall in Overwatch which was quite fun and had already liked the concept from when I first saw the metroid 3DS spinoff minigame.So now I got to play the king of the genre (I played mostly 3vs3 for my time).... well I have to say i'm disapointed. Having cars is nice and fun but it induces a real lack of accuracy both in the turning and momentum management. Sure i obviously do not control this game as a seasoned player learned of the double jump and spin to hit the ball better only after a few games but I was hard pressed to find anyone in my games that seemed to control this game as a sports should control. It basically felt like polo.... handling a horse and hitting each other more than the ball. Second beef is on the ball itself the physics seem to be lacking. It hugs to the walls and doesn't bump much unless you really boost before.... feels weak.In short I may have been spoiled with LucioBall where the controls were somehow just spot on (it had its flaws too notably the ultimate and bumping the keeper....) but this game really feels that it falls short of what it could be in many ways. Now there are a lot of people playing so I guess it's better a to play a decent multiplayer game with people than a great one with no one. But unless you really have time to spend i wouldn't recommend this game.

title: Rocket League®

review: Okay let us be honest. The game mechanically? Pretty much flawless. While it has a seemingly infinite skill curve you are quite able to jump in and just enjoy the game. There is no problem there.Where my issue enlies the community. It has what I would describe as your typical eSports community . . . which means it is full of s and people that make you wish you were playing with them in person so you could bash them over the head with your keyboard. You will be accused of AFK botting while having over half the team's kills people complaining that you didn't block a single shot when they've never defended all game all sorts of bullcrap. Since the single player has little to offer having to deal with the hassles of other people is the only limitation to enjoying the game. So basically here's the question If you would be willing to recommend a game like League of Legends or DotA2 to people you know based on the community would you? The answer to that is no I couldn't and the same applies here. I may play it every so often because it is mechanically beautiful but the community reminds me why I don't stay around long.
title: Rocket League®

review: HONEST REVIEW NO TPros Fun casually and competitively to play with friends New experience Frequent updatesCons Toxic community Need to play with friends or will get with toxics teammates Terrible matchmaking system Extreme learning curve Bugs are a regular occurance (such as ball stuck in free play) Unfair placement matchesI currently do not recommend this game for new commers. I've played 300 hours of this game and have had a decent experience but this game needs a lot more development to become better and actually playable at a competitive and casual level. People expect a nice community with welcome arms to a new game they recently purchased but its quite the opposite filled with toxic rage quitters in all casual modes except rumble and flamming players who are terrible at the game in competitive. The ranking system is a joke and is WORSE than the CS GO matchmaking system. There a TON of smurfs that love to ruin the game's fun and the learning curve is extreme with the tutorial being practically useless with only few guides to teach proper mechanics and basics of the game. The competitive experience is awful with a party basically manditory if you want to win or not at a high level (PLATINUM 3+). People are placed at ranks they don't deserve and feels as if they are practically throwing the game. There is no AI system in competitive and in 3's (standard) there is no kicking system to kick trollers or smurfs. Thankfully there are no cheats in the game and once you get to a decent rank people know somewhat how to play the game. To conclude I think Rocket League has great potential with a growing E sports scene but I think the reviews are too biased and to not give a good in sight to the actual game and just say it's fun when it is but there are too many cons that outweight the pros. The game needs a lot of develpoment and the ranking system needs an overhaul. Season 4 needs to be forgotten about and move straight on to Season 5 where I expect nothing but good things to come since the dev team seems very dedicated to improving Rocket League as a whole.
title: Rocket League®

review: The matchmaking in this game is terrible along with 0 rewards to keep playing the game. There is no reward for playing this game except getting the duplicate cosmetics Flags Hats etc. So you won 5 games in a row a sane person would expect he would get something from it but noo in Rocket League you get nothing. In game ranks are useless since you are mostly stuck in same division or you are loosing divisions due to your teammate being semi pro while you are an expert.In game stats are poor and only show shots goals saves. Slacking devs only make new DLCs to earn money rather than improving the gameplay.This game was fun for couple of days and now it's just a slow grind to improve your divison so you can get nothing out of it.Don't play this game if you think you will get something out of it for the time invested.Do not recommened until they fix their reward system.Too frustrating lots of "teammates" who will on purpose play against you if you say something "negative" to them.Good game to waste your time and nerves. Frequent disconnects LONGER queues after Xbox cross play(you would think it would lower queue times).Server Lags and Toxic kids are in everyday play.Psyonix bragging they are giving away FREE updates. Well updates should be free since I paid 20 for the game!!Psyhics sometimes are not logical and needs improvements.Overall I give this game 5/10 lots of improvements to be made but currently Devs only care to make money out of DLCs.Shame.

review: Where to begin...I bought Rocket League after seeing some hilarious and awesome GIFs online. It looked like a fun game and as someone who grew bored of FIFA pretty quickly but also has a love for cars and racing games it seemed right up my alley.I was right.This game is seriously addictive. It's one of those games where you say "Oh one more match" and then BAM it's 3am. It is extremely well polished has great replay value and well worth the money. At the time of writing this I've clocked up 90 ish hours that's 0.16/hour and it gets better with each day.I'm seriously looking forward to throwing more money at these guys for the DLC and excited to see what the future holds for this fantastic game.

review: Hello friends. I played this game 700 hrs so you can say I have seen nearly everything in this game. I have to say it's a good game to play and compete with other players around the world. But if you get to the point where you have to improve your gameplay massively to win even normal games....So in my case I have to play against low challenger tier players or champion players it's never really balanced (I'm currently Rising Star in all four categories in ranked). It really is a funny game to play with friends or without if you're in the low level tiers not ranked but your player level in particular. But when you get higher and higher the balancing of the matchmaking gets worse and worse....The second big point is the community. You sometimes have games where everyone is on the same level of skill super friendly and they stay for at least 3 games. But often you get leavers in normals almost every game people who insult others spam commands if you failed and so on. And it feels like reporting them has no impact at all. For myself I decided to lay down my controller after 700 hrs. Sad to say but I can't enjoy it anymore. Was a fun time well at least half of it was.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is like Surgeon Simulator but with cars and rockets. By that I mean of course that the controlls are comically inaccurate.Rocket League is fine for casual play but don't play it competitvely.With a controller it's almost impossible to line your shots up. The game is really 50% luck. It's very hard to get good at the game because you don't focus on strategy more than you do trying to line your shots up. Most of the 'skill' comes from being able to use the controller effectively and it's super hard because it's so sensitive. It's very frustrating and after as much as I've played the game I just can't recommend it. In fact I have permanantly removed the game from my library because the game is just that bad. If you can play the game and have fun with it great but just don't expect to try and play it competitvely because you'll be spending more time trying to learn the controlls than strategizing your gameplay. It's very similar to billiards in that sense. You know where you want the ball to go it's actually hitting it the right way which is the hardest part.

review: Rocket League is basically completely physics based football/soccer with rocket powered cars. The aerial goals are done by jumping pointing the car up and boosting. There's nothing else. There's no "kick ball" button or "pass" button. Only car control and physics which is what makes this game so unique and challenging.

review: Ranking system is a joke you can play with opponents from 1/10 of your skill to 10 times the skill.Servers are super laggy even with a good connection fix 50&gt ping but the ball is moving weird teleporting.Servers are usually BULLSHEETBounce physics are broken especially at the posts.The game is well optimalized playable with potatos too.Toxic players tilt out very fast if you don't want to kys play 3 ranks below ur skill level otherwise all your tm8s will afk/play for enemy team if you don't play perfectly.Average matchmaking experience after 350hours 50% of the matches are terrible you get players from a lower rank as ur tm8 and players from a higher rank as opponents therefore you lose your rank.40% of the time this happens after you have lost so many points that you can carry anything by your own after this part you finally can play a balanced match with players around your skill this time one of the teams win by 1 goal this is the win that will change your rank compared to the beginning. When you have done these everything starts over again.So basicly about 10% of the time the game is actually great.Unfortunately if you play in your rank (not smurfing) you have a 50% of getting a toxic tm8.If you find a normal player you'll be ok even if you lose but in those other scenarios your tm8 will flame you after the first mistake even if it happens after 3 minutes of gameplay and you're guaranteed to lose that match no matter what happens.

review: At its core Rocket League is a unique game with an addicting twist. That gives them enough of an advantage to be able to gain players despite a horrible development company that does a lot of shady crap. First let's start with some major design flaws 1. The Matchmaking is the worst I've ever seen in a game. No one is at their proper rank and it matches you very unevenly. Most games are boring snoozefest blowouts one way or another.2. Account buyers are ing rampant. This makes the horrendous matchmaking even worse.3. The servers have been bad for years and constantly go down. Psyonix apparently has no idea how to fix them.4. There are some bugs which they just outright have stated they don't know how to fix. There was an 'invisible goalpost' bug that they had to work around and now goalpost redirects seem to go in random directions. You'll clip through the ball constantly and desync is a horrible issue.The Development Team Psyonix is up there with DayBreak for "Worst Development Company in History". For example they control the subreddit and their EMPLOYEE moderators are toxic as hell. However they have made efforts to fix this by removing such toxic mods as HoraryHellfire so that deserves some recognition.In addition though Psyonix holds the RLCS every year where they offer peanuts to the winning team and shove advertisements/promos everywhere. Their esports scene is so forced its nauseating. All casters are required to smile at all times and they have to wear suits and can't cuss. There's product placement for Brisk everywhere to the point where the chat just spams 'Brisk' as a joke. On top of that Psyonix viewbots extremely badly. This year's RLCS was at 120k viewers and jumped to 190k within a 15 second timeframe. They aren't even good at viewbotting.On a final note as toxic as Psyonix's employees are the community is much worse. Expect leavers in around half of your games. I can't remember the last time I played an evenly matched 3v3. It's honestly been at least a year (over 2 000 matches).Obviously I have a of hours in RocketLeague because Im addicted to the core concept. Everyone keeps saying "this is the season they fix matchmaking this is the season they hire on better developers etc". It never happens. It's never going to happen. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this game.TL DR The core of the game is massively addicting. The matchmakings awful and the development company is beyond belief. Don't make the mistake I did and get sucked into this game.
title: Rocket League®

In casual however people tend to quit when the game turns against their favor which I feel ruins it a bit. There really is no punishment to this other than loss of XP gained.
