review: I really want to recommend this game but I can't. I've been playing almost since day one and if I was writing this review back then i would be recommending it. The game is incredibly fun but quality has been steadily declining since it was released. When the game was first released you could get into a match instantly and ping was great. I consistently had less than 10ms ping. Now it takes a few minutes to get into a match (even though there are more people playing) and ping has been steadily increasing with every update they do to the game. I'm lucky if I can get into a server with a ping least than 40ms. Even though 40 ping isn't bad it is way to high for a game that is highly dependent on reaction time and precise maneuvers. I also never had any issues running this game. It always ran flawlessly. It wasn't until recently that my game started crashing randomly and having two crashes in the matter of 15 minutes is what motivated me to write this review.On another note the physics are flawed. When I first started playing Rocket League the physics felt great and seems super realistic (minus pinching the ball) but as I played the game more and more I started to notice that the physics don't react proper in a lot of situations. I don't know for sure what is wrong but it seems like there is no friction at all and the ball's momentum reacts very strange at times. Collisions between vehicle make no sense to me. It seems completely random what happens when you hit someone else or when someone hits you. I have tapped someone and sent them flying to the moon and I have slammed someone at full speed and been stopped dead in my tracks. And whenever you get hit your car just arbitrarily spins killing any momentum you had when you were hit. I feel like Psyonix doesn't care about the quality of the game anymore and they are just pushing more and more new content. Don't get me wrong I love everything they have added and basketball is (in my opinion) way better than soccer but it feels like they are neglecting the quality that the game once had. They keep releasing all these car packs but it doesn't feel like they are fixing any of the problems with the game like the matchmaking.I love this game but it is slowly falling out of my favorites. Ultimately I can't recommend it but I will be more than happy to change my review if Psyonix brings the game back to what it use to be. There are a couple more things I want to note about this game but they did not influence my recommendation for this game since they are related to the community and not Psyonix directly. This will probably sound like a rant more than anything but these things need to be said.The community for this game is awful to put it bluntly. I occasionally get good matches with people who are fun and respectful and we have a blast but then there are matches where your entire team leaves if you get scored on in the first 5 seconds or people are being disrespectful to each other. In ranked matches I've had people totally blow up on me for making a mistake. I understand playing competitively and wanting to win. Nobody likes losing but people need to remember it's just a game and losing is part of any game. Something needs to be done about the people who leave mid game. Banning people doesn't fix anything. Implementing a system that separates quitters and non quitters might be beneficial. This system would track everyone and how often they leave matches before they are over. When you search for matches it will try to put you into a game with a similar quitting levels so that quitters play together and non quitters play together. Obviously this is very black and white and an actual implementation wouldn't be this crude but I think a system like this could be a step in the right direction.Rocket League is a difficult game. I have put many hours into it and I'm still pretty mediocre at it. The only way to get better is to play the game more. When you quit you are losing valuable game time that could help improve your own skills. I take more from matches where I lost than matches where I won. When you are beat it gives you a chance to analyze what you did wrong and makes you better. This goes along with the old saying "Quitters never win and winners never quit."
title: Rocket League®

review: I really really love this game. The reason I can't give it a positive review is not for the game design but for the frequently horrible community. I found countless times that during competitive play if my team was down a goal the other members of my team would drop out. Thus leaving me to be 1v3 or 1v2 with slim to nil chance of winning. Furthermore the penalties for abandoning a match early are not serve enough. 15 minute bans should be raised to 24 hour or 48 hour bans for dropping out of the game.Coupled with the terrible team mates work ethic the match making system is horrible. I would often find myself with players of pings well over 200 when I am searching for servers only within my region. The option of cross play with PlayStation players seems like a great idea but they would often have terrible pings and were almost always the first to throw a match.I really want to give this game a thumbs up but given that the core claws of this game are centred on competitive multiplayer (which is flawed at its very core) prevent me from doing so. 5/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: Let me state this I bought this game in 2015 went on a hiatus from Feb. 2016 Feb. 2017 and just recently permanently removed the game from my account. I hate the COMMUNITY for this game and consequentially the game became a constant headache.I played over 300 hours of this game and before I quit I was at expert level 43 I believe. I do not suck at the game so don't go thinking that is why I am hating. I am not hating I am being honest. I LOVE THIS GAME the care and thought (mostly well intended) by the developers is visible. The micro transactions only recently added are excusable considering the amount of cars and content you can get normally. BUT... we must get to the biggest problem of this game THE GARBAGE COMMUNITY.The MLG 420 casual idiotic pathetic and tryhard nature of the culture that the Rocket League community has taken since the game's release is what drags the game down to rock bottom. Competitive ironically is actually the most enjoyable part of the game most of times as there are "stakes" to the match and people play more tactical and grounded. Meaning actual strategy coordination and some fun. It has its problems but more often than not it is fine. What SUCKS is the regular modes which are supposed to be the most fun ones. Standard is where most players are but if you see a GRAN CHAMPION ROCKETEER and similar LEAVE IMMEDIATELY your fun will be ruined especially if they are in a party (which is almost always). The level of no life these pathetic wastes of oxygen demonstrate is almost unthinkable and the game rewards it what was once cool and interesting to see in ariels and cool passes has devolved into unblockable lopsided matches and outright of players who HAVE LIVES and choose not to spend 1000s of hours playing this garbage. At least in normal modes you can leave without being penalized from matchmaking. And speaking of this ing matchmaking...THE MATCHMAKING IS You will be put in matches you just left placed against way out of your league players and occasionally parties will get split. It sucks which is confusing when this could have been mostly fixed by adding the skill variable from competitive to this but keeping it hidden since it is normal mode. Also why is there no added clause to the matchmaking preventing you from joining the match you just left? It is infuriating...FINAL VERDICT 2/10This game was fin when it launched everyone was learning together learning the tactics and cooperation in order to win matches. But implementing and fostering E SPORTS GARBAGE hyping up competitive play and trying to keep ING OUR WALLETS with t DLC to such a degree it is no longer excusable but just shameful Rocket League becomes even more casual and frustrating than Call of Duty. review: I can safely say from 3 hours of gameplay that this game is great. It's such a simple formula flawlessly executed. It's fun addicting fast paced and a blast to play with your friends. There's great customization through a leveling system and even great content as the devs are adding FREE new modes like a basketball mode and hockey mode with more coming soon. There's even a Rocket Labs playlist where you can play experimental maps that the colorful minds of the devs make. There's also great paid DLC like the Batmobile and the Back to the Future Deloreon to use in games. Hell even the graphics are great and the unique futuristic artstyle is beautiful. The game is easy to pick up but hard to master. I was rusty for about 2 hours but once you get the hang of the controls it's fun. Rocketing in a goal never has felt so good.This is a must own for any gamer. It's a masterpiece and needs to be played by you. Should you buy? YES! It's a game for any type of gamer.I highly recommend you use a controller for this game.

review: The game is golden once you get to the point where you acquire the ability to do aerial shots decent dribbling know what to do where to put the ball PASS the ball make awesome plays... Teamwork is what makes this game great. And now you're wondering "wait is this a bad review?" Yes because unless you have friends that can play at the same level as you you're screwed. Solo queueing in competetive/ranked mode is the most masochist thing to do. Hence why I even got the urge to change my name to "Trash Teammate Magnet". But why do I claim my teammates are trash if I'm matched with players who are about the same rank as me? Because simply ranks don't matter anymore diamond rank is the new silver. I don't have a temper nor am I easily annoyed but when the same bullcrap happens again and again again and again especially when you get matched with the same bad teammates from the game before 3x in a row (my record is 5x in a row great matchmaking btw) yeah it's natural to get angry. Especially when your trash teammates are the ones to even talk crap towards you so I speak back and surprise surprise i'm now on my 3rd ban! Literally for saying the word "fu**ing". Give the ranks a proper meaning to the competitive section of the game please and what's the deal with being somehow able to derank after you've just won a match or rank up after losing? beats me. Also please fix your matchmaking. You're banning players for reacting to your in game flaws. If I wasn't matched consistently with teammates clearly below my level or teammates who troll (and get away punish free from my reports of "unsportsmanlike conduct" everytime) maybe I would also not feel the need to use the F word on them among other words that became so offensive since 2017 for some reason.

review: A stunning game whic exceptional physics and incredible mechanics perfect for teaming up or going head to head with friends online or on split screen!When you first start the game you only think of things on a single plane only ever staying on the floor. Very quickly you learn that the ability to jump high to block shots or even fly (aerial) works to your advantage more so than you ever thought. The combos that some people can pull off after practicing hard for hours on end really pays off and makes your shots look 300% cooler and way more impressive to show off.The physics are spectacular really nice to see some real effort put in into the immersion to this 'fantasy' game.However only criticisms i can make is (a) the crappy flaming scamming community that is its really off putting and just taints any enjoyment you initially had(b) server issues hiccups on clientside every so often despite low ping (20 30) you will get random hiccups in game which could potentially ruin a game/shot. Incredibly annoying when youve set up the perfect shot to only end up looking like a complete idiot to everyone else on the server who will just see you mess up and not see that the game jumped on your side.To clarify i have a TITAN X (Maxwell) and i7 7700K and 32GB DDR4 so there are 0 issues with game performance (i play in 4k60 but the framrates go up to 110 when vsync is disabled) so its not my PC which are causing these stutters.

review: After playing this game for over 400 hours I came to the conclusion that I can not recommend this game. The game itself is pretty awesome but many of the players you'll meet in public games just aren't. The game changed quite a bit over time due to patching and the addition of new stuff but not all for the better. Once you reach the level of expert/master things change. Matchmaking becomes quite a joke and not everyone is interested in playing all available maps. With the latest patch you're somewhat forced to play maps you don't want to play in unranked matches. How to counter this? Exactly play ranked. Ranked matches are flawed these days. If you do not have a proper team to play with and communicate with chances of losing are high. Lots and lots of trolls in this game idlers smurfs people leaving ranked matches and so on. Not to mention the salty people you'll encounter. On the higher levels it comes down to skills and teamplay. Skills you can practice for but for teamplay you need proper teammates not usually the ones you'll find in public games who all chase the ball into the same corner all the time. With non ranked games you'll encounter a lot of players leaving and joining all the time. People give up way too easily and some stay in a game for way too long. Surely everyone is allowed to do what they want but don't ruin the match for others.For me this game is only fun when playing with a proper team. Public games are more of a struggle rather than anything else these days. For new players the game will be fun nonetheless learning all the techniques being amazed at how you actually managed to score a really weird goal from a weird angle bumping into other players all the time and failing bigtime at flying. I'm not an expert at this game myself and I make mistakes every now and then as well but some people at master/legend level still have skills of a semi pro.Combine everything together and you'll have an excellent and balanced game with a few annoying possibilities due to Psyonix dictating what maps you sometimes have to play in non ranked but the public players are what ruin the experience and fun on higher levels.
title: Rocket League®

review: I hate soccer or football as those of you without freedom might call it. It's a boring sport full of panzies who cry any time another player enters their personal space. It is corrupt but worse yet it's run by old men *gasp!*. I like cars but even the best car games get dull for me reasonably fast.So when I head about this game you can imagine how thrilled I was ("wow that looks like a piece of quot ) but I did have some reservations. How much would this game revolve around a love of Sports Ball? *I don't love Sports Ball.* Would how well I play be determined by what crap I have unlocked? Would there be anything about the gameplay that kept me interested beyond the initial 30 minutes of learning the game and playing the tutorials and a few rounds? Honestly that was my biggest worry would I get bored of this inside of an hour? Well I played for several hours immediately after installing it and the next night I played for another hour or two. At the moment I feel like I'm going to continue playing the game probably every day. So I'm definitely not getting bored of it fast. The gameplay is incredibly well balanced. As far as I can tell the only thing determining how well you play is well you. Learn to master the techniques required to execute awesome shots and you will do well. However no man is an army just as no man is a team. This game is totally fine to just drop in and play a round here and there with strangers but it REALLY excels when you are on voice chat with a group of friends and actually can have a bit of strategy. Maybe that night one specific person is doing great in goal so they want to play net. Maybe they seem to be getting all the easy goals so they are charging in and striking. I don't feel that any of the elements of this game limit a person to always playing one position either. The first night I played I was absolutely awful at playing defense on the net. The second night that seemed to be the only thing I was good at. But nobody is locked into a position which I really love. The point is it's flexible. If you play goal you're not stuck there you can play the field and take shots on net and still rip back and try to make saves.Another thing I like about the game the number of players can DRASTICALLY change how you play the game (tactics and such) but also how difficult and balanced it seems. In a 4v4 game it's absolute chaos when there is a scramble for the ball and it makes for some really hilarious moments and ridiculous goals.What does this game remind me of? Combine the vehicles and silly driving of Sega classic Rock 'N' Roll Racing with the balanced gameplay and hats of TF2 throw in a dash of Sports Ball with the absolute anarchy of I don't know a bunch of 7 year olds on PCP playing soccer and you've got Rocket League. It's pretty good.

title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is all of what you can see rocket powered RC cars playing soccer and recently hockey and basketball.When teams are balanced and everyone knows how to play it's amazing challenging and loads of fun. Sadly this is a rare event. Most of the time you'll either be assigned the world's derpiest team or the opposition will be comprised of super saiyans and jedis. If you're particularly unlucky (about 15% of the time for me) you'll end up with both.Speed boosts are awesome and essential for high rank gameplay particularly when 70% of players above Pro Rank fly around like birds and I'm flopping like a dying fish. When I use it boost seems rather underwhelming at 24 or less and getting more can be painful due to the nodes littered around the arena not respawning fast enough for the gratuitous use they get.Getting to a higher rank is rather tedious when you get to semi pro and worse when trying for veteran. Experience requirements seem rather high for no reward other than getting a higher rank.But what truly ruins the fun of the game is the completely broken match making system. Team balancing in Rocket League is simply "put players in here till 3 each team". The game will FREQUENTLY put much higher ranked players into the match obliterating the hopes of the opposition and spoiling the fun for their team. Update Originally written 14th July 2016. All the above still very true now 20th Jan 2017. All they seem to have done in the mean time is make more maps and cars and adopt a slimy Loot Box mechanic to filtch money from people.Matchmaking still completely screwed and people make it worse when abusing the team mechanic to bring in a much higher tier. Update Currently 3rd September 2018. Sadly matchmaking is going a loooong way backwards. Now far from making balanced matches there's shoddy programming that results in queued teams (2 4 players that join the queue together) being put on separate teams in the match. By way of bugs there's also the 4v3 bug when matching puts an extra player on a full team. Everybody loves that one. /endsarcasmIf neither of these occur then you're subject to the usual nonsense of playing with others either above or below your rank (there's a strange lack of expert ranked people) and matching likes to take 10 15mins to place you even when there's over 13k people in the queue with you.In terms of progress there seems to be only as much content as they can sell you. Which thankfully is purely cosmetics at this point. They've been working on a lot of customisable parts some more thought out than others none of which really matter when there are such big issues with the core gameplay. If the matchmaking doesn't screw you (and it will) then the intermittent server issues will. (I play on the Oceanics so it might be just those.)I started this review over two years ago in hopes that maybe Psyonix would read it and realise they're missing the big problems of their game. That was two years ago. I now understand that they don't care beyond how much money they can squeeze out of people for cosmetics now that the spotlight of new release games has well and truly moved on.When the matchmaking was fixed I fully intended to come back to this review and rewrite it to give an accurate possibly even favourable summary of the game. Now two years on I realise that the window of opportunity has closed and so with it my hopes for the game.What you see here is a game with all the promise in the world and at times you can feel it fulfilled but for the most part it's a long wait between disappointing matchups. TL DR The developers don't care to fix issues that have been burdening the game for over two years and seem to put all their time into more cosmetics for Loot Boxes.If you're looking for a fun and balanced multiplayer game look elsewhere. If you want to play against players with loads more experience than you on a team with no goalie for little reward then welcome home.
title: Rocket League®

review: I went into this game with a clean slate just to see what it was like and if it was fun and sad to say but it really was not fun as a fair few issues kept cropping up with the game.Match Making SystemThe matchmaking system is a giant mess there seems to be no restrictions on whom you can meet and in my first few games I was getting put up against veterans with 500 1 000 hrs on their account and there is no fun to be had when you're just starting out and it throws you into games like this.The few times it did put me in a fair game with players around my level it was actually quite fun problem is these match were so minuscule that they were every 1/10 15 matches.Also the playercount must be really small or something as I ran into a lot of the same groups over and over just to hear more toxic abuse thrown my way about something that I did that they did not like.ToxicityPeople bailing on the game after the 1st goal or just helping the enemy team win the match though stopping you and your teammates or denying goals.The community toxicity is insane you make one slightly wrong move and you get called out for it and get a spam of noob and attempt to screw over the game for others like for example this is what has happened to me across the games I played.... deny goals bailing general toxicity in chat giving up so quick they might as well queued and then left the game as soon as it started driving around in circle for the whole match and I even ran into a teammate who job was to screw over our team to obviously help his buddies on the other team to get them leveled faster.The ServersWhat servers?the servers seem pretty unstable causing a lot of random teleports for most of my games as in one moment you could be chasing the ball and then it woudl vanish an re appear behind you which was very fustrating as I lost a lot of goals to this issue and toxicity I got for having a laggy game was at most point just unreasonable.The Loot SystemNow to begin with it seemed pretty good earn items over the coarse of the games you play no matter weather you win or lose but that then changed as I was wondering why I couln't find anything other than commons and the odd uncommon and all the great looking items were all etheir stick behind a dlc wall or a loot box that you need to spend money on keys opening and it really sucked a big amont of the joy I was having as I could not unlock any of these items with flashing my wallet.ConculsionIt's such a shame to see a great game fall so far as it seemed fun for a little while until it was all replaced with toxicity lagging and really poor matchmaking which really killed the enjoyment of the game for me and the sad thing was it got to the point where ethier I would have to play with frenids or against the bots to actually experince any enjoyment in this game.To sum upOnly buy if your going to play with frenids or if you just like making yourself suffer by playing against people who are just toxicity and act like a bunch of spoiled children who will throw a temper tamturn if you don't score the first point and then proceed to leave or throw the gameA great game that could of been even greater but instead it has fallen flat on it's face and been stomped to death.

review: I am quite sad to downvote this. Don't get me wrong its an amazing game. The easy to learn hard to master trait is a given for this. The amount of techniques and skills you can learn just from the time playing all the way to the customized training modules in the menu in which have taught me so much and the amount of fresh training activities that are updated daily never cease to help me further improve. The game is the best when you're playing with mates 2 3 or even 4. Its crazy how much fun and hype you can get from scoring an insane fluke goal and ride of a wave of victories with your friends till all hours of the night. Now...This is why I am downvoting this Firstly the community on its own is the most toxic i've seen since league of legends and its not even scraping the surface of whats wrong. The amount of trolling and throwing your partner can do if you're playing competitive is just baffling and they always and will always probably get away with it unless the punishment system is further improved. Nothing seems to work to combat people whom throw if you make a mistake etc. If you're thinking of getting into this game for the competitive standpoint whilst playing solo you're in for a ride of frustration. The matchmaking is all kinds of terrible for example Yourself (Platinum) playing doubles by yourself will get yourself matched with a player (Gold) in which severly handicaps your team in the amount of skill you have to verse your opposing teams whom are 8 times out of 10 queued together. And as I've said the toxicity you will encounter I can't even fathom. The lag the amount of rubber banding I have encountered and not only myself but people whom I play with also experience the same issue. Been here since day 1 and its been until now.. I don't think its getting fixed anytime soon. Thats all I can really think of as of now.+1 playing with mates 1 playing soloBut I cannot say that this is a bad game its well done and if you have friends to play it with its defintely worth your time. Just DONT PLAY IT BY YOURSELF!

review: Before I reason why I do not recommend this game I gotta say this game is amazing. I have been playing for an hour or so and although I suck complete at it the game makes me excited and the graphics look really good even on a computer. However... the only reason I do not recommend this game is because of the online features for the following countries China Crimea Cuba Iran North Korea Sudan Syria. Now I live in shanghai and I can play almost every game because of the decent internet here but before I purchased this game I had no idea online play was impossible in China. Rocket league uses google features and the all mighty great fire wall of China blocked Google a while back. I was able to connect to the servers using vpn but the connection simply wasn't steady. I was able to play a few online games with the lag and the games were still very exhilarating but I can still not hide my feeling of disappointment. I really hope the company does something about the servers just like many other gaming country has dealt with China because I know that without lag this game can be more than exciting.

review: At low levels the game is just hit the ball and hope it goes in. At high levels (diamond/champ/grand champ) the hits are too unpredictable and therefore causing many games in those levels to be based around luck. Your team could be far better than the other and still lose just because they got a few lucky kickoffs and some random challenges. I have over 950 hours on this game and have played in tournaments for it i am continually getting more frustrated as the ranking system is also messed up. For example say you started at Diamond 1 division 2 then decided to play a couple rounds you win 3 rounds and lose 1 you will likely end up in the same place as you started. Not even mentioning that the bot bans people for no reason and the terrible community enjoys pressing that report button.(Edit) I was just banned for three days for "verbal/text abuse" after turning off my chat and mich from the game it seems that now the bot for banning people it going a little crazy and just bans people if they get reported from anyone in this cancerous community.

review: The people who designed this game thought lets make a game where cars can hit a ball like soccer. Then another guy was like oh yeah lemme do some realistic physics for it. Then they were like naw that doesnt sound like fun lets make a glitchy mess where the ball flies foreward when backward momentum is applied to it and if two cars hit it at close to the same time it multiplies their vectors because why not? If you do manage to hit the ball where you want you have to deal with see through walls that bounce the ball off in ways you wont be able to predict until you have invested you sad life into this game. The ramp on the side which most likely was ac cop out from designers bounces the ball in a different way every time so there is no memorizing this and should be avoided if you hope to do anything productive in game. Along with this COMPLETE TRASH PHYSICS they also decided to make a ranking system that ensentavises smurfs. Now you can derank you solo rank down to bronze without effecting you coveted 3v3. You get to be a pathetic loser and trash on legit player trying to learn to play! Doesn't that sound like a great time? Why try to make it fun for new players when you have to keep the old ones happy. Sad design team and terrible ranking system. I could pay a indian scammer for 2 hours to make a system that is more comprehensive and makes more sense than this trash. Just today what tipped me over the edge was that i had worked my way up to Bronze 3 Division 4 (a game away from silver) and instead of playing another brinze player trying to rank up i played a silver 2. I lost then played again silver 3. Then again it was a silver 1. This TRASH system matched me against silvers until i deranked all the way down to Division 1. On top of that everyone i played was hitting insane arials some of which i'd never seen. It discusts me that i cant even rank up from the bottom tier without having people with hundreds to thousands of hours more than me trashing on me. It's pathetic and sad and the disigners of the game know about it and do nothing. It pisses me off how sad the player who can't win in their own rank are but this company loves them because they keep swiping their mom's credit card to buy cases. Congrats on taking a good concept and completely trashing it with terrible mechanics and the most pathetic player base in any game i've played before. I won't be wasting money on any other games from this publisher because it is clear they care more about micro transactions and retention of trash human beings rather than a good game and getting new people into it. If you are thinking about trying this game DON'T because everyone is better than you and you will lose every game until you give up anywasys so just save the time and money and don't buy this pathetic excuse of a game.

review: Simply this game is great and I reccomend it to everyone. The game is pretty simple. It's soccer with cars. But it's much more than that. There are many skills that you can master in the game such as striking aerials and playing goalie. There is also a CS GO like ranking system for different game modes of Rocket League such as solo standard doubles and singles. They each have their perks of playing them. In singles you just depend on yourself and no teammates but in solo standard you depend a lot on your teammates whether that be a good thing or a bad thing. Although it's not just about the soccer. There are cosmetics that you can collect such as car skins and wheels and Psyonix just released crates which you can open with keys that you buy from the store. A portion of the cost of the key is supposed to go to future Rocket League events. All in all the game is great.

review: Indoor soccer with walls on all sides (i.e. no out of bounds) is my favorite sport and this game seems to be popular in part because it captures part of what makes indoor soccer so exciting a team sport that has fast paced action (because of the small field size) and no stoppages (because you've got walls on all sides).Unfortunately if you've actually played indoor soccer you may find this game frustrating because of the relative lack of control that you have in this game.One aspect of the relative lack of control is in the movement controls. My impression is that you accelerate more slowly in this game than you do when you play indoor soccer and in indoor soccer you can immediately take off in any direction whereas in this game you're limited to going forwards and backwards and changing your direction gradually by steering. The controls make it feel more like ice/roller hockey than indoor soccer and while ice/roller hockey are fun I don't think the movement style in those sports are what make them great IMO the movement style in ice/roller hockey is just a side effect of ice hockey's need for a smooth slippery surface (ice) to have the small puck able to move smoothly / easily / predictably.Another aspect of the relative lack of control is in the passing. I did a Google search and it seems that passing is possible in this game but arguably much more difficult than in indoor soccer / hockey.Another aspect of the lack of control is maintaining control of the ball when you have possession. It seems that in this game you never really have possession you just strike the ball in a chosen direction once it's more like volleyball that way. In soccer and hockey there's a whole "mini game" of having one or more opponents trying to take the ball / puck from you and you using your skill to maintain control of the ball / puck.

review: Do I like this game?Yes.Do I recommend this game?No.Is it worth the money?It should be free because everything else ingame is not.SummaryIt's fun at first especially when you get better. But then you get to meet the toxic community and things go downhill. If you only wanna play this game on the couch with some friends it's perfect but unless you play with friends you're gonna have a bad time. Little kids are constantly complaining because they can't accept how bad they are. I like a game where I can chat with normal well functioning civil human beings. Maybe I'll play it again some day with the chat hidden.UpdateI have since my last comment been playing with every type of communication turned off. My game experience has improved in a way that I can play the game and don't get agitated. Unfortunately I'm missing the positive interaction with other players like saying Nice Shot or being able to tell my teammate what I'm going to do.ConclusionI'll probably just stick with casually playing with some friends on the couch or ocasionally having a quick match with all forms of communication turned off.
title: Rocket League®

review: Amazingly fun game. Skill ceiling is somewhere up in the clouds. Highly addicitve gameplay keeps me around day after day but this game suffers from a horribly toxic community. If you are just a casual player that sticks to unranked matched or you play mostly with friends I don't think there are many games I could recommend more highly than this. But if you find yourself getting better and better and you switch over to ranked play prepare to encounter salty aggressive and downright mean players on a regular basis especially as you progress higher and higher up the ladder.Maybe it's the nature of competitive gameplay but as a person who has played a considerable number of hours in other competitive games in the past this one is up high on the list of toxic communities. The playerbase of Rocket League far more than the gameplay itself frequently leaves me feeling upset and irritated after just a few matches. Every minor mistake is immediately met with punishing insults and taunting by your own teammates. Even though I will continue to play this game it is because of the community that I encounter day after day that I have to say I ultimately do not recommend this game.TLDR Great fun for casual play or matches with friends. But if you are looking for a competitive game to enjoy this one has a horribly toxic community that will leave you feeling frustrated and angry more than anything else.
title: Rocket League®

review: Before you drop your hard earned $20 on this game I will warn you ROCKET LEAGUE IS RIGGEDWhat do I mean by this? Well a normal competitive sports game would allow each player on each team an equal chance of scoring and thus winning. The same set of physical and logical rules applies to every player much like in the real world. This is not the case with rocket league. Different physics apply to different players and the game adjusts these parameters to favor one side over the other about 90% of the time.How is the game rigged exactly? Two principal types of rigging apply in Rocket League Camera rigging and entity physics rigging. Camera rigging occurs when the action you see on your screen does not reflect the action that happens in the game. One of the most basic camera rigs in RL is the classic missing the ball trick. You charge towards the ball expecting a hit only to brush by wide left wide right too low or too high. Or you hit the ball at the incorrect contact point. This is NOT a bug. This is NOT (always) due to lack of skill in fact highly skilled players miss these shots because Rocket League's piece of junk Ballcam (otherwise known as Shitcam) can and does generate optical illusions at will. This is one way RL rigs the game against you increasing the chances that you miss your shots or miss the ball entirely.The second type of rigging comes from a tweaking of the game physics themselves. One common scenario in RL is when two players hit the ball at the same time. Rocket league uses physics to calculate the path of the ball following the collision. However it can choose from not one but several paths within a degree of uncertainty. One path might head towards the center of the field. Another might head straight into your goal. You as the player can't tell the difference because all of those paths look valid given the physics of the game. But in real life the several paths scenario is complete and utter t much like most of Rocket League. RL *deliberately* selects the path that will conform to the way the game is rigged whether it's against you or for you. If you have saved replays of matches you suspect are rigged I urge you to look at them and in slow motion. You will begin to notice that some ball touches don't look right. The trajectory of the ball is too high too low too slow too fast etc. It's not you. It's Psyonix (Shytonix) who has stacked the odds against you.There's a third type of rigging but it's not really rigging. Just players cheating and believe me there are plenty enough to feed to all the starving zoo lions in the world. Cheats seen frequently in the game include Speed hacks noticeable when the player is twice the distance from the ball as you are and somehow is able to hit the ball at 100 kph into your goal even though you clearly hit the ball away from them first. Speed hacks can affect dodge speed boost speed or both. Aimbot hard to spot but used by low skill players who want to impress you with their fake (completely cheated) aerial skills and impossible angle shots Auto Demolition which decreases the speed at which you need to hit an opponent to make them explode. The dead giveaway here is to watch low speed collisions turn into BOOMs. Anti demolition the opposite of the above where a player can avoid being exploded even when the opponent rams into the player at the highest velocity possible. Again easily spotted from replaysNow would you really like to pay $20 to play a game that's rigged from the getgo and infested with cheaters? Your choice )
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League has a special spot for me in games. It was the first game I ever really tried to play competitively. Do I regret it? No. If you don't know the premise of the game well what rock have you been living under? Anyway it's a pretty basic concept. You hit the ball in the goal. As you progress in the game you will realize that it is a hell of a lot more than hitting a ball into a goal (if you get that far I know people who just play for a couple hours). If you don't get too in depth who cares? It is a fun little game and not everyone has to be the best. That is one problem I see with games like this. Especially in League of Legends. Mainly if you are a "casual" 90% of the community looks down on you. This issue is pretty much non existent in rocket league. The main thing that was holding me back from wanting to be decent at League of Legends was the simple fact that if you test something new or start playing a new character and don't do extrememly well you team flames the living out of you depending on how toxic they are. On the topic of toxic communities every game has them. Rocket League is no exeption however I do feel like there are lots of nice players in the community that are willing to help you get better. Or if you are just having fun you won't get flamed. Overall I have found a lot of friends to play this game with just by adding them on my friends list. All of them are really decent people. Besides a few bad apples the community is fairly decent.The gameplay has more depth than someone just looking at it might think. Some of the stuff very good players looks easy on paper but it is insanely hard to pull off especially when you are against an equally good team. Anyone who has tried to "pick up" this game knows what I'm talking about. The view of this game as a casual is no different than someone who try hards every game. The matchmaking system in casual games is surprisingly good. Every time I searched when I was a pro or vetran I got matched with someone at my level. Does that mean you win every game? No but it gave me a good fun and most of all close game. Overall if you play this game avidly or just play it once every 3 months you will have a good time. That is of course if you like the gameplay. Which is your opinion I'm not gonna argue with you.
title: Rocket League®

review: The amount of fun I have had in this game...I didn't expect it to be so good!Playing with buddies is a laugh and playing against them can get really competitive which is also a laugh. And when you score the sense of achievement is awesome!The controls are super easy to play with the technique (shooting actually being able to hit the ball) on the other hand is for you to master! It can take time or you take to it straight away!The only negative this game has at this moment in time is that the servers are constantly going down. This is more than likely to improve seeing as it has just launched on both PC and PS4 so some server troubles are expected. Other than that this game is excellent! If you enjoy playing competive skillful games this one is for you!

review: You lived in south east asia?Well too bad psyonix don't care about you. Just forget about this game. I'm serious.There's this thing called "region filter" that could helped you get matched in the servers to your liking and for the better ping. But unfortunately south east asia option are combined with australian server. And guess what? You will be matched into australian server undefinitely in ratio 99% you WILL BE.What's wrong with australian server? IF you lived in south east asia you will get horrible ping.Which would made the ball delayed constant stuttering and ball glitching everywhere.You want to have fun like the other player? nope you south east asian players you can't even play it with smooth connection.Forget about complaining to psyonix they will never hear you. Take it from the guy who already complained about the same thing for 88 times (still counting) and no response at all.Also if you lose 3 times to the same person you can bet my life you will be mathced to the same guy for 10 more times before finally you find another person.Now if you already consider all the things above you may buy the game.

review: Arguably one of the best multiplayer games in existence o particularly if you play with friends but still great solo. Has a great starter tutorial addicting music tons of car customization loot drops crates and an incredibly high skill ceiling. There is also skill based matchmaking so you don't have to worry about getting grouped against pros. There are also many modes to choose from including casual and competitive. If you're a gamer there is no reason to NOT buy this game. Best played with a controller.

review: My ImpressionEverybody probably knows this game by now.But there is way more to it than big balls and little cars and that's what makes it so interesting and worth playing for a long long time.TL DRBeing quick is an essential part of the game so let me give you a fast overview Positive Mediocre Negative+ Fun for beginner intermediate and pro but sometimes very frustrating + Loads of cool mechanics take a lot of time to learn + great car and item variety a lot has to be unboxed traded or bought + Great arena designs some may lag on older systems most goal posts aren't see through and obscure vision+ Cool and fresh soundtracks some might not like environmental sounds toxic communityThe GuideI will put the main part of this review into a steam guide the foremost reason is that there is far too much I want to talk about.To justify making it a guide review I will put a lot of reference to it and go into more detail so I hope you can accept my decision and enjoy it regardless.

review: I know I don't have a lot of hours on steam but together on PlayStation and steam I have about 700 hours. So you can trust me. Positives &gt The community is great and you will rarely find a toxic player.&gt Skill groups are balanced very well for ranked play.&gt There is an unbelievable amount of items that you can receive to customize your ultimate vehicle of choice.&gt This game has a variety of awesome game modes that you can play as well as the option to customize the amount of players you want to play with.&gt This game won't run on every system like CSGO would but if you can reach a stable 30 FPS that's all you will need to have fun and preform.Cons &gt I only have one suggestion so not really even a con and that is you might wanna grab this game on a free weekend or on a sale because if you buy it and end up not liking it so much then you would have paid around ten dollars instead of 24.

review: Ok let me start off by saying this. If you got a great PC and the time to learn every little aspect in the game fun as If your on a low end PC such as myself this is the worst game for you to get. Imma start by saying this was meant to be soccer with cars which it still is sorta. When they added hockey game mode was excited ok not a bad addition so i stuck with it loved it. Ok coming out with maps with ramps and two goals oh wait what is this $hiet?? Frames were a little lower than usual but manageable because I loved the game was still willing to tolerate it. Then aquadome is released the biggest piece of crap map to exist literally a frame murdering pyschopathic $hiet fest. I still love the game at this point but aggravated they would make a map that disreguards all low end PC's. Then they come out with arcbase the 2nd most frame murdering map but is more manageable still easily playable ok just another map i have to leave when I join a game and see it. Still loving it added a feature that lets you pick maps you prefer only one down side the maps you dont prefer you still get and can only dislike 2 of them. That update infuriated me to no end and I made it a point to some people and they said Ok will look into it. Nothing happened for the longest time and still has not. Last thing on my $hiet rant... If your on a low end PC dont bother touching this game it will be a huge let down to you. Only reason I am probably still gonna play this is private matching with friends devs destroyed my hope of ever playing comp on there as well as Playing daily

review: Soccar/Football+Cars Rocket LeagueThis really truly is one of the best and unique games I've ever experienced. There's lots of customization for your car and lots of fun new gamemodes to try out! If you're into games with competitive seasons then you'll enjoy this game. There is a crate system (basically loot boxes) and after some games you can get a crate. In order to open them though you have to pay money to buy keys to access the suprise that's inside. The developers are extremely active by adding new DLC's crates items and other fun stuff for us to enjoy. Other than that it's a pretty awesome mashup game that I'd highly reccomend!

review: I loved playing this before the social justice update but... Now I see people complaining about bad performance from updates too? None of my friends are playing with it in this condition. This a n t iharrassment system that enables more of what it is trying to prevent is stupid and shouldn't exist. Online Bans are supposed to be for foulplay cheaters and hackers not for protecting your safe space. For unsportsman like play or chat griefing I feel if it is actually the programmers responsibility to protect you from negative online interactions to that extent it should only be through utilities like individualized blocklists or blacklisted matchmaking servers for rude uncooperative or frequent afk players to play amongst themselves. It's unreasonable to revoke service without breaking any agreed terms and I did not see my fellow players permanent happy mentality in the ToS. I literally haven't played ANY randoms or used any crate keys since they added bans because I feel anxious that BS would happen to me. Simply because matchmaking is such random unbalanced crap unfair games are not fun and leave children salty and report happy.. If that happens to me I will likely never play again period. In the mean time I feel better leaving it alone permanently of my own volition and only playing IF friends I know who won't do that EVER play again. So far no luck..
title: Rocket League®

review: I've had this game quite some time and I figured that I should share my view about the game.I hate it. I like car games and football games in general. This game was fun first but I got sick of it when I had about 60 80 hours in the game.I've tried to start liking it since some of my friends plays it but I can't do it. I'm usually calm and goofy when I play games but this game just frustrates me a lot. I get mad and quit the game almost every time I play it. Community that I've met are total faces. I had to remove whole chat from the game. I've never even thought about removing chat window in any other game. I like chatting with random fellas. With rocket league the community is so toxic and the chat is filled with ridicilous spam. I couldn't handle that. It annoyed me so much.Casual gamemode is not fun for the most parts. I haven't been playing it for a long time. If I remember correctly the balance was bad and there were many leavers. Ranking system is really bad in my opinion. There are so many players misranked in rising star rank. You can really see it clearly that some players in the same rank play completely different game. Today I played 4 matches in a row and it was complete mismatch every game. I get easily bored if enemies are playing really bad. Also many times I feel like I'm playing against really good players and lose a crushing defeat. I don't really mind losing to good players since it gives me the opportunity to learn more and get better. But again. Mismatch.I don't like the weird lucky stuff in the game but hey maybe someone thinks it's the game's feature and belongs in it. I'm just one stupid guy with opinions.I really can't recommend this game. I just despise it so much I had to write this review. That at least tells me a lot.
title: Rocket League®

review: Chinese Taipei? C'mon that's super offensive. I would have refunded and uninstalled the game if my little brother didn't want me to play it with him. The Taiwanese Flag is literally the flag of the REPUBLIC OF CHINA which is NOT "Chinese Taipei." If you are going to kowtow to communist countries demands you should just remove the flag altogether. But those of us with family in Taiwan are pretty offended by this footed move. An entire nation of people wanting to show pride in their country has to have their pride degraded by their country not even being referred to by its own name. Can you imagine the uproar if they listed the United States flag as "British North American Colonies"? Regarding gameplay I love it but the blood and tears shed in the past over this outrageous naming convention (Chinese Taipei) makes me say that for such a "minor" little thing (is the United States flag a *minor* thing to you? Think about how the people of Taiwan feel) makes me unable to recommend this game to my family and friends in Taiwan.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a game that is "Physics Based" game but as soon as you get to gold you will see the game is full of smurfs and horrible match making that will keep you stuck in one rank for what seems like forever. Say if you are in Plat but belong in Diamond you will never get out of plat because rocket league will just match you with smurfs and people who should also be in diamond but because of teammates or just the fact they don't come against Plat players and instead Diamond players. They base yourr rank off of wins and not performance. often time you will wins multiple games in a row and not go u a division but after your 6 game win streak you will lose one game and go down a division or sometimes win a game and still go down a divsion but you can't lose a game and go up a division. Rocket Leagues servers are just full of smurfs and players who don't belong in the rank you are in making it hard to go up a rank once you make it to gold and unless you are a lucky youtuber you wont get any good teammates that will drag you down make you lose and despite playing well it will make you go down a division. This plus the lag makes this a broken game not making any effort to make the servers better and less lagy. I loved Super Sonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars but this is just not a very good sequell and with the way it is it should still be in beta.

review: Simply put Rocket League is a new and unique take on an old game. Soccer is already the most widely played sport in the world so why not add cars that can play soccer? That is exactly what the creators of Rocket League have done. The high speed game puts you in the driver s seat and tells you to hit the ball into the goal. It is easily one of my favorite games to play because of the pure and simplistic nature of the game.The developers have done really well with the game. There is very few if any bugs and most of them have to do with the actual servers. They have focused on perfecting the mechanics and balancing everything out for the best possible experience. The game itself is not a hard one to learn while some of the more acrobatic moves may be harder everything comes in due time. The use of cross platform integration is also another really great addition that shows that the developers care. Being able to play with your friend on an Xbox or PS4 means that you no longer have to buy a console to play with them. In general it is evident that the developers care for the game.Unlike other games on Steam the skins and other cosmetic features in Rocket League aren t a cancer to the game. For the most part the cosmetic features have no actual monetary value and while you can by keys for cases that drop in game you can t actually sell the items on the Steam Community Market. However the addition of some cars via DLC has caused distress due to the fact that some cars hitboxes are bigger than others. This gives players an unfair advantage by paying for certain DLCs because it allows them more surface to hit the ball. While most people don t mind it is on occasion that you will encounter someone salty about it after a loss.Sometimes the smallest things are what make a game and Rocket League is not short of small features. Similar to CS GO s GOTV Rocket League s replay system allows for watching your best games. In addition the replay feature also has automatic cinematic features that will track the ball or a player of your choosing. While the functionality of watching matches live is pretty exclusive the spectator option is viable especially for live streamers. Additionally Rocket League is full of other small features including Car presets tutorials built in training workshop integration and many other features.Game modes in Rocket League are also another one of its strong suits. Obviously the soccer or Soccar is the main selling point but games like basketball and hockey allow for some variety. Of course moving away from traditional sports the Rumble a derby with power up variant of Soccar and Dropshot where the floor is broken by the ball till the point that it falls through the floor showcases the best features of the game.With the addition of game modes comes new maps to play them on. Like most games there are a variety of different maps to play on and Rocket League is no exception. Most of the maps are simple rounded rectangular pitches with boosts spaced out and two goals at either end however this convention was broken with the addition of Wasteland that featured a slight slope on either side as it neared the wall allowing for a variety of new tactics to test out. Neo Tokyo changed the convention once again by adding two raised sections on the sides of the map. It was changed once more with Starbase Arc which instead of a rectangle was an octagon. All of these maps were tested prior to their release for competitive play in Rocket Labs play menu which currently features and tests additions the developers want to add.While the addition of new maps gets some people excited others aren t to happy. At the forefront users who have played Starbase Arc aren t too happy with the shape as the ball bounces differently on the angles and because the map is substantially bigger. To combat this the game has implemented a pseudo veto feature that allows you to vote not to play that map granted other players in the game will also have to veto the same map for it to be removed from the queue.Many features in the game are good however one of the biggest problems that plague the game is the abandoning in the middle of competitive play. While the developers have implemented a 15 minute suspension from playing any online game mode competitive or not this is not really a deterrent for most. Additionally the ELO system in the game is broken and like most games it can take you 2 games to derank and 10 games to rank up. To combat this the developers introduced divisions inside the actual rank giving you not only a more general idea of your overall rank but also seeing how close you are to demotion.In general the game is free of major game breaking glitches and bugs. The development team takes great care of the game and for the most part it is very entertaining to play. Overall the game is a 9/10 because of the mastery exemplified in the simplistic yet mechanically complex nature of the game. In all honesty the game would have received a 10/10 however I felt that some issues need to be properly addressed first. Altogether however the game is worth the price in fact I would say that the price is perfect for what the game is.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've played more of this game than I realized. It sucks you in with 5 minute matches and frenetic aggrivating at times gameplay. Super fun and has me screaming at the screen so much (in good ways and bad). All that said there really isn't too terribly much here. I got it on sale for around 10$ and I don't know that I'd have paid much more than that. All the unlocks are cosmetic same with ALL the DLC. So...sure I'll pay 2$ to drive around the BTTF Delorean but that's not why you're going to keep playing this.The learning curve can be steep for some it definitely keeps you learning and trying to just be aware of where the ball and other players are so you can set up plays and position yourself in the best places.Ranked matches can be brutal the competition can be intense but it's also a ton of fun to invest in getting good at the game.7/10 good lightweight fun that can be taken to absurd levels.

review: This is a game that I'd recommend for anyone that wants to just have fun with friends. It is basically a perfect mixture of a car game and a football game. If you think however that this game is a football game like FIFA you should not buy the game. This game is again a game not as fun when played alone but with friends it is a bunch of fun. From my experience I'd always play this on a big TV screen with a controller rather than on a keyboard as this certainly works way better with a controller. I encountered some problems while trying to get my controller to work but it was easily fixed with some help from the Steam Discussions. Whether you play with the kayboard or a controller stick wit hone of them. It's really hard to switch when you're already up and running.I like that the game has a bunch of vehicles to choose from and quite a lot of customizing options for them as well. If you like the mixture this game offers I'd recommend buying it.Quite a good game 8 5/10**EDIT**Now that I've gotten a bit more into the game's competitive aspect I really have to say that it beats the casual playstyle I talked about in this review previously. Of course everyone has their own opinion but I think the game is best played with a friend or two when playing competitive. Except for Rumble. Nothing beats Rumble.
title: Rocket League®

review: This Game didn t have a huge marketing machine behind it at first and not many people played it from the start because they just simply didn't know about it but you found it and loved it. review: Title Rocket LeagueThis review is largely subjective and is mostly based on personal opinion. Overall Note This aggregate score averages each weighted applicable category on a scale of 0% to 100% where 50% is a neutral score higher scores are positive and lower scores are negative. I typically grade each category in multiples of 5%.Aggregate Score 79.1%Aggregate Score (Without Story Score) 97.3%Scores by categoryWeighted 4.00 Price Index 100%Weighted 3.00 Playtime/Replayability 100%Weighted 3.00 Story 0%Weighted 2.00 Visuals/Graphics 95%Weighted 2.00 Sounds/Music 95%Weighted 1.00 Hardware Requirements 90%Weighted 1.00 Absence of Bugs 95%Flying car soccer I mean Rocket League is easily the highest rated game in my library if I disregard any sort of story because there is none. It can serve as a fun party game with your friends but it can also be a sweaty neckbeard's paradise in the competitive scene because there are so many ways to outscore your opponents. Needless to say the skill ceiling is pretty much infinite. All in all flying car soccer was and still is one of the best games to ever grace this planet in 2015."It's flying car soccer. What's not to love?" $ Price Index Worth even MORE than full price Completely worth full price Wait for a sale Be prepared to refund this title No Man's Sky (Do not ever purchase this abomination to the gaming industry)For $20 this game is a steal. People have been sucked into thousands of hours of playing this game just in the past 3 years of its existence. Playtime/Replayability Highly replayable (&gt 250 hours) Long (100 250 hours) Average (50 100 hours) Short (10 50 hours) Minuscule (0 10 hours)If you get bored of this game before you hit 500 hours then you shouldn't even video game bro. Story Masterpiece Memorable Good Average Poor NoneUnfortunately with my grading system the perfect game would have a masterpiece of a story along with perfect scores in everything else. Since Rocket League does not have any story whatsoever that significantly brings down its Aggregate Score. Disregarding any sort of story gives this game a 97.3% Aggregate Score which is nearly flawless so having no story is not a bad thing. Visuals/Graphics Masterpiece Beautiful Good Average Poor Visual catastrophe Ask M. Night Shyamalan to make a movie of itThe game just looks fantastic. But we should expect this since it runs on Unreal Engine a very well developed framework. Sounds/Music Masterpiece (Beethoven is smiling in his grave) Memorable Good Average Poor Do not put your ears through this terrorMonstercat and its artists have been heavily involved in the makings of this game's soundtrack and they have done a phenomenal job making the music memorable. Most of it is fast paced EDM but what more do you need for a game where you can score a gnarly soccer goal flying upside down in a muscle car? Hardware Requirements A stone tablet should be able to run it Minimum Average High End Quantum Computing may not be enoughAlso thanks to Unreal Engine this game doesn't require much of any sort of serious hardware. The graphics settings are vastly tweak able so pretty much any system should be able to run this game no problem. Bugs None to report Some but still completely playable Several annoying bugs UnplayableEvery now and then you'll find a bug with the game but these bugs usually appear fresh from a major update and are usually patched up pretty quickly in hotfixes. Unlike most developers Psyonix cares a lot about this game. Audience Fetus (&gt 0) Kids (&gt 4) Everyone (&gt 8) Teenagers (&gt 13) Adults (&gt 18) Casual players Pro playersI'd like to see your newborn son destroy Turbopolsa Lethamyr Sizz GarrettG or any other recurring competitive player in RLCS. Some people are just gifted at this game including fetuses (fetii? Irrelevant). Skill Level Better make this your day job Sweaty neckbeards galore Requires reasonable effort Minuscule effort Just look at the screen and you winThis is the one category that doesn't really matter. Anyone can play this game and enjoy it... except for maybe some vehicular sports haters. If you're competitive sometimes you'll do the carrying and sometimes you'll get carried. If you're a casual gamer just relax and enjoy the game. Miscellaneous Fair warning beware of toxic people. But that's to be expected in any competive game.

review: This game is fun to play really.But the physics are not really good. Maybe for the first look but not more.The ball between 2 players with the same speed...Ball flys right in my goal with about 200mph! Dafuq...Every time...Never in the enemys goal gg.If the ball hits the walls once every physic is gone until it hits the ground....Falling down like a stone won't return the right way.And the best part is the luck is this game...I am so skilled in taking shots but everytime I hit metal . The enemy hits me in the ball and somehow the ball flys all over the map in my goal...They shoot against 4 walls and perfect goal....I shoot against one and the ball should score but what? yea metal... this If you have luck in life get this game and you are happy if not leave it! No fun for skilled players...I am skilled really when I am playing with my friends it's so much fun we are all good no luck or But hey 20 is ok if you want to ruin your controller your mousepad your desk and your monitor...This game will get you in a rage mode you will experience no where else..Believe me...LOL Battlefield and COD are not even close to this games rage modes...If you buy it anyway I have warned you!gl hf

Their new updated agreement requires you to forfeit your ownership in the game saying that you are only buying the license to play the game not to own it so at any given time they can take that license away and take all of your stuff with it unless you transfered it before they revoked your license.A lot of people might not care about this but this is terrifying and more and more games are starting to do this. They basically never want you to own anything but instead buy a subscription to a game so they are not tied up to your purchase.This is extremely shady and if I knew they were going to do this I would've never bought their repetitive stupid microtransaction infested piece of game.20$ for a ing license to play a game is outrageous. you Psyionix go to hell you greedy bastards.

review: I've played this game on Xbox One/Nintendo Switch for about 100 Hours. Recently just switched over to PC and have put in about 30 (at time of writing this).Rocket league is unique. Everything about it on paper sounds so wrong but the way it feels when you play it feels so right. There's a reason it just won Steam's "Suspension of Disbelief" award. This game is so much fun with such odd premises! Whoever came up with the idea that playing soccer with cars was a good idea might be crazy but MAN that person couldn't have been more correct!Pros Lots of FunQuick MatchesPlenty of GamemodesBetter Than Average NetcodeDLCs are CosmeticSustainable Trading MarketEasy to Play (w/ High Skill Ceiling)Competitive (&amp eSports)Optimized Very WellUpdated OftenCons Pretty Toxic CommunityFor my only con to be the community shows how well this game was made because my only gripe has nothing to actually do with the game itself. That being said any game that is considered "competitive" will have plenty of toxic people playing it. But you will find your fair share of friendly people playing this game and if you find people that are being rude in chats you can easily mute them.This is a fantastically well made game that suits all people old and young casual or competitive!Thanks Psyonix!

review: Before I say anything about this my first opinion was that this game looked ABSOLUTELY boring.Holy I was wrong. My boyfriend and his friends played this and told me how fun it was. I really wasn't interested but a friend got me the game so I said "ah what the hell I'll try it." I haven't really played it much but it's really funny. I was new to the game and became an instant MVP against some people marked as Pros. I don't play with a controller (I suggest you do) but I still have fun. This game is great with freinds and matches don't take TOO long so it's loads of fun. Pros Customizaion Tons of fun for hours Easy to unlock stuff Blow people up You can play WITHOUT a controllerCons It's better with a controller Some lag for me here and there before a game starts (My laptop is very new and can DEFINETLY run games like this) Ocassional trolls or afks More fun (for me) with friends than alone.I would rate this game honestly 8/10. I would rather play it on a console than PC but it's still super fun. Recommended
title: Rocket League®

review: It's rocket cars wot are playing soccer. Now consider your reaction to that and then know that whether that sentence sounds utterly brilliant or heartbreakingly stupid is irrelevant. This is the greatest game about cars playing footie the world has ever known or likely will know and it will lay its hooks into you in an instant like only the best games can. This is because there's one extra twist to this (I'm going to hell for this) CARtoon premise These things can JUMP. Not just useless little hops like so many kart based games either (and there is a lot of karting in this game's DNA) no sir these things DOUBLE JUMP in any direction hurling the very concept of inertia to the ground beneath them and farting triumphantly in its abstract face! The end result is less vehicular mayhem and more litter of overexcited puppies going after a giant soccer ball and the fact it's still a bunch of tiny toy cars in hats leaping about makes it an only slightly less adorable thing to watch. You'll feel the psychological benefit most acutely while you're getting bashed and bludgeoned into tiny bits in the best traditions of both soccer and NASCAR. There are some teething troubles with matchmaking but early days etc. and quitters will probably always be a problem but other than that I have nothing negative to say about this game it's a beautiful thing on every level. Somewhere out there is a teal sports coupe with a sombrero and your name on it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Overall this game is absolutely phenomenal. Probably one of the only games without a skill cap as everything is constantly evolving and new stuff is discovered everyday. Besides the little glitches here and there the only issue with this game is smurfing. This is obvious in any game with competitive and seeing how this is picking up significant traction and one of the best games you can play (objective) that relies solely on skill. Due to this however people are consistently smurfing in competitive (mostly 1v1 and sometimes 2v2). I dont understand the reasoning for this seeing how freeplay is a viable option with more than enough people in it. Most of the time it is C1 C3 who cant advance any further and practice aerial control and new mechanics. Theres no issue with this but its kind of off putting especially to newer players. Other than that and the occasional toxic player this game is one of a kind.Recent updates involving how XP was given and the Rocket pass are very disappointing. Understanding they're trying to revamp the game and give people more of a reason to play is nice and all but the new XP distribution focuses mostly on goals and saves and if you only play support youre getting half the XP as you did previously. The Rocket Pass is too much of a grind. 100 hours in 3 months seems reasonable however most people dont have more than 1500 or even 1000. Using myself for example I have almost 800 hours in. If I wanted to achieve the full Rocket Pass I would have to put an 1/8th of the time I already had in. This game is a fun pick up and play game but I doubt people want to sit and play for 4 hours a day for 25 days ball chasing to get enough xp for each tier.
title: Rocket League®

review: I'm roughly about 500 hours into this game and have found it to be one of the most addictive in my 25 years of PC gaming! There are skills to be acquired as well as noticable improvement that you will experience playing from day to day. For the most part other players are welcoming and you can find lots of fun people to play alongside most times of the day. This game is most certainily worth the $20 asking price but keep in mind that it can become quite expensive should you choose to start opening some of the crates tht you will earn (purely cosmetic items). I almost exclusively play the hockey or "Snow Day" servers which seem to have the most easy going players.Edit Now +2000 hours in and still going strong!
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Let me start by saying that what this game offers (driving meets soccer) it does very well. The game works well the cars handle about how you would expect and that's all I can really say. That being said the game also doesn't offer a whole lot. It only takes about 30 minutes of gameplay to see everything the game has to offer. All that comes after that is trying to master the game which would take quite some time. The game is easy to learn and hard to master which can certainly be appealing to some people but I find there isn't enough in the game to recommend. It only took a few hours of gameplay for me to get bored of the game and I imagine many players will feel the same.

The gameplay mechanics are really smooth it's car independant nevertheless. Competitive play is kinda broken at the moment the matchmaking is too random all ranks can be matched against each other (f.e. a Diamond 1 can meet a Silver 2) but don't that let discourage you some people have more luck than others and gain ranks merely by waiting for their opponents to forfeit. But once you play with "steady" players you learn their moves and whatnot. Overall highly recommendable!
title: Rocket League®

review: Football meets Racer. Rocket League is a rare example where the execution of a simple absurd idea is so strong and so engaging that it doesn t need a ton of extra features around it. The rush of ripping across the pitch at full turbo to deny a shot on goal with a clutch bicycle kick is enough to bring me back time and time again for just one more match even without meaningful progression systems. Rocket League is a great goofy easy to learn and difficult to master action sports game which demands that you grab a few friends and play a "few" rounds.
title: Rocket League®

review: Unnamed racetrack June Seventh Two Thousand Sixteen.The road is hot the smell of burnt rubber in the air. There is nobody but me and the ball. Here I am my "mad max" machine of a remote controlled rocket powered car if you would. I'm accelerating towards the ball at ludicrous speeds guitar thrashing in the background as my turbo boosted car pummels through the other plebeian cars. "WITNESS ME!" I shout loudly into my microphone Jump jump right over the opposition as I sail towards the ball slamming into that rubbery spherical object with my car. My "Magnum Opus" has a clear shot and I took it. It's as wide open WS the Great Sandy Plains of Australia from whence I had been summoned from. I watch contently with the Ball Cam TM as the ball rolls towards the goal almost in slow motion. "OH WHAT A DAY! WHAT A LOVELY DAY!!" I am now screaming into the microphone. My mouth parts have been sprayed over with chrome spray paint as I wildly shake around in my chair eager to sco Wait! What is this? A new challenger approaches me? What is this HERESY?!Off the corner of my vision I see him. He's about 30 feet to the the ball and I can almost taste it going into the goal! I cannot let this blue heretic deny my ascendancy to Ballhalla!"BALLHALLAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!"My shout pierces the heavens and this man's heart. I swerve to the side right in front of him flailing to the side from the inertia of this action. My car meets his his meets mine our cars fly almost gracefully in the battle over this small beautiful spherical obj EX SCORED!The words flash over the screen at the top as both his and my cars are flung away by the sirens. Vuvuzelas and trumpets blare loudly in the background and the shouting of pre pubescent males can be heard faintly over the celebration. But this does not faze me. I have pleased him. Immortan Joe he watches over me now over my team and simply chuckles at my futile attempt to score the goal. "Medicore!"But I have done him well I have SERVED HIM LIKE A GOOD WARBOY!True to what I said it was a lovely day. Oh what a lovely day!
