review: For some time now I haven't been able to play Rocket League I've only clocked 13 hours last year or so when I purchased it. I was looking to get back into it but as of late I've tried methods from three different Psyonix employees to try to get my game to run properly but nothing has worked. I don't know if anyone else has experienced trouble with games in general not running but I feel like I've tried everything. These are what I've tried.Press the Windows key Type Windows Firewall in the search bar Select Turn Windows Firewall on or offEnsure both Turn on Windows Firewall options are selected Select OK Select Allow a program or feature through Windows Firewall Check all boxes associated with Rocket League If you do not see Rocket League on the list click Allow another program find Rocket League and Select Add Select OK Afterwards add Rocket League as an exclusion to Windows Defender so that it is not blocked Go to Start &gt Settings &gt Update &amp Security &gt Windows Security &gt Virus &amp threat protection.Under Virus &amp threat protection settings select Manage settings and then under Exclusions select Add or remove exclusions. Select Add an exclusion and then select from files folders file types or process. The exclusion will apply to subfolders within a folder as well.Press Windows key + R. Enter "msconfig" in the entry field and hit enter.Go to the "Services" tab check the "Hide All Microsoft Services" checkbox and then hit the "Disable All" button.Select the "Startup" tab and open Task Manager. Disable all applications. Click the "OK" button and close the utility.Restart your computer so the steps take effect.Also please make sure to restore the factory defaults of the game settings Open Steam and select the Library tab Right click on Rocket League Select "Properties" Click "Set Launch Options" found under the "General" tab Type in autoconfig Click "Ok" Launch the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: An incredible game created by incredible developers that care for quality and their fans. Psyonix have put so much effort into creating this car football sequel and have delivered exactly what fans from the community have asked for. (And more!) The visuals are colourful over the top and impressive. Physics and gameplay are perfect and the game plays just how it should. Loads of customisation items. Literally millions of different combinations. The online is very very stable. Various ways to play with friends including up to 4 player split screen. Cross play for PC and PS4. A season mode for offline play. Replay editor which also acts as a photo mode is a very welcome feature. Future support for the game confirmed including DLC and free stadiums. Day one release on PlayStation Plus for free is a wonderful bonus and a very loyal move from Psyonix to their fans. This game is tons of fun and is the most fun I've had with a game in ages. You won't regret picking this up. Although you may never put it down.AWESOME STUFF
title: Rocket League®

review: The game has some great perks! Easy to get into matches and not overly complicated. That said... I haven't seen a worst community in ranked play in any game i've played. It's FILLED with trolls and vac banned cheaters. People consistently throwing the game with new accounts just to people off and put them in lower ranks. Unless you plan to ONLY play with others that you know ranked play is toxic for solo. The fact RL just lets this continue without addressing it is frustrating. This game is not Solo friendly at all in that aspect. You get punished for it because of these players. Which stops solo gamers from getting higher ranked items at the end of a season. So if you are playing Solo then this game is a no go.

review: Badly coded mess.I bought this game hoping it would run on my GNU/Linux installation. It didn't. At first I got a laggy main menu because graphics were set to Ultra by default. Then I changed my configuration to the lowest specs possible which made main menu navigation possible. The moment I enter any kind of match the game freezes and I have to restart my computer with Alt+SysRq+B. Also it's laggy no matter what. I have &lt 2 hours of "gameplay" (because I can't play) so I am considering a refund. Can you do something about the Linux release please? All of my other games work fine under Linux so this game is the exception rather than the rule.

review: This is by far not an entirely negative review but a statement of current player base. It is ever increasingly full of poison and salt derivated from LoL. Make a single mistake or even play well and do good passes and you will be cried upon by someone who has done far less for the team simply because of reason I cannot explain. There is plenty of fun to be had in unranked and with friends but play alone in solo ranked or with "strangers" as in non RL steam friends and you eventually will be so salty that not even the lobsters will want a taste of your remaining corpse.I was an all star and saw a quick purple sign before passing down again. I've gradually spiraled down to gold because of a chain of random salty people refusing to play well as they are more concerned with crying at your play regardless of being good or bad simply because it somehow contradicts their expectations from you. Perhaps they are offensive players and wish for you to camp in the goal all round perhaps they are supportive players trying to make passes and due to a sad childhood immediately rages on if not a 100% of their passes are perfectly picked up on every single time or maybe they're just tired after a 10 hour long shift at work with annoying customers and a baby that simply just won't stay quiet. Regardless of the circumstances play enough and you'll find yourself in a worse mood after logging off than before logging in.This league is nothing but a rocket full of salt eager to take off into oblivion.Though if you are able to not be upset by the unecessary and often unwarranted salty behavior Rocket League is an absolutely magnificent game with countless of hours of fun.
title: Rocket League®

Otherwise? More frustration than anything else on 1v1 or queuing solo standard with randoms which mainly destroy the game. Why is 1vs1 so bad than? Kind of boring repeating strategies with people literally camping every corner until you make the slightest mistake and counter you onto that after that you cant get to the ball when it slowly rolls inside of your goal without any skill needed I like to play a game for fun not for tryharding at 1v1.

Enjoy and remember everyone is just playing

review: Yeah The Witcher 3 is a good game. Sure GTA 5 is exciting. I guess all those MOBAs u kids like to play are entertaining.but have you tried Rocket League?I swear this game has never and will never get old. (Realize here that I spent most of my time with this game on PS4). I have worshipped this gem for these past few years similar to the way Gollum worshipped that one ring or whatever in the Lord of the Rings. Lately I've been trying to force myself off of this wonderful wonderful thing and try other titles mostly so I don't end up on one of those addiction television shows and to helplessly expand my gaming range. This game is perfect.I don't care who you are I don't care if you hate sports I don't care if you hate video games I don't care if you're one of those football kids who will most definitely be like "ew a soccer game".Buy this game.Grind this game.Love this game.Rage in this game.Troll in this game.Worship this game.

review: Rocket League is one of those rare games who've got the "from zero to hero" 's ideology.I still remember playing it one week after its release if I still remember it was released 5th July 2015 and I started playing it since 15 July 2015 on the cracked version (yeah I know I was still a poor young guy who doesn't follow the law) It was really a fun game and even nowadays still funny but not like before why? Simply I was discovering it by myself I got my actual skills thanks to the many games against pro bots (I loose often to all stars that's why) but after years and few months I decided it to buy the game 'cause I started getting bored from bots even I up to date the cracked version either of it I liked snowday and Hoops pretty much but it's time to shine on multiplayer. So I added Rocket League to my games list on 26th September 2016 at the end of Rumble's era ( . So from now on I play the game legally and without the updating's pain but i'm facing now another type of pain and it's community. Really I discovered that the PC community is too toxic and either my connection was bad (and still worse even with updating the MB) which means I experienced the ragequit for the first time in Rocket League . I'm not generalizing things but I concluded from season 4 that the ranking system is broken and unfair IDK but I can't believe a bronze skilled guy would be in Gold and Platinum. Regardless many players found out about that and Psyonix tried to improve their skills by adding costume training and adding the MMR's deal. But I cannot end my review with talking about the features they add a good car then a bad car good one and then a bad one but now they only post bad ones due to running out of ideas I liked much the Batmobile and Dominus they are just .... M A S T E R P I E C E ! And the soundtracks OOOOH MAAAN ! they add only dope ones before but now they collaborated with Monstercat and imagine the ball is music and Monstercat and Psyonix playing against us on a unfair match Monstercat (team) I got it! Psyonix (team) All yours! Psyonix Holy cow ! Psyonix What a play ! Psyonix Nice shot ! Chat disabled for 3 seconds. Monstercat Thanks! Community Wow!Nevertheless Rocket League is a fun game and I recommend you to play it but I advise you to play on party to have fun more and to not mate with toxic and unskilled players on ranked so yeah this is it Rocket League ! Kim Jong Un's favourite game !

review: When I was 18 I was a stereotypical socially awkward nerd. I had really sh i t luck with women and I was afraid of each and every girl I came across. I was a virgin as well. I had only kissed a couple girls not much other than that to be honest. My best friend Liam always got women. He always told me that talking to girls was easy and not scary at all just don't be a scared little dog and do it. I always wished I had his confidence. I asked for help to get a girlfriend/someone to so I wouldn't be a virgin finally. He said he'd help me I was so damn happy and scared at the same time.So one day he decided to take me to a party he was going to. He was content on getting me laid finally. I was nervous asf. I had a few drinks and I saw a girl I thought was a solid 8/10. A little feral though. Liam saw me looking at her and laughed. I asked him what was funny and instead he pushed me into the same girl. I apologised and was freaking out. Liam came over and said "This here is my boy he acts shy but he's a ing god. Treat him right." and took off elsewhere. The girl giggled and told me her name was Olivia. Even thought my autism kicked in and I was a complete idiot we hit it off. A guy she knew came over and told her to come have a smoke with him. She said yes as he grabbed her hand and started walking off. She asked me if I smoked I have never but I said yes anyway cause I wasn't letting this dog take her away from me. I inhaled my first cigarette and naturally I had a coughing fit. They laughed but it was all good. 1 year after that party I was dating Olivia. She took my virginity and we hit it off. I started smoking more often because why not life was good. I loved her more than I will anything. At least it was until Olivia dumped me. Olivia cheated on me with Liam. Multiple times. The love of my life and my best mate.I became immensly depressed and started chain smoking. At least a pack a day. I did this for a solid 7 months. One day I started to feel a pain whenever I took a deep breath. I myself. I went to to doctor's to find out what was happening. I was so damn worried. My doctor said they'd call me with results after a short time.After a week my doctor called me up with some results. I was freaking the out at this point. He said I was all clear and lucky because my cells defended my body before cancer could take affect. I cried for 3 days out of relief. I beat cancer. Just for Rocket League to give it back to me.
title: Rocket League®

review: Disney Cars meets Fifa with added physics.. nuff said.. Recomend ++++EDIT That review was when I barely had hrs in but still had a lot of fun. REAL REVIEWPros 1 ) CROSSPLATFORM++ 2) PHYSICS++ 3) 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4 game modes and it has a ranking system ++ 4) Graphics are pretty good ++ 5) You can distinguish betwen ps4/pc players++ 6)When people leave in normal games bots will replace them++ 7)free/tutorial mode will defintatley help you practice the game ++Cons 1) When people leave in rank games bots will NOT replace them. This is why I lost a few of my games when I play rank. 2)No buddy invites yet for ps4/pc but I hear they are working on a solution(reading through articles and stuff not 100% sure if its true) 3) mechanics are really hard to learn and master play tutorial and free roam mode thing Can't really think of anymore cons but great game 8/10. If the rank system is a little better might get a better score. I wouldn't mind bots replacing my teams it's better than 1v3.
title: Rocket League®

review: I gave this game dozens upon dozens of hours to change my mind and I can only come away with a negative impression.It controls nicely. Its netcode is solid given the ludicrous amount of traffic. The concept needless to say is original and brilliant.And then you realize you actually have to sit down and play.At times this game will make you want to disembowel yourself with the nearest dull object within reach. The matchmaking in this game is perfectly streamlined to provide you with the most insufferable caustic simpleminded oxygen thieves that the human race has to offer. You will be unable to predict your teammates' movements so don't even try. Half the time they will turn and intentionally score on your goal just to torment a new player.In advanced and competitive play there's a technical term "pinching" which involves two players colliding with the ball from two different angles simultaneously. If legitimate physics applied something would break buckle or crumble but since everything in this game is indestructible the ball goes flying at hundreds of kilometers per hour. This one phenomenon cracks the physics engine wide open and makes the game look like a half baked beta. At least sixty percent of goals scored in ranked mode are due to "pinches" because no one can move fast enough to block them and with inordinate frequency they end up landing square in the center of someone's goal.This game is not about skill. It's about luck at least immediately after being a terrible terrible person.The only reason I haven't had this game permanently removed from my account refund be damned is because I don't know if it will delete my review. I want as many negative reviews to stay up as possible.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is in competition for my #1 game of all time. The replayability depth of skill and overall presentation is first class. I can always fall back to Rocket League whenever I "don't know what to play".I've purchased this game twice first discovering it through PS Plus. I probably have a similar amount of hours on the PS4 as I do on Steam.I thoroughly approve of how Psyonix has handled keys/crates. Pure customization no competitive advantage by spending money. This is a fantastic game and you will never regret purchasing it (except maybe after going on a 10 game losing streak in ranked).Addendum I've noticed an increase in negative reviews because of their automated ban system. Just wanted to mention that I've never been banned on either platform nor have any of my friends. If you're a decent person who isn't contributing to the toxicity of online ranked you will be fine.

review: Where do I begin Rocket League is truly a game like no other. Unlike other types of games such as the fps genre where your prior skill in the genre helps you adapt to game your new to Rocket League doesn't.If your looking for a game you can play with a couple of friends and really grind and practice to see your self get to that level of skill you want to be at this is it.Nobody is good when they start but its easy to get a hold of and just as hard to master the mechanics because players are always finding new ways to score goals.Im terrible at this game but I keep coming back because this game isn't just about rising through the ranks or being at the top of the leaderboard its about testing yourself... Every shot every wall dribble and every fake is the result of practice and reading your opponents theres hardly any RNG and nothing feels better then getting a shot you've been trying to get for hours days or even weeks. This is because the game is hard but it never gets old or too difficult.Devs care about community and are trying to be more transparent. So get ready for some What A Save! 's and some trash talk but I know you can handle yourself I hope you get this game and I hope maybe we can play a few games.But for real buy this game! 9/10 Wish there were more items you could get without loot boxes

review: COMING FROM SOMEONE WHO REACHED C2 in season 8 on few accs after 1300hrsDont even start playing this game. Its a complete waste of time. Devs are becoming more and more greedy for money while providing nothing in return. Guess what. You can reach champion while being complete trash in real life. You dont even need 70iq to achieve this. This game is all about addiction. People are spending thousands of hours playing this trash. The sooner you realise that you are addicted the better for you. This game is all about playing (wasting your time) as much as you can so you can reach balls faster (WOW HIGH QUALITY GAMEPLAY RIGHT THERE LMAO). The worst part of it is the matchmaking. When u're playing solo queue you can play against premade players (20% of time one of them is smurfing) while in your team you get someone who got carried by his friend/ booster (the same way as that enemy player) and now solo queues so he plays like trash. OH WELL! Too bad you will lose 10mmr points as the enemy team's smurf was 2 ranks below AND YOU SHOULD HAVE WON THAT GAME AS HIS RANK WAS LOWER THAN YOURS while you gain 7mmr for usual win ) What a beautiful game rocket league is. STOP WASTING YOUR TIME ON THIS STUPID GAME AND START DOING SOMETHING USEFUL IN YOUR LIFE.

review: Rocket League has taken over my life but only in a good way.OK...maybe not quite my life but I spend A LOT of my free time on this game. After racking up more than 1200 hours gameplay since November I still feel like I'm learning the game.I think that's the beauty of this game it's so accessible to a wide range of players and their skill levels and the game just keeps on giving. The in game community are fantastic and a few of the "pro" players stream on Twitch so there's always a way to interact.The gameplay is fantastic and the physics and mechanics of the game allow for a wide variety of manoevures and skills to be learned over time. It is also a very aesthetically pleasing game so a big shout out to the arty guys at Psyonix. For those that want to take the game more seriously there are several tournaments every week with prizes Gfinity Mockit and ESL spring to mind straight away not to mention the Rocket League Championship Series that is currently underway.The level of customisation for your car is also impressive although I do wish there were more colours and decals to choose from!Overall an extremely fun game that you can play casually or seriously with friends you know or friends you don't. It's a game that just keeps on giving.David (the world's worst Rocketeer)

review: Let me start of by saying I have had hours of fun playing this game. I have also had hours of truly awful gameplay. This used to be a great game. I would have recommended it several years ago. It's fun. It's easy to drop into. It gets regular free updates. What's not to love right? Well the problem is that you are only as good as the people it pairs you up with. Here is the problem. The game is a victim of its own success. I would say at least 75% of the time once the first goal is scored someone on the now losing team will just quit the game. They will write it off and move on to the next match. I would say at least 33% of the time I go to join a match and get slotted into a team that is down 7 0 with 3 minutes left in a match.Everyone seems to just accept this and point out that ranked play solves this problem. I've also been told to just play with friends. I bought this for some casual fun where I just drop in as needed. Scheduling with friends is not that. I just want to casually play a game for fun and blow off steam. This game used to be amazing at that. It might some day return to that state. I actually hope it does because the developers are basically doing everything else right. Until then this game is not recommended.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've seen this game for quite a while and have been on the edge on buying it. On one hand the reviews from just about everyone have been positive which is hard to ignore however everything I saw Pictures Gameplay videos and the like just didn't seem appealing at all. I don't like soccer and I hardly like racing games.. so I put this game on the backburner of things to buy.Welp when I finally decided to buy it and launched my first session was 4 hours long. This game is super addicting. It has all the right elements simple to learn yet still having the desire to get better competitive yet casual unlockables that are interesting and make you want to keep playing. All in all it's a blast. If you were like me and on the edge about this game you're doing yourself a disservice by not buying it. Believe the hype.

review: This is my most played game.Community is buttcheeks though. Everyone reports everyone for the dumbest Bunch of 3 year olds. Almost as cancerous as League.I would recommend this game but it depends if you can stomach a basic ranked system that is un refined and requires a lot of grinding to advance through tiers along with a toxic online community. Very few players understand communication and playing with a teammate. If you have someone to play with then it's insanely fun. I would highly suggest staying away from solo que all together.Outside of online play there is very little for solo play. The game offers a Season mode which you compete against AI in anywhere from 1v1 to 4v4 and an exhibition mode with adjustable modifiers to the match that are interesting but not very deep. Overall this is an online game with nothing much else to offer. If playing with other people is not your strong suit then stay away.

The journey of going from constantly missing the ball to dribbling around and over people takes time and requires a true love for this particular balance between mechanical skill and game sense. I've been playing this since launch and don't see myself stopping anytime soon as I get better and start to try some really wild stuff. Getting past the initial learning curve can be a hillarious mess but once you start blasting shots in you'll see why Rocket League is so popular.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of those games that generates its fan base and popularity off of raw gameplay. No story no interesting characters just pure gameplay. It's difficult to play this game for the first time and set the controller down just 30mins later. This statement also holds true whether you've played the game for 1 hour or 1000 hours. It's that good. It never gets old and it never stops being fun unless you run into the occasional human being who isn't to friendly towards others. There's quite a few of them who plague this game and sometimes it sucks. But hey that's life for ya.The best games out there (video games or not) all follow 1 common quote "Easy to learn and difficult to master". Just about anyone and their grandmother can pick this game up and have fun with it on their own level. But wanna git gud? Then just take one look at some of the Rocket League pros they got gud and they all started off the same as we did and so can you. It's crazy to think I debated for weeks on whether paying $20 for some silly car game was worth my money. Well that "silly car game" has become my most played game ever.Buy it on sale or not you wont reget it.The only reget you may have (like I did) is that you didn't buy it sooner.
title: Rocket League®

review: Although I only have 5.7 hours on PC edition I have played this game for over 1000 hours on Xbox and I love it. It is such a unique game and very addicting. I would highly recommend using a controller while playing because it is easier however using keyboard and mouse is just as fun. The only thing that lowers my liking of the game is that there haven't been many new game modes released recently (Probably because they are hard to make) and the game has slowly added more and more things that require money to get (Keys and DLC). I don't mind this however because it is not compulsory to have fun and part of the money given goes to funding E Sport for rocket league. I would probably rate it 8 9 / 10.

review: This game is one of those games that you can put hours into and still not master. It is easy to learn but hard to master. Above all this game is fun regardless of skill level age or interest in real world football. I believe this is a game almost anyone will enjoy and I strongly recommend everyone to try it out as you get a lot of hours for a relatively small amount of money.

review: I loved it from the first time I played it. I remember how I spend 5 hours per day to play it. Is it much? Probably yes since I don't spend so much time playing just one game. What's so great about Rocket League? Probably everything. Starting how easy the gameplay is and how hard it is to win. Because of how small teams are every player's role is important. Without any teamplay you can't win sure to some point you can but that's not what Rocket League is about. Trying your best to defend attack and use every chance there will be to score climbing ladder in competetive matches and just having simply fun in hockey or basketball. I don't remember when I had last this much fun playing online game. Don't wait for sale discover fun of Rocket League today. It's not really high price for a game you could probably spend more than XXX hours into. There are also some DLCs but YOU DON'T NEED THEM TO ENJOY GAME and some kind of loot system similar to one in CS GO but I'm thankful it didn't reach Steam market. People could focus on simply getting drops and it would turn into something we don't really want to get...

review: Simple idea football with cars well done.Graphics are decent sound is good altho i would prefer jukebox play options are even surprisingly good enough.Atop of variants of the football varriants (from duel to 4v4) there are likes of basketball and hockey not having played those i can not judge the quallity but you do have options for playing outsside of the pressuminly main draw.customisation (something i tend to gravitate towards heavily) is pretty borad even with just free itmes altho you are being pushed towards lootboxes*. You can change colour of your car use some textures unlock some seasonal ones put on silly hats rocket boost style and even scoring effect and wheels. Unfortunatly this is in major part locked in lootboxes*.Gameplay ballance least fair point of the whole review and one of major reasons for not recommandation This is almost entirely dependant on luck because the system either dose not have enough players and you wil end up in team that dominates or is being dominated (no neither is fun). it seems to be using some sort of avarage. To be fair this dose usually occurs when longer wait time in an effort to get the game running. My point here is taht i would personaly prefer either choice of longer wait or bgoradeing of search.* And now the obvious problem LOOTBOXES specificaly RNG boxes that do drop duplicates with joke ammounts of free keys being ofeered ony during seasonal events.As the game stands at the moment and on the EU version of the game you can NOT purchase the content of lootboxes directly you are fully at mercy of the RND (which i can not emphesize enough CAN give you duplicates hell there are even duplicates with different properties for example traisl behind wheels can track various stats and i have 2 sets of them where one tracks time played and one goals scored that is the entire difference). there are lootbox exclussives styles (for exampled very nice doted dynamic livierty which looks really pretty even entire vehicles).Yes i can not recommand the game based solely on the RNG as even i was seduced to buy extra keys... twice. Weak willed that is what i am. i will NOt just elave it like this i do have a suggested solution keep the RNG in but make it free lootboxess for achivement keys for free per x game played allow players to buy ANNYTHING directly you allready ahve some cars avalible to purchase so just use that system?additionall complains (but those coud just be me being usless) trading items from lootboxess has odd restrictions i am unable to freely trade the items one by one only en mass (5x items if you trade solo for one item of higher quality) even than it appears to be limited to quality and type of lootbox there are way too manny types of lootboxess btw. Being me i offcourse can not figure out anny other way to trade as mentioned this could be on me.You will dodge the whole "just like EA" paraller that ill draw here just to stab at something that should not be present on PTP game.in summary buy the game on discount hide the lootboxess in your menu and pray that your will is strong enough.expectgood quick (5min) matches to be your quick unwind after a day rather than sticking around the game for hours..or do as i recommand and on principle do NOT buy the game untill they fix the damned lootbox system.
title: Rocket League®

I highly recommend this game for people who like cars and soccor.

review: The only saving grace of this game is the fact that it CAN be fun especially the first 50 hours or so. After that it just sinks from there. The worst part is probably that it seems like it has insane potential to be fun but it just never seemed to achieve that potential once I realized how bad the physics are and by how much bs there can be. Awful physics 80% of the time ball speed doesn't seem to be reliant on car speed at all and the luckiness of 75% of the goals made is unreal. Call me salty or bad or whatever other names you can think up but everyone one that has sunk at least 100 hours into this game knows how what I'm talking about. EDITThe game is still "fun" to play especially as a new player. The game developers seem intent on ruining the competitive playlist with the inclusion of maps like Wasteland and Neo Tokyo and the terrible competitive matchmaking system even after the October 2016 rank update.I'm not sure exactly how the competitive matchmaking system works but it only seems to account for the actual ranks (challenger rising star etc.) and not for the in game levels (like master legend etc.). Currently at All star 1 as a level 53 Master and all I see are legends and rocketeers with the occasional master and even more rarely an expert. I get limited enjoyment of the game because usually after about 4 games I have had enough of bs goals or unfair match ups. 11/10 Would get tilted againEDITI hardly play anymore and when I do I feel myself enjoying it less and less every time I play. Its now at the point where I maybe play two games regardless of the outcome and just get off. It has lost its luster and I already reminisce about the times when the game was enjoyable.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League. A game which I watched from the outside grow in popularity more and more YouTubers began playing it but why? I just couldn't fathom what made all of these YouTubers suddenly encorporate this game into their daily schedule that is until I bought it.When I first bought the game I was playing on my Macbook Pro lowest settings with a terrible frame rate so it didn't look good at all. Yet when I first played the game and had no idea what I was doing I believe I spent every night for about a week straight just playing Rocket League I was hooked. The fast paced tense competitive yet friendly games that only took about 6 to 7 minutes each kepted me wanting more.The support both from the developers and community is amazing. Both are constantly and tirelessly working to improve the game. The level of communication and trust between the developers and players is truly admirable the developers constantly doing their best to fix issues keeping the players informed and implementing good features suggested by the community. Other publishers should defintely strive to achieve the same honesty transparency and integrity achieved by Psyonix.Word of advice for when you get the game get the Game of the Year edition as you will be happy to pay a bit extra and it saves buying some of the DLC you'll likely get later on. Also change your control scheme earlier rather than later and Turn Off Camera Shake!
title: Rocket League®

review: Controls obviously take a bit of getting used to in a game like this but once you get comfortable with them they feel pretty good. Overall it's a really good game as long as you play online. Don't play with computer controlled allies unless you want your blood pressure to go through the roof because the team AI loves dribbling the ball right into its own goal from downfield and knocking the ball into its own goal at every opportunity while on defense and constantly ruining really easy plays by smacking the ball back to your side of the pitch as you're about to score. In other words 3v3 season play is actually 5v1 and you're the always the 1 the exception being if you play on Rookie and win every game 30 to 0 because you can immediately knock the ball into the goal every time the opposing AI won't boost to it and it's really easy to hit in from half court. But online play is really good save for the occasional lag spike and even if your teammates suck at least they usually know which goal is theirs. If you insist on playing single player do yourself a favor and keep something cheap and soft around to pummel as you will likely feel incredible rage especially if you have viking ancestors.Disclaimer I wrote this after losing like three season games in a row due to incredible teammate fails my fury is legend
title: Rocket League®

review: If you don't like salty players this probably isn't a game for you.It takes practice to get decent but it's easy to have fun in this game if you don't get screwed by smurfs. Rumble is great Snow Day is great Hoops is fun once you get decent at ball control/aerials. A controller is a must and I would highly suggest spending time tweaking the default camera settings. A lot of players are salty and will either leave a game if they are on a losing team spam quick chat with "Nice save" "Great pass" etc or will downright be the saltiest baby that could ever salt. But there are some pretty awesome players/teams out there too.Well worth the $$ if you ask me.P.S. Disable cross play unless you really want to play against PS4 and Xbone fools they rarely ready up for matches after a game are often the people most likely to afk or have lag inducing network issues that somehow affect you as well and are so much saltier than PC players.
title: Rocket League®

review: While i have enjoyed many a great hour playing this wonderful game. I have a simple complaint to make that strikes me at the base of my freedom. We as Rocket League players are being taxed in a great way. When i first purchased the game I was very pleased to play it and receive a mere 34 boost at start which was perfectly fine by me however after the latest update I noticed that we are being taxed for no apperent reason our boost starts at a mere 33 upon kickoff. Now I as an American firmly believe in no taxation without representation so I for one would like to know what kind of impoverished children my 1 boost is helping. Answer that Psyonix WHERE IS MY BOOST GOING???????
title: Rocket League®

review: It's a great game but think hard before you buy if you want to play on Linux. I've had it for a while now and multiplayer is pretty much broken. There seem to be some problems with the network code I was in a multiplayer game with a ping of 32 just now but the whole screen was pulsing in and out everything moving erratically. This has happened in every single game I've tried to play. It makes even seeing where the ball is impossible (to be honest I couldn't even tell where I was half the time stuff was just moving so weirdly). I guess sync errors with the servers but who knows. It also crashes extremely frequently (every 1 2 games) but even though the crash reporter fires a half dozen times a day for me they haven't patched the Linux client once as far as I can tell. It's hard to know if they're going to.Local exhibition play is okay but the bot AI is truly awful a weird mix of perfect ball prediction and absolutely awful play. I've watched the bots sit on their own goal line as the ball rolls past them without making any effort to save. The number of times one bot on a team will just get lost at the far end of the pitch for no reason. Or you'll be in the middle of a dribble (of sorts) and a bot on your own side will fly over you and pass to the opposition... Or you'll be 2 1 up with 10 seconds left and your side will suddenly decide to score an own goal under no pressure. It's way too frustrating to recommend paying money to play against the AI. Right now you're paying full price for a game that is well below alpha quality on Linux.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a game I've played way too much over the years it's fun it's adictive it's...repetetive it's...tedious.Rocket League for me when I first bought it was those first two things it was fun and addictive and I invested over 1 000 hours into the game. I loved the game and even though I wasn't very good (I'm still not very good) from the start there was something to aim for the ranking system. As you got better you progressed through the ranks and whenever you got to a rank at the end of a season you'd get a reward in game cosmetics to make your battle car look cooler and more appealing than a plain blank car. This gave you an insentive to play more and eventually pay real money to invest in microtransactions and so so much DLC.However as I played more and more into the game I found it very repetive and it got so tedious as to the point that I took a month break from the game. I came back refreshed and I enjoyed it again and thought nothing of it. As more time went by I found the game even more tedious than ever and even after break after break after break I could not find the game as enjoyable as it once was.As for the goals I had at the beginning as I progressed they seemed more and more unrealistic at the start of the game I thought obtaining these goals wouldn't be that difficult that I could obtain then in just a few hundred hours but I was wrong. These goals seem unobtainable and ridiculous that I feel that there is no point in trying anymore as I'll never get that good and that makes me think that the game is redundant that no matter how hard I try I will not be able to achieve the goals I once had.
title: Rocket League®

review: I am finally able to give this game a good review since a few updates happened. The game mechanics work without any flaws now gaining a higher rank is now taking quicker than before. Basically you don't get bashed for one or two loss playing with randoms like it was before. When you win against higher ranks it seems to grant you earlier access to a higher division than it was before. So it is more rewarding. They implemented a diverse item and trading system. It works like a charm like it did in Team Fortress 2. An ingame market economy with common values for various items has already been established by the community. I will give this game half a year and it will become like team fortress 2 in it's prime days. Except you can only trade in the lobby menu not while playing. So no one standing afk and asking for trades. So far you can only trade within the game itself and see your inventory there. It would have been better to implement the items with Steam Inventory so you could check the items from outside the game and trade them for other game's items. But maybe this will be implemented later.After all the time now i see now other way but to come back every day and play it for a few rounds. The only damn thing left in this game is the f*King toxic and very very salty community. Best thing is to avoid "Solo Standart" at all and only play with your friends in a team. Sadly the developers can't patch the community. But people getting banned for foul play trolling or swearing in chat would be a big step forward. Why not do so Psyonix?UPDATE 09th July 2018 By now there is a Ban System that seems to work good. You can report players and receive feedback for when your reports would help to ban someone. Psyonix seems to listen to it's community at least. Thank You Psyonix.
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros Pretty graphics Tricky gameplay Simple soccer game driven by rocket propelled vehicles (which increases the fun factor of the whole game) Different abilities already given in the game can actually prove to invite more impressive stunts just to hit the ball. OK audio. Additional unlocks from completed matches gives you opportunities to make some rather humourous designs on your vehicle.Cons Extremely irritating and useless AI especially when they're on your team. Their difficulty level does not change the AI's utter stupidity. The AI makes it pretty bad to hone any of your skills and only harbours more frustration than learning anything period. (Enemy AI seems to always be a lot smarter than your allied AI and scores more goals than your allied AI does.) Very poor matchmaking. You're a "Rookie" pitted against and with "Pros". This doesn't make any ing sense. Annoying music. No option to turn that off in the main menu. Overall lack of balance between different skill levels that make this game a total bore and (very often) irritating experience.I don't recommend this piece of garbage. Lack of intuition with overall gameplay and experience game design is absolutely ed and makes it a very unplayable experience for me. It will offer a slightly steeper learning curve for some but that doesn't mean a higher learning curve makes a bad game it's the game's overall design that is made to with you countless times for no specific reason other than to constantly and consistently you off that makes it a bad game.

review: This is my 400+ hours review.Single Player + Huge stunning map with the best details you will find in a video game+ Interesting characters+ AMAZING gameplay+ Lots of customizations+ Beautiful graphics Confusing story (yes I found it confusing...) May get boring after a while Lack of clothing (yes I am VERY serious) No Single Player DLCOverall the Single Player is really fun to play. You will get to play as three amazing characters with each having a different personality. It'll take you about 40 hours to complete the main mission (which is around 60% of the game). I personaly found the side missions a little boring so I didn't complete them all yet.GTA Online + The same map you get with SP+ Even more customizations+ SO MUCH CLOTHING!+ Really fun missions+ Free DLCs HACKERS (although they do get banned right after reporting them) The map isn't as alive as it is in SP Micro transactions EVERYTHING IS SO EXPENSIVE! Asshlole players Loading screens that take foreverGTA Online is the main reason I bought this game and it definitely met my expectations. It's a really fun game to play with a varitey of content. I really recomend this game to anyone who is looking for a game to invest many hours into.

review: Rocket league remindes me of the emoji movie The world we live in.It's so wondrous mysterious even magical.No. No not that world.I meant this one.The smartphone.Each system and program and appis its own little planet of perfect technology all providing services so necessary so crucial so unbelievably profound.Look who just sent me a text.Addie McAllister?Must be a mistake. Or a joke. Or a scam.Don't send her your Social Security number.Dude.She's right there.That's our user Alex.And like every freshman in high school his whole life everything revolves around his phone.And as the pace of life gets faster and faster...Phones down in five.And attention spans get shorter and shorter and...You're probably not even listening to me right now.Who has the time to type out actual words?And that's where we come in the most important invention in the history of communication...Emojis.That's my home.Textopolis.Here each of us does one thing and we have to nail it every time.The Christmas Tree just has tostand there all festive.Merry Christmas.It's still September Tim.The Princesses...I am so pretty.They just got to wear their crowns and keep their hair combed.You guys we are so pretty.Devil Poop Thumbs Up.They just show up and they're good to go.But for the faces the pressure is on.Crier always has to cry even if he's just won the lottery.Hooray! I'm a billionaire!The Laugher is always laughing even if he's just broken his arm.I can see the bone!Now me I'm a Meh.So I got to be totally over it all the time you know like "Meh who cares?"Which is not as easy as it sounds.Morning Mrs. D. I see you have the little minis with you.They're so cute.That is so adorable I can't take it!Now I'll never get them to sleep.Stick to your one face weirdo.No! No!It's hard to always act blase when living in Textopolis is just so exciting.Hello good simians.Those are some sharp attaches.Yes well we have business to attend to.What kind of business?Monkey business.I sounded British!Meh. That was really good.Meh. Meh. That was a great... Whatcha doing there mate? Practicing.Today is my first day on the phone.Boy. I'm gonna be so meh.What are you gonna do?Me and the boys are gonna throw ourselves on the barbie!Here's my sauce now.G'day mate.Hey. Konnichiwa.Sorry emoticons!I hate knocking over the elderly.Here let me help let me help.My colon!Is that the time?Hey my eyes are up here pal.Yeah! All right!Right on time.So last week Alex sends me next to this guy.That kid! Where does he get this stuff?Why are you laughing freak?Now unlike me my parents are total pros.Gene please tell me you weren't laughing just now.In public.He was. I remember.Let's go somewhere more private.I have some bad news Gene.And I'm afraid you'll have the wrong reaction.Okay. What's the wrong reaction?Anything other than "meh."Come on. I don't want to be late.I'm not letting you go to work today.Wait what?You're just not ready son.Come on! Working in the cube is an emoji's whole purpose in life.Everybody my age is working on the phone except for me.Sweetie that's not true.Yeah! I'm gonna work on the phone and I'm only 10.That's because I believe in you.Should we wash our hands?No no no.We're number two!We're number two! We're number two!See?I... I know I'm different okay?But when I need to I can be meh.I just...I want to be a working emoji you know like...Like everybody else and then...Then I would finally fit in you know?You fit in honey.No I don't Mom.I never have.But I can change all that if you'd just let me. Just give me a chance.But what if you get sent out on the phone making the wrong face?No Dad I'll make the right face.Look.Meh...You're so handsome when you make that face.I think he's ready Mel.Meh.Come on Dad.Let me prove it to you.If you really think you're ready.I am! Yes! Yes. I promise I won't let you down.Stop.Congratulations everyone!What an exciting day for all of you.It's really her.Pizza!Hey!Your first day on the job.Hi. Hi.Don't be nervous. I won't bite. Hi. I'm Smiler.Don't touch me.Hi!Okay.I mean hey.As you know I'm Smiler.I am the system supervisor herebecause I was the original emoji.Here's how it works.It's nothing fancy.Wait a minute. It's really fancy!You each have your own cube on the emoji bar.If Alex chooses you should you be so lucky your cube will light up.It's showtime.The scanner will scan you and that scan will get sent right up to Alex's text box.And let me tell you guys there is nothing like getting scanned for the first time.You're gonna love it. Really.Now over here is the favorites sectionwhere you'll find all the most popular emojis.And of course you'll find my cube here.You are smooth.Just doing my duty.What? What did I say?Rocket looking to party.Come on tell me you aren't just a little bit tempted.Steven for the last time I don't want to buy a time share.Come on man it's Hi 5. You know me I'm a favorite.Alex hasn't picked you in weeks.And if he stops picking you you're no longer a favorite.It's got to be some sort of mistake.I mean look at me I'm an attractive hand giving a high five.Fist Bump. Come on in.Hey.Fist Bump? He's a knucklehead. Literally.Look at him. I can look like that.Cramp. Huge mistake.Help. Help me. Help up the hand.There you go.Thanks mate.Hey little Meh how about you create a distraction and then I'll just slip under the rope?Is someone lost?Smiler hi. Just leaving.Yeah you know just killing timebefore I go back to my cube in the far cornerwhere Alex can't even see me anymore!You may not be a favorite anymore but you will always have a place in the cube.Yeah in the nosebleeds.I'm standing right here. Words hurt.The most important thing I can tell you is to just be yourself.Blah.I was made to be happy so I am always smiling.Places please. Emojis to your cubes.Attention. We've got incoming.Got to be meh. Got to be meh.My gosh my own cube.I can't believe it. I could put a plant over here.And over here could go an inspirational calendar.Okay. Got to be meh. Got to be meh.Look at our son down there.I'm just beamingwith pride.You don't think he'll actually get picked do you?Hie ro gly phics.Hieroglyphics was an ancient language of picture forms.Does that remind anyone of anything?Hello? A language of pictures. Anyone?Early hieroglyphs date back as far as 3 300...I got to reply to Addie's text.What should I write?Nothing.Words aren't cool.Okay. Be cool. Be cool.All right Alex is not sure how he wants to play this.I would really love it to be me.Beam me up! Beam me up!I need Thumbs Up on standby.Yeah! Thumbs Up is going in!Wait! Alex is changing his mind.He's moving.Okay. Looks like it's gonna be Meh.I'm so nervous I could almost shrug.We are go for Meh.Initiating scan.Okay. You can do this.I can't do this! I can't do it!What is this?Stop the scan!I can't! It's too late!Meh meh meh meh. My goodness I'm freaking out!What's he doing?He's making the wrong face!Good for him! Little... Wait what?Be meh! Be meh! Be meh!Abort! Abort!Shut it down! Shut it down!What is that emoji?Wrong emoji sent! Evacuate the Meh cube!Evacuate the cube!I got to get out of here.Get that bozo out of there!I'm trying!No!My God.The humanity.Medic.Sorry everybody. That was not what I meant to do.I kinda...I kinda panicked.Are you even a Meh at all?Course he is.He's my spitting image.If you have expressions other than meh what you are is a malfunction.Malfunction?No! I can be meh. Just give me one more chance.That's not gonna happen.You know what would be really fun?A board meeting.Where we could figure out what to do with you!I knew there was something wrong with him.A malfunction?

review: Great game Im surprised its not "Overwhelmingly positive". PROS Gameplay Super fun super polished hard to master but easy to learn. You can see new players getting some pretty amazing goals.Graphics The graphics are aestheticly pleasing neon lights laser trails from the cars its all great.Music Music is great especially on the menu and pumps you up between gamesPrice Ive spent more time on this than most 60 euro games for 20 euro its a no brainer.SplitScreen Playing with friends is so intense and fun especially with a few beers.Pretty contant updates. CONS Community Can be quite toxic game can induce rage and players take it out on eachother. "Ez" " YOu NOOB"Voice chat Its horrible. No matter how good your mic is. Loot boxes skins ectOverall the game is incredibly fun wether online with your friends and even with the bots isnt bad. Ive had great experience with the game. Its really addictive and its minor problems are in no means ruining the game.
title: Rocket League®

review: I bought this game a few days ago and got instantly hooked. I admit I have played this game before at my friends house but not so much to the point I would go out of my way and buy the game myself. I currently at the time of writing this review have 30+ hours on the game. At the start and average player might think this game is really easy and its just a casual game but when you hop into a competetive match and see all the "good" players your jaw will drop in the amount of possibilities that you can execute while in a game. There is sooooo much stuff you can master learn and do in this game. This game is one of the very few games that actually make me want to get better and better and better since I don't think there is a point in this game where you master everything and stop playing because the game is to easy. I must also praise Psyonix for putting out such cheap DLC's for the players. It's so cheap to have your car to look cool and the best thing is that you dont even need to pay you can just play and get LOADS of items from leveling up. There are also limited time offers where per match you for example get 14 shells and a decryptor (which is used to open crates) is 150 it seems like a lot but its far from a lot so its literally like getting a free key except you can't trade the item you unboxed. There is a lot more pro's in this game that I would point out but I dont think anyone has so much time to read everything. To sum it all up this game is 101% worth your money buy it on sale or not on sale you won't be dissapointed. I have no interest to stop playing this game and I will guarantee you won't also
title: Rocket League®

review: Do you like Cars? Do you wanna play Soccer without actually going outside? Do mind microtransactions? (No but I do want a mystery decal!) (Too Bad..) Well then Rocket League is a game that needs to be in your library. With different mini games it keeps you entertained while there are events that get you some cool items every so often. Try to climb the rankings in competitive games or just play casual with your friends. (Just make sure not to get scored on when you're the goalie of the team expect to get yelled at...) Customize your car with awesome looking items....exept here comes the negative side of the review. You can customize your car but if you want good looking items you have to get them in crates which cost real life money. To top that off even if you do buy crates you have a really low chance of getting a mystery decal. (Best looking decals.) But remember it only changes the look of your car so unless you're a dedicated player don't bother with the crates. So besides the microtransaction part this is a really good game and I highly recommend it. It's just an all out fun thing to play I give it a 7/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game does everything right The DLC is only cosmetic it has consistant updates split screen multiplayer replay saving ranked servers everything you would want in this type of game is there and it all works great.It runs extremely smoothly (as it should considering how little is on screen) and looks very nice. The tessellation on the grass is an awesome touch. Rocket League is fun whether you just started playing it or if you've been playing for months. You can score goals and make saves even if you just started out but you end up slowly learning the layers of strategy as you keep playing. The longer you play it the more you learn how the ball tends to move and how to keep it on the opponent's side of the field and the game only becomes more and more fun.

review: Okay Rocket League.A fun full filled game with a basic concept playing soccer with cars. Nice touch with some of the different arenas and boost options although I would of liked it more if you could customize your car more. Reasonabley laid out easy enough to understand. If you want to master it you'll have to play a lot to grow familar with the physics of the game.Overall it's fun and easy enough to waste 20 minutes playing. Is it worth $20 USD? Definitely not! I'd pay $5 maybe $10 if they're lucky. Other than that a nic soundtrack to it and wasn't a total waste of money.

review: Product received for free. Although this is a wonderful game it has issues all to common on team based games. Try hards individuals who shouldn't be in the public domain rage gamers and the occasional slacker looking for carry. Overall however the game itself is great I'm sure their are people who cheat and aside from the troll/nazi I've come across (multiple times over about a week) the community is relatively decent. It would help if their were ways to report cheating through replay review as well as having an innapropriate behaviour report option but that is not really a huge priority. As well it seems the servers try to adjust for low ping player which just screws up the game play I may be wrong its just my impression (I have had my car thrown around/out map while having a 60 ping but another who was playing well was at 240+). As a whole I would recomend this game without hesitation. My only issue is game stability but that could be and issue of other players(cheaters possible high ping adjuster) or my internet (centurylink through phonelines).graphics gameplay stability community(upkeep) /vfun Good meh/ averagev Needs work

review: It think this game has potential. Great physics nice and colourful which makes me clap sometimes. I must say though it's not much of a challenge. Most of the tracks are the same shape so easy to learn the course. This could be a fab little racer but this ball thing keeps getting in the way what's up with that? Also seems most of the other players just zig zag across the track. I do perfect laps and have gotten quite fast although the chat I get from other players is a bit toxic suggesting I 'stop being a and hit the ball'.But there we go. Some of us are born racers others like to win by cutting corners.Overall a good racer not as good as Gran Turismo due to lack of variety in tracks but the cars make nice noises and sometimes go boom.

And seriously they still charge players to open crates earned throughout the game. I've got them all stored up. I ain't paying for that. I always thought when you pay for a game you get a majority of the features. This one just seems to milk until it's dry.

review: It's a fun game at the core and there's a lot of things I like about it.However the most recent matchmaking update made me never want to play again and here's why Rocket League is most fun when playing with friends. Unfortunately an extremely small subset of players were having their friends tank their own MMR and then boost it back up in an effort to cheat the ranking system.This is bad but what's worse is what the decs did about it To stop this extremely small group of rank exploiters they made it so team MMR is based solely on the highest party members MMR (versus averaging the teams MMR)This means if you queue with a friend who isn't *exactly* as good as you are one of you is being put at a big disadvantage.I used to play a few days a week with 2 friends one of whom is better than me and the other one a little worse. It was always fun win or lose with many close games.Now? Every opponent is as good as the better of my two teammates which means we are ALWAYS the worse ranked team going into a match and in a surprise to no one now lose about 90% of our games and it's usually not close (why would it be when the matchmaking system purposefully found a team way better than us to play against?)All of this is exasperated by the fact that this game given it's cross platform amtchmaking has SO MANY PLAYERS and a higher player base should make "tighter" matchmaking easier.I honestly have no desire to log in knowing the only way to find a balanced game is to tell my friends to go kick rocks.And to think all of these changes just to stop a teeny tiny minority of people abusing the ranked system. Which had no discernable negative effect on 99% of the playerbase.

review: Rocket League is a game for 1) Those with beefy PCs (don't bother playing if you can't eke out a minimal 30fps or higher)2) Those with nuts ISP connections (better have less than 20ms ping to the Psyonix server of your choice)3) Those with patience to deal with the consequences of being put on servers with maintenance issues.Psyonix as a dev team has zero respect for their player base. When submitting a support ticket regarding significant latency rubber banding and disconnection issues Psyonix would rather blame your ISP or your own ignorance than admit their own servers are trash (despite their own CEO admitting that himself).Psyonix servers are run down overloaded latent and frustrating to play on if you're even remotely decent. If you don't have a beeline connection to the nearest server center don't bother playing.It's a fun game when it works. Otherwise it's trash.

Now the game is a complete mess you can't play every map in custom game (meaning you can't do certain game modes against your friends) some of the new maps seems to be only mades to be visually attractives and worst of the worst now the items drop is low items are ranked by rarity and you have to pay at least 1 for 1 Key and a chance to drop another item that would have usually been in a DLC or a free update. In the meantime servers are still unstables matchmaking is full of bugs and strange choices are mades (like WTF you can hide your rank on an online game ?).Anyway. Thanks Psyonix for turning from an independant dev who's happy to sell his game to a company who try to make us pay more and more.

review: I have to give it a thumbs up because it is a very fun game. Its very addicting. More than you would think. Ive logged over 500 hours in and feel that im decent for my rank. That being said i give it a 3 out of 5. It has some of the worst matchmaking ive ever had the displeasure of using. Unless you have talented friends to play with you all the time you are in for a lot of losing that will mostly not be your fault. The game constantly matches you up with people that are less than your rank and mostly less than your skill and for some reason thinks you wanna play teams of people who are even better and higher rank than you are. You will get angry ALOT! On top of that they love to put you in matches with ai bots on your team and im telling you right now youll rather have a rookie on your team then the best ai bot they have. Some of the worst ai programming ive seen in a game. Youll also quite often get put into a match that you have no chance of winning. Youll be bumped into a match that has 1 or 2 minutes remaining and be down 5+ to nothing. You have no choice. There is no option to opt out of games already in progress (atleast not that ive found). It is the most frustrating and yet incredibly addicting games ive ever played. Youll have fun but be prepared for alot of stress!!!EDIT!!!! I can no longer give this game a good review. I attempted to do the 3v3 anniversary and it booted me out because it couldnt load a module. I then got a message saying that you now get punished for leaving games and that the punishment will get worse the more you do it. It made me wait 5 minutes to play another match. You absolutely cannot punish people for leaving games and not fix your broken matchmaking. Thats completely assanign!!!!!

review: Start the game.Enjoy great music in a simple designed menu.Learn basics in a short tutorial training.Start tryharding in pubs.Collect skins flags and HATS!!!!Become better in the game.Play with friends and let the tryhard emotions fly... So basically it's the same experience when playing other Ball Games against or with my friends.We yell we shout we try to make the world greatest plays and moves to impress and stomp each others... AND IT FEELS GREAT!!!!!!!This game is as simple as addicting!RC ish like cars with a good load of customisable appearences great music very smooth and nice graphics for a fair price.Oh and not to mention you can crash and destroy your openents with boosted speed to get a small adventage.If you kept reading until this you'll be wondering ''No cons at all? There have to be some issues or bad things about this game''Jeah there were some hicups when they game released with server stability/lag issues but it's resolved and no point to even mention it now again. Everything runs smooth there are no bugs at all that I could face like e.g. stuck in a wall or something else. The only thing you might feel very often is that your openent(s) has/have more luck than you in the ways the ball gets hit BUT it's a great motivation to become even better in this game and spend even more time playing it! And on the other hand with its short time per match (5 minutes when the ball gets hit/ 6 8 per match due to goal replays... and there can be many goal replays!) it is perfect to play it just for ''in between'' or if you need a short break from something.See ya in the stadion!
title: Rocket League®

review: Good evening.How great it is to be with you tonight.Let me begin by thanking the hundreds of thousands of Americans who actively participated in our campaign as volunteers. Let me thank the 2 1/2 million Americans who helped fund our campaign with an unprecedented 8 million individual campaign contributions averaging $27 a piece. Let me thank the 13 million Americans who voted for the political revolution giving us the 1 846 pledged delegates here tonight 46 percent of the total. And delegates Thank you for being here and for all the work you ve done. I look forward to your votes during the roll call on Tuesday night.And let me offer a special thanks to the people of my own state of Vermont who have sustained me and supported me as a mayor congressman senator and presidential candidate. And to my family my wife Jane four kids and seven grandchildren thank you very much for your love and hard work on this campaign.I understand that many people here in this convention hall and around the country are disappointed about the final results of the nominating process. I think it s fair to say that no one is more disappointed than I am. But to all of our supporters here and around the country I hope you take enormous pride in the historical accomplishments we have achieved.Together my friends we have begun a political revolution to transform America and that revolution Our Revolution continues. Election days come and go. But the struggle of the people to create a government which represents all of us and not just the 1 percent a government based on the principles of economic social racial and environmental justice that struggle continues. And I look forward to being part of that struggle with you.Let me be as clear as I can be. This election is not about and has never been about Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump or Bernie Sanders or any of the other candidates who sought the presidency. This election is not about political gossip. It s not about polls. It s not about campaign strategy. It s not about fundraising. It s not about all the things the media spends so much time discussing.This election is about and must be about the needs of the American people and the kind of future we create for our children and grandchildren.This election is about ending the 40 year decline of our middle class the reality that 47 million men women and children live in poverty. It is about understanding that if we do not transform our economy our younger generation will likely have a lower standard of living then their parents.This election is about ending the grotesque level of income and wealth inequality that we currently experience the worst it has been since 1928. It is not moral not acceptable and not sustainable that the top one tenth of one percent now own almost as much wealth as the bottom 90 percent or that the top 1 percent in recent years has earned 85 percent of all new income. That is unacceptable. That must change.This election is about remembering where we were 7 1/2 years ago when President Obama came into office after eight years of Republican trickle down economics.The Republicans want us to forget that as a result of the greed recklessness and illegal behavior on Wall Street our economy was in the worst economic downturn since the Great Depression. Some 800 000 people a month were losing their jobs. We were running up a record breaking deficit of $1.4 trillion and the world s financial system was on the verge of collapse.We have come a long way in the last 7 1/2 years and I thank President Obama and Vice President Biden for their leadership in pulling us out of that terrible recession.Yes we have made progress but I think we can all agree that much much more needs to be done.This election is about which candidate understands the real problems facing this country and has offered real solutions not just bombast fear mongering name calling and divisiveness.We need leadership in this country which will improve the lives of working families the children the elderly the sick and the poor. We need leadership which brings our people together and makes us stronger not leadership which insults Latinos Muslims women African Americans and veterans and divides us up.By these measures any objective observer will conclude that based on her ideas and her leadership Hillary Clinton must become the next president of the United States. The choice is not even close.This election is about a single mom I saw in Nevada who with tears in her eyes told me that she was scared to death about the future because she and her young daughter were not making it on the $10.45 an hour she was earning. This election is about that woman and the millions of other workers in this country who are struggling to survive on totally inadequate wages.Hillary Clinton understands that if someone in America works 40 hours a week that person should not be living in poverty. She understands that we must raise the minimum wage to a living wage. And she is determined to create millions of new jobs by rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure our roads bridges water systems and wastewater plants.But her opponent Donald Trump well he has a very different view. He does not support raising the federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour a starvation wage. While Donald Trump believes in huge tax breaks for billionaires he believes that states should actually have the right to lower the minimum wage below $7.25. What an outrage!This election is about overturning Citizens United one of the worst Supreme Court decisions in the history of our country. That decision allows the wealthiest people in America like the billionaire Koch brothers to spend hundreds of millions of dollars buying elections and in the process undermine American democracy.Hillary Clinton will nominate justices to the Supreme Court who are prepared to overturn Citizens United and end the movement toward oligarchy in this country. Her Supreme Court appointments will also defend a woman s right to choose workers rights the rights of the LGBT community the needs of minorities and immigrants and the government s ability to protect the environment.If you don t believe this election is important if you think you can sit it out take a moment to think about the Supreme Court justices that Donald Trump would nominate and what that would mean to civil liberties equal rights and the future of our country.This election is about the thousands of young people I have met who have left college deeply in debt and the many others who cannot afford to go to college. During the primary campaign Secretary Clinton and I both focused on this issue but with different approaches. Recently however we have come together on a proposal that will revolutionize higher education in America. It will guarantee that the children of any family this country with an annual income of $125 000 a year or less 83 percent of our population will be able to go to a public college or university tuition free. That proposal also substantially reduces student debt.This election is about climate change the greatest environmental crisis facing our planet and the need to leave this world in a way that is healthy and habitable for our kids and future generations. Hillary Clinton is listening to the scientists who tell us that unless we act boldly and transform our energy system in the very near future there will be more drought more floods more acidification of the oceans more rising sea levels. She understands that when we do that we can create hundreds of thousands of good paying jobs.

review: I have trouble running this game with SLI enabled Win 7 i7 3770k z77 2 GTX 680's. Framerate periodically drops to sub 20fps. Everytime I exit the game and re launch it my settings are reverted to defaults. This means having to select my car paint my car select all of my goodies for my car set my camera settings my controller bindings change server settings and change my graphics setttings... EACH... AND... EVERYTIME that I play. So ANNOYING. I used to be able to just pop in and pop out for a quick 5 minute match but now I have to spend 5 minutes just getting my settings back to where I need them. Because of this bug that they refuse to patch or even acknowledge exists I can no longer recommend this game to anyone. Fix your game. Players are often mean to each other and are often to vulgar for me. You can mute them and even report them but that means stopping in the middle of an active game to access the player menus and selecting these options. AI bots will totally throw a winning game away for your team. They are constantly scoring own goals getting in the way making poor decisions and driving in the opposite direction of where they should be. They are even worse on the experimental rocketlabs mutator and snowday tracks. The better you are at this game the worse the bots are. Unless you want to play a highly competitive ranked match where players will yell profanity at you then you willl most certainly be playing with some of these awful bots from time to time.

review: A Good Game for everyone who likes competitive Online Games. Cons It takes a while and takes patience to learn the mechanical gameplay. Matching up on ranked matches with strangers is often frustrating since you have to adapt to your teammate without any real conversation. This game is the most fun when playing with a friend talking to him/her through Voicechat. Pros + Big possibilities for tactical gameplay.+ No limitations in tactics due to the very little amount of game mechanics (the team with the most goals wins)+ The feeling when you score after a nice passing play is worth all the practice.+ Very good update support from dev that tries to take community issues into consideration.

review: I'm not a fan of football. In fact I don't even like it. But this is just pure joy! A mix of racing and football. An idea so simple yet executed so well! I've never had more fun driving a car. The sheer chaos and the occasional awesome save or goal just makes it even more fun. Granted as any other multiplayer game it's more fun to play with others. But that shouldn't keep you from getting this gem. Many will say that you require a controller for this. Maybe for some of the more complicated moves but with decent keybindings you can play it well on a keyboard as well. Yes you heard that right. This game has rebindable keys. A rarity even among AAA titles these days.Soundtrack is just perfect. It really fits the setting.Would I suggest you buy it? Well did you read my review? No? Then yes! I fully suggest it. Come and join the romp that is Rocket League and have fun while you're at it! I mean it is only 20 or your regional equivalent. Emphase

review: Like hitting a ing beach ball around that floats unrealistically in the air with a vehicle that has poorly designed and awkward controls (especially when boosting) all while dealing with a really annoying camera lock on system that makes it difficult to line anything up properly until you spend s of hours trying to get used to the timing and unexpected results when you actually hit the ball.The ball isn't propelled in relation to the speed your vehicle is travelling all that matters is if you were in the air when you hit it and if you were using boost when hitting it. The momentum of the ball is in effect extremely predictable which equates to a game that is all about coordination teamwork and positioning NOT so much about individual player skill like so many players preach.

review: At time of this review I have about 10 hours in the game. I can complete the 2nd tier of training so you know just your average starting trash tier player. This game is fun. Moving around is fun. Flying through the air is fun. Trying and usually failing to hit the ball is fun (remember trash tier).You know what isn't fun? Matchmaking.In 90% of my casual games and so far all of my ranked ones there is a player on one of the teams who is vastly superior to all of the other players. Sometimes my team sometimes the other team but it is always that one guy playing around with the rest of us. Personally I see enough I like in this game and know it is for me so I know I will enjoy. Unless you feel the same from watching it (or try it if you can) then do not buy.
title: Rocket League®

review: The game is modeled after soccer but the ball seems to be based on a ping pong ball.it will repeatedly bounce in place 4 or 5 times like a volleyball on a gym floor. Given the severe lack of arial mobility this is often frustrating.Lastly quitting a ranked match means a 5 minute cooldown before you can play again which is fair. What isn't fair is that the cooldown applies to ALL game modes casual and ranked.Sorry i didn't want to finish the match being called a . Guess I'll write a review in 5 mins instead.Insanely unpredectable ball physics and a toxic community (wtf is a "leecher") gives this game a solid 3 5
