review: Great game awful reward system. Okay so the game is really fun. Scoring in Rocket League actually feels incredibly rewarding the gameplay is smooth feels very well optimised and the graphics imo are actually really vibrant and very good. Problem I have with this game is the awful reward system. Somewhere along the line of levelling up I "earned" a rare crate which at the time I thought was great and looked forward to opening it. That was until I saw the 2 words "Potential Items" then "Unlock with key". So in other words loot crates that you "earn" have to be paid for. You do earn items such as cars decals and many other customisable things along the way but none of them feel unique and worth showing off like the possible items you could get from reward crates but oh yeah... you have to pay for them. I was stupid enough to and got an awful single decal for a car I wasn't even using. Advice Get the game don't buy the loot crates.
title: Rocket League®

review: The gameplay is fun and the feel is very good. My main issue with this game is the servers myself as well as multiple other people i have spoken to routinely experince rather bad server lag when people leave or join a game as well as when someone gets demo'd as well as at seeming random points during the game when the ball or other players will seemingly phase through each other or teleport. There will also be situations where on your end you have hit the ball or someone else hits it however the server either does not register it or registers something else and so the ball will begin to move one direction only to teleport the other way. If the server issues were not present i would say this game is effectivley perfect however for a game about precise mechanics and timing the server lag is incredibly jarring and can be at times aggravating. Other then that the game is fine.
title: Rocket League®

review: Oh yes. This game is... THE MOST LEGENDARY GAME FROM MY CHILDHOOD! I reme ber playing worms 3 mayhen when i was like 8 years old. And this game is basically the same just better. Let me point out a few reasons why you should immediateli put all of your money into this game The gameplay Turn based 3D gameplay. While it's most fun when played with a controller it'll be almost as fun with your keyboard and mousa. It's also so much fun with local multiplayer since A) There's usually no one at the online multiplayer and B) You can't smash online opponents with a controller. Also the story mode is a ton of fun. You get the full story mode of worms 4 mayhem and worms 3d! Alsom you'll be fine with a single controller since you just give to the person who has the turn.The music OHMYGOSHYES!!!!! The soundtrack is just amazing. I want to describe it with the word Masterpiece. I downloaded almost the full soundtrack because the music is just so awesome. It's very calm but fits the game for some reason.Also you can create your own teams (with thats and stuff) weapons and gamemodes I absolutely and warmly recommend this game. Now go ahead and buy it.Thonking2Pepe3kms2

review: Car soccer. It's a simple concept and pretty hard to get wrong (in a video game at least). It's been attenmpted in real life but since you can't change the fundamental physics of the real world it wasn't very fun. Psyonix hit the nail right on the head with this. Looks beautiful plays smooth and I get to drive the Batmobile. My only gripe is the lack of punishment for ragequitters in casual. You can leave at any time with absolutely no penalty. It doesn't even count as a loss. I know a guy with a 99% win rate because he left every game he was gonna lose. Other than that its an amazing game with a great and wholesome fanbase (mostly everyone I play with is so nice) and exhilarating gameplay. 9.3/10

review: Rocket League seems simple use a car to push or hit a ball into a goal. It is rather easy to jump into and learn the controls and mechanics. But just like real soccer (or any sport for that matter) mastering dribbling passing and goaltending takes time. One game played can turn into two two into four and before you know it you've played two hours worth of games. It's a game that easy you can put 1000 hours into and not be bored of it. One piece of advice having a controller helps you can get good with a mouse and keyboard but a controller makes movement easier from my experience.10/10 worth every penny a must play for pretty much anyone.
title: Rocket League®

review: Great game. However there is a large percentage of this community that really makes you want to jump off a cliff. Ranking system recently is very broken. A lot of players are ranked at platinum this season yet they cannot even hit the ball or their skill is equivalent to a beginner bot. My advice is if you want to have fun play with someone you trust or you will never progress in rank. Crates are a money pit. With no resale value you are better off buying keys waiting 7 days and finding items on a trading site that you actually want. Trading can be fun yet there is only a small part of the community that will fairly trade with you which is even more reason not to bother opening crates. The DLC is mostly worthless considering the "best" cars come with the game and in the crates.

I tried to like it I really did. heck I even bought some cars for it..I'll keep it short and sweet.ProsIt's fun kicking a ball with a car.I got a Delorean.... cons.* The matches are WAAAY too short. 3 mins...* Most of the time its your team mates who own goal score.* No player cohesion no assigned goalies people just go and do what they want leaving goal open* Most of the time the ball is stolen off you by a team mate not the opposing team.* ppl so desperate for a goal that they ignore everyone else on the team to achieve this.* Matchmaking will put you in empty matches to wait for 10 mins for others to show up... which is odd when apparently there is some 20 000 people playing..*GETS OLD FAST.

review: Solar eclipses.This game is a must buy even if you're not a sports fan. Personally I'm not into the sport games... but this is an exception. It's fun matchmaking doens't take long you can take it at your own pace customisability is everywhere and it's very easy to pick up and play.PROS Simple concept Takes time to master Customisability galore! Decent servers across the world Many offline options to play as well as online Many game modes DLC and other paid in game content is ONLY cosmetics no pay to win Updates are still coming nearly 2 years after initial release Pretty good sound trackCONS The game thinks &gt 250 ms delay for ping is acceptable The skill/rank matchmaking algorithms aren't always good No ability to kick bots No cut off angle for the camera (so if you're locked onto the ball and it goes above you you'll lose sight of everything but the ball!) I feel like there aren't enough unlockable skins for the default cars. Like just one or two more per car would be plenty. No option for playing music while in a match...?TLDR If you don't think the concept of playing soccer in remote control cars with rocket boosters and explosive jumping capabilities with equipable hats is interesting then don't buy this game. For every other sane person in the universe this is a must buy. So much love and care has gone into this game the developers deserve all the money they get!
title: Rocket League®

review: I really used to love this game. Like I LOVED this game. So much that I paid full price for xbox version then later full price for PC version when I upgraded to a new pc. But the servers. First let me say I have fiber. I get 150mbps with very little latency at least. This is when my two roommates are actively gaming also. Yet I work a night schedule and can play in the middle of the night on a worknight when I am pushing 200mbps and there is STILL lag.This is a very popular game now. The internet is riddled with people asking how to FIX this. But because the game is so popular it just gets swept under the rug. A few months ago I would have recommended this game to ANYONE. In my 50 or so games in my Steam library this is the only one that CONSISTENTLY lags for me. I have scoured the internet trying to find a solution but frankly I am just tired of it. I am about to stop playing this game entirely when I lose multiple games in a row due to lag and then when I mentioned it I just get bullied and talked by the other gamers. I can deal with the occasional lag and even crash. But this is every game every time I log on. It has finally gotten old. I will quit this game if I don't see improvement. And I really don't want to.

review: Alright for anyone who is new to the game...this is all you need to know.This game is centered around Go Mifune. He has a huge passion for racing and always puts his family before anything. Unfortunately for Mifune he is prone to a lot of danger. So when he starts racing with his Mach 5 on the track...his dad fears for him"You're just a boy! You can get killed doing this stuff! Please come back home and start racing professionally when you're older!" Speed Ra Mifune's dad shouts."Okay dad! I shall come home!"This game takes place after Speed race Mifune has grown up and becomes a better racer.You hit a big soccer ball with cars with rockets that fly it's pretty dope. I give this game 4 dead Andy Kauffman's out of 5.

review: Honestly with close to 150 hours in this game I really can recommend it. The game is simply fun. At first it's really hard but what I found was that the difficulty kept relevant to my skill level (most of the time) But what annoys me the most about it is deffinately the matchmaking I am now around level 33 and consider myself pretty good but I am ALWAYS Placed in matches with either AI or Rookies against parties of Masters. I have made a little experiment every single game that I was placed completely unfairly I screenshotted. And in the last 200 or so games 106 have been terribly matchmaked.Overall I think that this game is great but the matchmaking could do with a fair bit of tweaking or maybe I'm just too good _(ツ)_/

review: Firstly I love this game because you can drive all over Europe. You have to manage your money and make sure that when you get out a loan from the bank you have enough money to pay it back or are at least making enough daily profit to pay it back.You also manage a business. You can hire drivers to work for you and they will complete jobs for you but you have to pay them a wage plus some for every journey they complete. You level up they skills that make them be better at certian things like you can make them earn more money for going over a set distance or you can make them carry high value or fragile cargo. They can also carry ADR materials so things that could be dangourous. But you get paid more for that.You can always do 'Quick Jobs' and these are when the employer provides the truck and you just go where they tell you. This is fun but it starts to get boring only doing short deliverys so you can buy a truck so that you can go further distances and get more money.To conclude I feel that anybody who likes games like Farm Simulator or any simulator game should give this game a try because it is a great way to unwind after a long day and I have found it to be so much fun and very calming. Some people say that this is a boring game I happen to disagree.

review: The first screen uela/tos is complete t. So tired of game companies distributing binaries of unknown origin with overly draconian tos/uelas they know no one reads but really matter. I know it's an industry norm on windows but when I installed the linux client on the free to play weekend I immediately clicked "decline" and uninstalled.More linux games doesn't mean we have to adopt the pisspoor treatment of the community windows and microsoft have shown. It's time for more open source games. AGPL could apply to service/server connection server and game management to differietiate between official and private servers. GPL the client AGPL the service something like that and still get all the same trademark and copyleft protections. I wish companies would understand the GPL is about freedom not money. You can still sell your software!You just can't prevent modification to anything other than what resides on your own hardware.
title: Rocket League®

review: I loaded up my Rocket League and went to my garage to see what was new. I try to switch my loadout and a window pops up stopping the game say that Rocket League has stopped working and then closes the game. So I try getting back on go into my garage and it works! I click to change tires and the same thing happens. I reload the game for a third time and the garage works perfectly fine. I try finding a match and as soon as I join the game stops again! The fouth time I didn't even get to find a match before it stopped the game again. I don't understand I purchased this game sometime in September. Ever time I tried it before it worked fine. No bugs or anything. Now I don't play it for a month and it doesn't work anymore. I'm very disappointed expecially since I also purchased this game for my friend right around the same time I did so for myself. My friend's game still works but mine doesn't. I want this fixed or I want a refund. I am tired of my games that I purchase end up not working after I don't play them for a little bit. I still update them! I want my money back or I want it fixed or I want a sollution to fixing this problem. Please help me fix this.

review: Started with this game on PS4 and eventually took it on here on PC too. This game is a jewel. When u start playing it you will find yourself playing it still at 4 am when should be sleeping.Once u start playing this you are hooked. Simple physic based game that has a lot more to it than what you would think. If you don't find yourself playing it then you will be trading items with other players. All these items are stuff you can use to customize your car to your liking and holy crap there is lot of options.In short this game is easy to learn but it takes time to master. You can improve your skill with multiple training sequences from shooting goal tending and defending.So get your friends and start playing. You will get hooked as i did.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: On the surface it seems Rocket League is a glorified soccer game with a Y axis added to the field of play. But it's so much more. It takes time to learn the mechanics and then teach your fingers to actually do that crazy aerial you are trying. There's an ever rising ceiling of skill level for those who just want more but there's also casual play for people like me who just want to sit down for an hour and play a handful of games stress free.If you're worried you won't like Rocket League because it seems like another sports game I assure you it's vastly different. At the end of the day the aim of the game is to score goals and win but playing this game is so much more fun than simply trying to win. You can attempt new moves assist teammates or perfect crazy goaltending techniques. You don't have to be the star of every game or even any game. You can be a team player and help your teammates to victory without even scoring a goal. While no community is without toxic players most of the players I've come across are very friendly. In what other online game would you find an opponent complimenting the other team on their skills? That's what makes this game unique. The game is as fun now as it was when I picked it up months ago so do yourself a favor find some friends with the game or who are interested and play together that's the best way to experience the magic of Rocket League.
title: Rocket League®

review: Reading the negative reviews made me realize how many people do not get how matchmaking in Rocket League specifically the ranked matches works. The levels of Rookie Pro Master ect. mean as much as being 10th prestige in call of duty. Absolutely nothing other than relatively how much time you have put into a game. Matchmaking is figured by a skill rating (a hidden MMR) not with how many points you have scored. Theoretically you could reach the rank of Rocketeer without ever winning a game in your career. Also the people say the community sucks have somewhat of a point but mostly just because they dont win enough. People don't talk if you beat them.

review: Fun party game to play with friends. Community isn't half bad almost all toxic players are at lower ranks. Good solid mechanics with very few a little bugs you come across. The bad server every once in a while. Mostly balanced matchmaking. Great car customization to let you decide how you want your car to look like. The tournaments are a fun way to compete with others but still need some work. The DLC is a very good option for variety and change of your game play. The crate system is similar to CS GO's (get a crate buy key to open). There is cross play with Xbox AND Playstation but Xbox and Playstation players can't be in the same game unless you are in a private match. Ranking system is pretty good minor hiccups every update and will still improve in the future. good game
title: Rocket League®

review: Casually or Competitively this game has you covered. Sick of the ball bouncing around everywhere? There's a hockey mode for that niche. Think there's not enough Mario Kart style powerups in the game? Well you're not looking close enough because there's a mode for that too. Are you annoyed that there's not enough aerial trickshotting and you want the goalposts to be the floor? Sure there's a mode for that. Wanna Slam It Like Space Jam? It's even got that man. It has that sweetspot gameplay of "easy to learn hard to master" written all over it. I could think of a lot of bad things to do with $20 and Rocket League wouldn't be something on that list.

review: 9.5/10+ Great optimization clean UI lots of car customization excellent post launch support. The best way to describe this game is to say it's pure and addictive fun. It's the prime example of a game that is easy to pick up but hard to master. I tend to play multiplayer games with my close group of friends and hate playing most solo this game is good enough to be one of the only exceptions to that habit. With no penalty for quitting unranked matches some one sided affairs can turn in to a revolving door of players coming and leaving. As with any game that has attained mass appeal it has its fair share of toxic players.

review: A friend of mine summed up Rocket League pretty well Easy to learn hard to master.Other than that what is there really to dissect? Two teams against each other you can go from 1v1 to 4v4. If you want some variation there's basketball hockey dropshot and rumble. Rounds take 5 minutes so this is a really great game to drop into really fast and then drop out. I've turned off the music in the game and then I put on some good old Judas Priest Yngwie Malmsteen and play for the duration of an album or so. Incredibly fun with friends and it also supports LAN.One of the most toxic communities I've experienced outside of Call of Duty. For newcomers Play with a joystick if possible. Leave your rank title on. The game takes a bit of time to learn. You will miss the ball a bunch of times but when you nail it it feels good. When you start scoring goals learning to fly that feels pretty good too.The game has loot boxes... and as always they ing suck. There's only two ways to get items in the game. Buy keys for crates. Or trade in 5 pieces of loot to some random crap. I've bought 5 keys once and never will again. As with all loot boxes you get So if there is a specific item you want for your cars (some cars only drop in crates as well...) then you're out luck. Go to a 3rd party site to trade or try your luck on the Steam forum.Linux port is not really up to snuff. AA does not work at all. There is a bug if you use keyboard/mouse where if you press left and right mouse (boost and jump) at the same time it looks backwards. So if you want to jump fast and boost then sometimes you're out of luck. Besides that performance is pretty good.
title: Rocket League®

review: a new season starts so it s a lot of crate hunters back again. People join games via script but don t play. leaving you 1v3 or 2v3 in every 3rd or 4th game atm.also a lot of salty people back making it hard to finish just one simple match. They rather threaten to find you kill you and your family or they start scoring own goals when they are trailing by 2 after 30 seconds.game still is a good fun if you turn off any chat or just play with your friends. But some people seem to be really depressive or somewhat mentally instable when they play RL.Maybe I m just too old for this behaviour maybe this behaviour gets you more viewers on Twitch... but sometimes it can be frustrating when you just wanna play and cannot finish one single game within an hour without heavy insults unsportsmanlike conducts or just idle players that just hunt crates.Update November 27th 2017 Still the saltiness is ruining the game. With the new update that punishes quitters more people start to go idle or just drive around in 3 out of 5 matches.Update May 5th 2018 played 5 games. First one opponent is idle/macro moving. Had to sit the entire game and wait. Second game was okay. Third game one guy kept shouting " ing retard" through the mic. Fourth game the opponent started typing "noob" every 10 seconds like with an automated macro. Fifth and last game opponent typed "idiot" after we were in the lead 3 1 and started shooting on own goal. Didn t wanna forfeit. When we were behind 3 4 he was idle until the end of the game.Since the implementation of the report system I only report drastic insults shooting own goals and beeing idle with a macro. Although there were even 3 death threads in chat only one single protest was cared of.

review: Fantastic game. I have recently hit 1000 hours and felt like it was time to give this a public thumbs up. The only time I have ever had an issue with this game was when the Aquadome arena released in October 2016. My PC at the time could not reliably load that map. Since then I gave the map a thumbs down in game so I rarely see it and I have also since upgraded my PC.Rocket League has infinite replayability online. I enjoy the all chat trash talk from time to time. I also enjoy being able to mute/report people that go too far in that regard. This game is not worth $ playing against the bots the bots are bad. Get good and play online you'll love it!

review: I love (and hate) this game so much that I have purchased it on every available platform. I play it on all 3 systems regularly depending on what piece of technology happens to be on at the time. The simplicity and complexity is what makes this 4 wheeled mayhem so much fun with a constant curve of learning new tricks and plays that keeps it so addicting to come back to. Even on the most frustrating days a 10 minute break is sufficient enough to get back into ramming balls and opponents to oblivion.The rocket pass is a nice addition for extra content and revenue oin their part. Just wished they gave more time to complete.

review: As an avid fan of an atmosphere enthralled with competition and packed with an indefinite supply of suspense and engagement I can confirm that the Rocket League title fulfills the natural tendency of our minds to wander into a world in which competitive superiority and progressive advancement yields satisfaction and promotes collaboration. Indeed after 896 hours of gameplay I have experienced exhilarating victory the product of numerous nail biting saves howling shots and graceful aerial goals of which solidify one's sense of freedom. From the novice ranks of Prospect boasting my innocence as a new player in the world of Rocket League to the evolution of skill and advancement in competition as was highlighted by my rise to the star ranks later known as Platinum and Diamond I enjoyed pondering upon the idea that I had an everlasting potential to improve and increase my rank. Watching the champions of Rocket League engage in fierce battle characterized by benevolent sportsmanship and advertised as a competition boasting a prize of thousands in dollars I came to recognize that this was the primary objective of ambitious players across the world a dream to reach the highest admired level in ESports. Indeed the ability to improve meet aspiring players who hold goals equivalent to the ones envisioned by you and I and share a common creed of bold individuals who crave to productively seek success is fostered in companionship and strengthened by a competitive purpose. Nevertheless maybe this far fetched idea this perception of mine held throughout my time in membership was a dream in itself. While it remains true and likely will remain so that those who cherish this game as a tool of ultimate action packed entertainment and a collaborative guide in developing friendship reap a profound satisfaction in a dignity reinforced with gameplay I have witnessed a converse dismal reality portrayed with only malice and a destructive urge to conquer everything except for this outlined positivity. From the punishingly immense insults reasoning my "weakminded sheep" like qualities to echoing curses which only obscure and suppress the chief objective of the game to gain entertainment and attain success it remains available for one to consider the personal benefits associated with gaining victory examined with the opposing toxicity which often effectively destroys self accomplishment and tears emotional stability. This consistent presence of ominous and dreadful affairs only weakens the foundation of an otherwise blissful and unified community and for me tarnishes the hope of reaching the nurturing community offered by established players such as Kronovi. As a result without a founded motive for playing Rocket League weakened and damaged by a socially degrading player base the act of uninstalling the game justifies my desire to maintain a pure lifestyle unbounded by corruption and malevolence. While I must append that the remediation offered by Psyonix and Rocket League representatives encourages an environment free from pollution and distressing insult it is up to the user as to whether or not these solutions are sufficient to present a desire to play in the otherwise well constructed framework that composes Rocket League.
title: Rocket League®

review: There are millions of reasons to buy and not to buy this game.+ Great customisation options+ Good ranking systems+ Great matchmaking+ Multiple gamemodes (so you're not just playing soccer for hours on end)+ Great times with friends+ Awesome communities+ Crate system (to waste all your money that you didn't buy the game with xD)Negatives Two maps may cause frame lag on stupidly bad computers You might not like soccer You will probably need a controller if you want to be any good at the gameAll in all buy the game if you like cars and sports and friends but I don't have friends so good luck with that me. 77 hours was all I needed to break challenger but I'm sure you can do it quicker.

review: My favorite game and there's no change in sight! Every day brings something new to the experience be it some awesome aerial plays or an insane shot off the wall. It's just a fantastic game. The best part is the matches are 5 only 5 10 minutes long! This game is perfect to put on while you're waiting something out just pop right in and you're right in the game. The developers work hard to being new and exciting maps and cars to the game the former for free the latter for a small not unreasonable charge. Definitely worth every penny and then some. And it's not even that many pennies either. At $20 this game has brought me longer enjoyment than any other $40 $60 game I've ver bought. 10/10 would (and do) definitely recommend to anyone and everyone.
title: Rocket League®

review: I can honestly say after hundred of hours playing this game Rocket League has only become more and more fun since the day I bought it. Car soccer is far too under rated and as someone who personally understands why alot of people don't see "esports" as a sport this game is by far the most viable game to receive the well deserved title of being an "esport". It's concepts are easy to understand yet hard to master which leaves lots of room for player improvement and improvisation. Would DEFINITELY recommend 10/10

The better I get at the game the more I realize not only how much I CAN improve but that I still Want to. Anyone with a love of both sports and video games should try Rocket League though getting hooked requires neither.

review: With over 2 000 Hours played on Xbox I still found myself compelled to repurchase the game for PC. With such fast and addictive gameplay compiled into short five minute matches it's a game that you'll literally be telling yourself "just five more minutes". The skill gap is surprisingly high for such a simple concept. Nearly every game you'll find someone doing something that you can't even comprehend how it could ever be done only to one day do it yourself and somehow still be downright astonished at the complexity of the moves you pull off. With surprising in depth customization that doesn't effect your stats the aspect of trading items can become a game in its own right. Whether or not you like soccer (or Football) the $20 price tag gives this game a very high enjoyment to price ratio.
title: Rocket League®

review: With all of the hundreds of thousands of video games out there eventually there was going to be a game that seemed to continually get everything right. That game is...Rocket LeagueThis is the game that keeps on giving. Psyonix seems to be incapable of making a wrong decision when it comes to this game. Everything is done so perfectly. Every texture model visual effect world sound clip... every last one was given extra care. It looks and feels real. Not just "Wow look at the shaders" real but like real real. I feel like I could jump into my monitor and drive that car. The physics of the game behave the way you expect physics to behave. Gravity works perfectly inertia feels real even lift and drag are life like. The ball reacts to your car like it should dropping onto it in midair with your wheels will be distinctly different in three ways from hitting it with the front of your car on the ground. It's so easy to explain the game Rocket League takes the basics of soccer (2 nets get a ball in the other team's net) changes the team size to 3 and replaces people with cars that have rockets. To power these rockets you have to collect boost. When a ball is 100% inside the net (no part of the ball is outside the volume of the net) it counts as a goal. That's basically the game right there and yet it's so much more complex than that. I can't tell you what to do from there because that's your playing style that adds complexity to it. Your strengths and weaknesses and the other player's strengths and weaknesses are what defines this game. The game allows you to create techniques that even the developers didn't think of the game doesn't bug out when presented with something entirely new. The updates... continue to only make the game better. Crates. In most video games crates are hated. Rocket League does it differently. For one you know exactly where your money goes RLCS (and other events) prize pools. Second you can't get a higher chance of getting an item by paying. Joe Average has the same chance of getting an Import Body out of a crate as a YouTuber does. If you don't like the item you can trade it and four others in for a better one. But it's all personal preference you may not want anything that the crates have to offer. The customization leaves you wanting more but in a good way you wish there was more stuff to customize even after customizing every little detail. Psyonix keeps adding more categories and items. Your playstyle works hand in hand with the car you chose each car is different with its strengths and weaknesses and after a while you'll find yourself mostly choosing one car. My personal car so far is the Vulcan. The DLC... you don't feel pressured into buying DLC in order to win. You get the DLC because you're having a blast with Rocket League and you want to try out those cars. I could go on and on and on. Pros10/10 game getting everything right. ConsOn lower spec computers it doesn't look all that great with all the visuals turned off but... what are you gonna do? You can only optimize a game so much without losing quality and gameplay.
title: Rocket League®

review: Let me start this review by saying that I fell in love with this game when it came out. I've spent 1 100 hours playing it and I don't regret one of those hours as this game brought me more enjoyment until the last day than most games ever bring me. However tonight I uninstalled Rocket League. Originally I gave this game a glowing review. It was a competitive game that literally anyone could pick up and play. I could play the casual modes with kids and the competitive modes with my friends. However the matchmaking has simply become too much for me. The games aren't even close to being fair in terms of balanced teams and Psyonix has implemented no way for us to review the quality of our matches. I honestly don't mind losing games in ranked play as long as they are close. However most of my recent games were complete blowouts despite my efforts to carry my teammates.
title: Rocket League®

review: I was hesitant to buy the game at 20 bucks but eventually decided I would give it a try. Now that I'm more than 550 hours in and currently in the top division I can definitely say that the game is worth it. It's great as a party/nooby game as its fun to pick up even when you aren't too good. And as the game is essentially entirely skill based there is a ton of room for growth and too see yourself improve.Added bonus Psyonix is awesome when it comes to communicating with the community. Also relative to other popular games and especially the higher up u get there is not very much toxicity. Not to say that there aren't people that just blame others and rage cause there are but relatively speaking there are less.If you have your doubts just watch a few ESL games or check out the following Youtube Amoney_tv Gibbs subparbutinhd kronovi paschy90 lachinio low5iveTwitch xRizzo00 Amoney_tv low5iveJust buy it!!!
title: Rocket League®

review: Be warned Rocket League is a very easy game to pick up and play for the first time. The gameplay is simple and intuitive. Anyone can jump in and have a good time. However this game is also extremely hard to master and can take hundreds and hundreds of hours to make minimal progress in terms of skill. Therefore any new players to the game might find themselves getting destroyed in online play with little to no hope of winning against more skilled opponents.That being said it is very much worth the time and effort required to learn the more advanced techniques required to be competative in this game. I for one am a person with a short attention span and find myself jumping from game to game playing 1 2 hours of this game then 2 3 hours of that game getting bored insanely fast. Rocket league is one of the only exceptions to this. I can find myself sinking 6 7 hours in one session and still wanting to play more. Well worth the price tag for fans of any genre. You simply cannot go wrong with this game if you are willing to put the time in.1000+ hours 2's and 3's ChampionTLDR There are very VERY few games I would give a 10/10. This is one of them.EDIT After some changes made to the game and the policies I can no longer recommend the game. Devs now ban people at the drop of a hat. Psyonix is anti free speech and hypocritical. They will ban you for saying things that are litterally put on banners that are thrown in peoples faces when you score a goal. The ranking system also is designed to keep you at your rank and it intentionally prevents you from ranking up. Win 3 games in a row? "**** you" pysonix says as they place you against people several ranks higher and with a teammate several ranks lower. But don't vent it out on your horrible teammate or you are going to get banned. Not worth your time if you are serious about games.
title: Rocket League®

review: The community and Psyonix is killing an otherwise amazing game.Casuals just become a revolving door once you go down goals due to no leaver penalties which means you're playing down a person or two constantly. You could just go for ranked but sometimes you just want to relax and have some fun and the community just won't allow any of that fun to happen.Pysonix keeps adding crates and other monetizational services when more time and money should be focused one fix the absolutely horrible server quality and adding in more updates not focused on crates and this idiotic rocket pass.I also personally think that getting rid of non standard maps makes the game worse and less enjoyable while making the game even more repetitive so thanks for getting rid of all of the actual fun maps from the playlists. The game needs some kind of priority matchmaking for placing premades and premades because as a solo only player i absolutely despise playing against premades that can communicate and rotate better than me and 2 randoms. I also think there needs to be ranked restrictions for who you can queue with in ranked. Players in placements shouldn't affect the mmr of anyone that play with in ranked also unless their previous season mmr HEAVILY outweighs the rest of the group.Until the Psyonix can get their collective heads out of their asses i don't think the game is even worth the meager amount it costs. Take you money and go buy something that isn't being stuffed into a coffin by its developer.Also let's not forget the smurfs and boosters that plague higher mmrs of this game.

review: I just hit 420 hours in this game. So I thought I'd write something about this game.So FIRST OFF Before you buy this game!This game is one of a kind. An idea that sounds awesome to everyone. It is an awesome idea. The gameplay behind this idea is tough for new players to understand. There is a huge skill gap between new players and players who have about 200+ hours in the game and continue to practice to become better. This wouldn't be such a problem if the community that surrounds this game wasn't completely toxic. I am not saying all the players in this game are toxic but some sadly are... This game can be particularly scary for a new player they will likely get harassed in casual games a lot. Because of this I always tell new players. just play competitive as a noob you will be much better off there. Because in some cases the new player will be able to play against other new players.Unfortunatly Not all new players are told this. So they get cursed out in a casual lobby and never want to play the game again.The second issue I have with this game Is lag and ping. I run Netgears Orbi and I have no problems. My team they have bad internet all the time. This game takes up a huge amount of bandwidth. Without the propper internet speeds you will get lag and ghost hits all the time. All of this info comes straight from my friends they till me its the only reason they hate this game.Other than the issues. The game is my favorite. One of the best games to watch at an esports competition.I am addicted to the gameplay. I am loving the content. Psyonix is a very fair company. I feel they run this game the way it should be and they have built up a swell community around it.

review: This is the "sequel" to the awesome Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars from the PS3 in 2008. SARPBC was the best game that came out that year (I am fully aware that GTA IV came out in 2008). I put "sequel" in quotes because it's largely the same game with new trimmings. However that is not an insult. It means that Psyonix know how good their game is and not to break something that's already gameplay perfection.It is hard (or impossible) to overstate how much fun this game is because you get no assistance from the computer. Everything you get in this game is earned through skill. Lucky shots exist but you'll find that the only way to perform consistently is to master control of your car and collisions with the ball.There are only minor differences between the myriad cars you see in the screenshots so everything comes down to player skill not choice of car. "Play balance" isn't something we have to worry about here.After over 100 hours with this title I can say they have done the original game great justice and created something that will last for many years to come. It only gets to be more fun as you get better at it.

You can hit a ball dead on and it goes off on the most ridiculous angles ever and then you can hit it at ridiculous angles and it goes straight. review: There is truly no other game like Rocket League in the world. It is often said that this game feels more like a true sports game than video games created based on real life sports. This is due mainly to it being entirely physics based. The ball bounces off of your car differently based on how fast you are moving relative to the ball the angle of your car what part of the ball you hit and many other factors. You practice shooting the ball just as you would any real life sport. It requires timing finesse and muscle memory to pull off shots well.Your car has several abilities including jumping boosting and dodging. Jumping and boosting allows you to fly through the air to hit the ball. Dodging allows you to perform front/back flips diagonal flips and barrel rolls to move around the field faster and hit the ball with more power. These are all accomplished entirely by applying physical forces on the car rather than by animation. As an unintended concequence of the physically based nature of the game new mechanics are always being discovered that continue to raise the skill ceiling. Just one example of such a mechanic this is the wave dash. A wave dash is acheived by dodging in such a way that the wheels slam into the ground transferring the rotational torque of the dodge into linear momentum giving you an instant boost of speed.Aside from the mechanics of the game there is also a huge strategy component to it as well. Positioning yourself correctly based on the positioning of your teammates and your opponents is very important. Being in the wrong place at the wrong time can result in you conceding a goal. If you give your opponent too much space they can utilize that space to wind up for a powerful shot on your goal. At higher ranks players begin to anticipate when you'll hit the ball and will jump early to intercept the ball. You can exploit this by feinting a touch sending them flying past you and leaving their goal open for a free shot.With all that said the game does suffer from server issues and the community is known for being very toxic.
title: Rocket League®

review: After 180 hours in this game I have to say something to warn everyone. Yes the game seems fun and relaxing but from the point where you learn the basics you will suck until youre a pro and even then can happen thats just as . Also even if you have a good internet connection don't expect to get a good server with a good ping. Yes they exist but mostly you will get either servers with t ping or enemies/mates with t ping and ping means so much in this game. And now (maybe its only me) the game crashed 4 times in 4 days 2 minutes after i started the game. WTF? Just don't get it if you have anxiety or any else psychological problems. And if you don't have them Congrats! Play for 50 hours and you will get them! Don't get me wrong the game can be fun yes. But the times you rage because of the enemies luck your unluck or the t ping aren't worth it.
title: Rocket League®

review: I like this games potential. But there are many problmes. As a consistent top 3.5% I dont understand the demo system I get demolished by getting tapped yet when i go full speed into a car staying still nothing happens or even a few times Im the one getting bumped. The physics engine still needs some fine tuning. the devs would rather add new crates and items to make more money than fix these minor problems. Dislike/Like system is still broken. Servers cause lag ONLY on this game. I can play other games and will play fine. Smurfs and trolls are very common (Not as much in my lvl). Ok time for a positive part You now get automatically banned for saying offensive words! Im glad to see this chat being cleansed of filth! This new system is so strict it wont even tell you what they consider "offensive" so you get banned from playing the game for almost no reason! Glad they added this cool little feature ) /Love the game but until some of these issues are fixed its a non recommended game.

review: Great game takes a long time to get the basics down (rotation ball control aerials dribbling positioning taking shots on net defense etc.)Currently Diamond 2/ Diamond 3 as my highest ranks and its very difficult to find things I DON'T love about this game. Consistent updates every two ish months give or take of course. Been playing since 2015 and I still love this game like its the first time I played. If you're considering purchasing this game just give it a shot you have two hours to see if its a concept you really like or not. I can say that it will probably take around 15 to 20 hours to really tell if you like the concept. The controls will feel awkward at first for sure but it comes with time. Any game nowadays has a learning curve and this one is constantly challenging and rewarding to learn something new.

review: "Going along playing some Rocket League when all of a sudden I come across a team that was easy to beat. They started to get steamsalty and demanded a rematch. Scored 12 seconds in. They ragequit. 10/10 would rematch again.But seriously this game is great. It is easily a must have in your library if you like a) having fun b) rc cars c) soccer d) crashing randomly and flying around an rc soccer arena. If you like any of those things you will definitely love this game. It is honest worth way more than the 20 dollar asking price on it. 10/10 game."The above was posted when the game was new and it felt fun and refreshing. Nowadays the only way to enjoy the game or to have a chance at having fun with it is to play the game and train to get to be the best. The fun game modes are only populated with people who spend entirely too much time in the game and even the "different game modes" (hoops snow day and rumble) are populated with people who do nothing but waste their lives on the game. I really don't see how a game with this sort of learning curve for something so simple can be enjoyable to a casual player which is why I'm changing the review to negative. Even playing the fun game modes listed above has too long of a queue for very little or no fun involved whatsoever. The game used to feel fun when no one knew what they were doing but now all the game has devolved into is aerials and flashy plays that put a casual player like myself at a huge disadvantage.Uninstalled and never to be installed again. Cya rocket league. Update Still do not regret writing this.

Nothing feels better then hitting that aerial goal.The competative in this game can get INTENSE. matchups seem to always be against people at or above your skill. Grab a couple of friends sit down and have a blast.there's only one downside to this game. the cancerous community. that's all hahaha.

title: Rocket League®

review: When I can't decide what else to play I play Rocket League. I have played more than my fair share of great games but their appeal inevitably fades. From RPGs racing sims action adventures puzzlers MMOs...eventually my time with them passes. But not Rocket League. The gameplay is about as perfect as you will find in any game. So simple to learn and understand and yet somehow incredibly deep once you play around and experiment with it. The huge range of skill levels amazes me even after the 1000+ hours I've sank into it whilst I could now run circles around 'old me' from back when I began playing I still encounter countless players who end up doing just that to me today. The drive to keep competing and improving my game is always there.I honestly struggle to imagine a time to come where I will stop playing and enjoying Rocket League. The key word being 'enjoy' because it is just such a fundamentally fun game that I would recommend to any gamer.
title: Rocket League®

review: Every time you get on the game gets even better because you are able to do new things like airials. After countless hours on the game and even after finishing all of the acheivements and grand champ being achieved this game has never seemed old to me. I recommend if both for casual and serious play. The community is great (with few exceptions) and new things are being added all the time. Both playing and trading up to that item that you wanted for so long has helped this game be able to pull off such a weird idea and make it into one of the top selling games.

review: Rocket league is a game like no other it introduced us to the idea of goddamn cars playing football.The game was made perfectly as the systems of boost allows you to fly and get into situations pretty quick instead of slow driving all the time this made the game really dynamic and a lot of people seemed to like that idea as the game got really popular and a lot of people still play it till this day.The graphics for such a game are also amazing better than some of the modern games to be honest new maps and cars are introduced every once in a while theres also a lot of items in the game that can let you customize your car however you want it to be colorful? sure! edgy? sure! random sure! you know.I honestly never played the ranked system in the gaem as i only wanted to play it for fun with friends instead of gettings competetive the game was such an amazing expierience in my opinion.

review: While the game itself is nice and deserves recommendation if you want to play it occasionally and mess around I cannot recommend it because of the developers. They lack creativity in everything besides adding more cosmetics. You can spend a lot of time learning the mechanics and stuff but in the end the game doesn't evolve. To make the matters worse community can be pretty toxic at times.

review: Product received for free. This is a very good game. The graphics are nice the physics are great but some of the maps just don't work well on all computers. Also sometimes (more often than you think) the matchmaking is unfair. For example 2 people in silver 1 going against 2 people in silver 3 (2 ranks up). The worst part about this game is its community. Whatever you do do not solo queue. There are many people that will cuss you out and I've asked my teammates if they could do one thing (For example please rotate behind me so we can 2v1 the guy) and they would report me for being toxic cuss me out and stop playing (or purposely own goal). Also doing 1v1 is very stressing as well bc people will try tactics to get you and the problem even if you report them they won't get banned bc they're doing it within the terms of service. They use quickchat demo or use curse words that aren't regulated for bans. Overall it's a really addicting game just don't play alone or you will end up getting really mad.
title: Rocket League®
